助记符

Mnemonology

认知心理学论文集

ESSAYS IN COGNITIVE PSYCHOLOGY

北美编辑：

North American Editors:

亨利·L·罗迪格三世，圣路易斯华盛顿大学

Henry L. Roediger, III, Washington University in St. Louis

詹姆斯·R·波默兰茨，莱斯大学

James R. Pomerantz, Rice University

欧洲编辑：

European Editors:

艾伦·D·巴德利，约克大学

Alan D. Baddeley, University of York

Vicki Bruce，爱丁堡大学

Vicki Bruce, University of Edinburgh

乔纳森·格兰杰， 普罗旺斯大学

Jonathan Grainger, Université de Provence

《认知心理学论文集》旨在满足快速出版认知心理学短篇丛书的需求。主要主题包括感知、运动和行动、注意力、记忆、心理表征、语言和问题解决。此外，本系列丛书力求以最广义的方式定义认知心理学，涵盖所有与心理过程研究相关或与之相关的主题。因此，它涵盖了广泛的学科，包括认知的计算方法、认知神经科学、社会认知和认知发展，以及传统上被定义为认知心理学的领域。本系列的每一卷都将通过回顾和综合现有研究文献、推进该领域的理论或将上述任务结合起来，为该主题做出概念性贡献。其主要目的是让作者概述他们在某个领域非常成功的研究项目。此外，预计每卷丛书将在一定程度上包含对现有知识的评估以及对未来研究趋势的预测。每本书都是一个独立的单元，为高级读者提供对所描述和评估的作品的结构良好的评论。

Essays in Cognitive Psychology is designed to meet the need for rapid publication of brief volumes in cognitive psychology. Primary topics will include perception, movement and action, attention, memory, mental representation, language and problem solving. Furthermore, the series seeks to define cognitive psychology in its broadest sense, encompassing all topics either informed by, or informing, the study of mental processes. As such, it covers a wide range of subjects including computational approaches to cognition, cognitive neuroscience, social cognition, and cognitive development, as well as areas more traditionally defined as cognitive psychology. Each volume in the series will make a conceptual contribution to the topic by reviewing and synthesizing the existing research literature, by advancing theory in the area, or by some combination of these missions. The principal aim is that authors will provide an overview of their own highly successful research program in an area. It is also expected that volumes will, to some extent, include an assessment of current knowledge and identification of possible future trends in research. Each book will be a self-contained unit supplying the advanced reader with a well-structured review of the work described and evaluated.

Mnemonology

前言

PREFACE

心理学教授和教师对记忆术这个话题感到不安的情况并不少见。心理学导论课程和一些认知心理学课程对记忆术的覆盖通常被认为是一种有些过时的传统。此外，即使是那些接受传统优点的人也倾向于怀疑记忆术和记忆术教学的整体效用。随着时间的推移，记忆术的定义变得狭窄，人们对这个话题缺乏热情，似乎把这门古老的艺术降级为历史好奇心。结果，在过去的二十年里，记忆术在实证心理学中被搁置了​​。我们希望这本书能够通过展示这个话题对心理学研究人员、教育工作者和心理学学生来说仍然是一个富有成果的领域，从而重新激发人们对记忆术的兴趣。

It is not uncommon for professors and teachers of psychology to approach the topic of mnemonics with uneasiness. Coverage of mnemonics in introductory psychology courses and some courses in cognitive psychology is often considered a somewhat outdated tradition. Moreover, even those who accept the merit of tradition tend to be skeptical about the overall utility of mnemonics and mnemonic instruction. Over the course of time, the definition of mnemonics has become narrow, and a lack of enthusiasm in the topic seems to have relegated this ancient art to the rank of a historical curiosity. As a result, mnemonics has been placed on the back burner of empirical psychology in the past two decades. It is our hope that this book revives interest in mnemonics by showing that the topic remains fertile for psychological researchers, educators, and students of psychology.

我们非常感谢 Roddy Roediger 提出这个项目并对其发展提供的建议。Russell Carney 通读了整部手稿，并提出了建设性的意见，使最终版本更加完善，另外两位匿名审稿人也做出了贡献。心理学出版社的 Paul Dukes 和 Stephanie Drew 为作者提供了所有必要的支持和鼓励。他们的努力对本书的完成起到了至关重要的作用。

We are grateful to Roddy Roediger for suggesting this project and for advice on its development. Russell Carney read the entire manuscript and offered constructive comments that improved the final version, as did two other anonymous reviewers. Paul Dukes and Stephanie Drew at Psychology Press provided all of the support and encouragement an author could want. Their efforts were invaluable in seeing the book to completion.

1

摄氏度哈一个磷T埃R		 



助记符在现代心理学中有一席之地吗？

Is There a Place for Mnemonics

in Modern Psychology?

助记符是一项奇特的发明。迄今为止，还没有任何其他发明，其唯一目的是为了支持一种自然的心理过程，而这种过程本身就以其自然的形式完美地运作着。这种心理过程当然就是记忆。

Mnemonics is a peculiar invention. No other artifact has been created for the sole purpose of supporting a natural psychological process that already is functioning perfectly in its natural form. The psychological process of course is memory.

助记符的存在本身就证明了记忆在人类无数活动中的核心重要性。然而，与之微妙矛盾的是，助记符的诞生也暴露出一种观念，即自然进化的生物/心理记忆过程不足以完成许多此类活动。为了弥补自然记忆过程中的这种缺陷，我们发明了一种神器：助记符技巧。

The very existence of mnemonics is a testament to the central importance of memory for myriad human endeavors, but, in a subtle contradiction, the creation of mnemonics exposes a belief that the naturally evolved, bio/psychological process of memory is inadequate to accomplish many of these activities. To compensate for the perceived deficiency in the natural process, we invented an artifact: mnemonic techniques.

助记符的开发和使用有着悠久的历史。在这段时间里，人们设计出了许多具体的技术，其中一些技术已被证明或多或少令人信服，堪称真正的记忆假体。鉴于大多数人似乎认为自己的记忆力不如自己所愿，人们或许可以预期，人们对助记符的教育和热情将更加广泛。虽然历史上也曾有过这样的时期，但如今并非如此。为什么呢？本章将简要回顾助记符发展历史的亮点，并探讨这个问题。

The development and use of mnemonic devices have a very long history. Over this time frame, many specific techniques have been devised, and in some subset of those, their effectiveness has been documented, more or less convincingly, as bona fide memory prostheses. Given that most people seem to believe that their memory is not as good as they would like for it to be, one might expect widespread education about and enthusiasm for mnemonics. Although there have been periods in history when such was the case, today is not one of them. Why not? This is a question that we shall pursue in this chapter as we briefly trace highlights of the history of mnemonics.

正如我们将看到的，几个世纪以来，人们对记忆术的热情一直呈周期性波动。正式设计的系统可能非常复杂，而且一直被视为人工的。人们对记忆术使用的看法，随着人们对人工技术与自然记忆之间关系的看法而变化。虽然从未明确定义，但自然记忆在历史上被认为是自然的记忆过程，有时被描述为上帝赋予的，无需人工干预即可运作。干预（Yates，1966）。对记忆术的正面看法是，它是一种为自然记忆过程创造助手的艺术。而负面看法则认为，它不过是一套花招，充其量只是噱头，更糟的是，它干扰了自然记忆过程。在本章历史叙述的最后，我们将直面这种矛盾，并提出一种现代的调和方法，将记忆的艺术纳入记忆科学的主流。

As we shall see, enthusiasm for mnemonics has been cyclical for centuries now. The formally devised systems can be elaborate and complex and have always been viewed as artificial. Sentiment concerning the use of mnemonics varies with the perceived relationship between the artificial techniques and natural memory. Although never clearly defined, natural memory was historically taken to be the natural processes of memory, sometimes described as God given, that operate without artifactual intervention (Yates, 1966). The positive view of mnemonics is of an art that created an assistant to the natural memory processes. The negative view is of a set of tricks that at best produces gimmickry and at worse interference with the natural processes. At the end of the historical account in this chapter, we shall directly confront this tension and propose a modern reconciliation that will bring the art of memory into the mainstream of memory science.

□助记符使用的首次记录

□ First Records of Mnemonic Use

自从人类在地球上定居以来，就很可能一直依赖并试图改善记忆力。早期的狩猎采集社会会利用记忆力来了解一年中不同时间猎物和其他饲料的位置。事实上，考古证据表明，外部记忆法最早出现在28000年前（D'Errico，2001）。外部记忆法是放置在环境中的线索，用于改善记忆力。现代外部记忆法的例子包括在纸上写下提醒或在日历上圈出日期。有证据表明，在旧石器时代晚期，原始人类会在木头和骨头上刻上刻痕，以记录周期性事件的累积信息（Wynn & Coolidge，2003）。虽然记录的具体事件尚不清楚，但不难接受这样一种可能性：这些原始记忆法的使用方式与现代猎人参考日历或阳历表来确定猎物的地点和时间非常相似。例如，原始猎人可能绘制了动物迁徙的周期，并利用这些记录来提醒自己寻找季节性食物来源。无论如何，值得注意的是，这些原始的外部记忆术被认为具有与现代外部记忆术相同的功能：减少工作记忆负荷，并最大限度地减少对长期存储和检索的依赖（Wynn & Coolidge，2003）。外部记忆术的现代应用将在第二章讨论。

As long as humans have inhabited the earth, it is likely that there has been reliance on and attempts to improve memory. Early hunter-gatherer societies would have used memory to know where game and other forage could be located at different times of year, and, in fact, archaeological evidence suggests that external mnemonics were first used 28,000 years ago (D’Errico, 2001). External mnemonics are cues placed in the environment in order to improve memory. Modern examples of external mnemonics include writing a reminder on paper or circling a date on a calendar. Evidence suggests that during the Upper Paleolithic period, primitive humans marked wood and bones with notches to keep cumulative records of cyclical events (Wynn & Coolidge, 2003). Although the specific events being recorded are not known, it is not difficult to accept the possibility that these primitive mnemonics were used much like a modern hunter might refer to a calendar or solunar tables to determine where and when to locate wild game. For example, primitive hunters may have charted cycles of animal migration and used the records as reminders of where to locate seasonal food sources. In any event, it is interesting to note that these primitive external mnemonics are believed to have served the same functions that modern-day external mnemonics serve: to reduce working-memory load and to minimize dependence on long-term storage and retrieval (Wynn & Coolidge, 2003). Modern use of external mnemonics will be discussed in Chapter 2.

□内部记忆法和口头文化

□ Internal Mnemonics and Oral Culture

内部助记符是一种旨在增强信息编码（初始处理）的认知策略。如果助记符成功地增强了编码，那么理论上它也应该有助于信息的存储和检索。因此，人们可以将内部助记符视为一种用于准备待记忆信息的策略。这样它就可以正确地归档在内存中，并在需要时轻松访问。

An internal mnemonic is a cognitive strategy designed to enhance the encoding (initial processing) of information. If a mnemonic successfully enhances encoding, then, in theory, it should also facilitate the storage and retrieval of the information. As such, one might view an internal mnemonic as a strategy that serves to prepare to-be-remembered information such that it can be properly filed away in memory and thus easily accessed when needed.

社会心理过程的演变，尤其是语言和交流，需要对细节的记忆，而这是生物进化所不具备的（德·夏尔丹，1959）。早期口头传统对再生记忆的要求已得到充分证实（例如，鲁宾，1995；耶茨，1966），由于自然记忆尚未进化出这种功能，因此需要人工支持自然过程来发展和维持口头体裁。如果没有广泛的识字能力，外部记忆术将无法满足新的记忆需求。发展支持此类记忆的认知策略，是满足新的社会文化需求的重要心理适应。

The evolution of psychosocial processes, especially language and communication, required memory for detail that biological evolution had not (de Chardin, 1959). The demands that early oral traditions placed on reproductive memory are well documented (e.g., Rubin, 1995; Yates, 1966), and because natural memory had not evolved for such purposes, artificial support for the natural processes was required to develop and maintain oral genres. In the absence of widespread literacy, external mnemonics would have been unavailable for the new demands on memory. Development of cognitive strategies to support such memory constitutes an important psychological adaptation to meet the new sociocultural demands.

如下文所述，内部记忆法在具有浓厚口头传统的古代文化中确实普遍存在。事实上，至少有一种主要的口述文化理论（Ong，2002）将记忆法的使用视为口头文化的典型特征之一。在古代演说家使用的内部记忆法中，视觉心理意象是主导主题。

As documented below, the use of internal mnemonics indeed was ubiquitous in ancient cultures with strong oral traditions. In fact, at least one major theory of orality (Ong, 2002) includes the use of mnemonics as one of the defining characteristics of oral culture. Among the internal mnemonics used by ancient orators, visual mental imagery was a dominant theme.

早期使用基于意象的助记符的一个例子可以在马库斯·图留斯·西塞罗的《雄辩家论》中找到，该书写于公元前 55 年（Yates，1966 年）。在《雄辩家论》中，西塞罗讲述了塞奥斯的西蒙尼德斯（公元前 556 年-公元前 448 年）的故事，他被雇来在庆祝主人在战车比赛中获胜的庆祝活动中朗诵一首抒情诗。在西蒙尼德斯的朗诵过程中，主人觉得他对神话人物卡斯托耳和波鲁克斯的过度赞美感到生气。结果，主人只付给西蒙尼德斯约定金额的一半，并建议西蒙尼德斯让卡斯托耳和波鲁克斯支付剩余的费用。与主人对峙后不久，西蒙尼德斯被两位客人叫出了宴会厅。西蒙尼德斯离开宴会厅后，屋顶塌陷，主人和所有客人都丧生。随后人们得知，想要与西蒙尼德斯交谈的来者是卡斯托耳和波鲁克斯，他们是来救西蒙尼德斯的命的。后来，在从灾难现场打捞尸体时，人们发现尸体毁容严重，无法辨认。然而，西蒙尼德斯能够回忆起每位客人在宴会厅中所坐的位置，从而能够辨认出每具尸体。在此经验的基础上，西蒙尼德斯开发了一套记忆系统，该系统首先是在脑海中形成一个熟悉地方的图像（Yarmey，1984）。然后，通过有序的排列，人们在脑海中将需要记住的物品放置在想象中的熟悉地点的各个位置。在回忆的时候，人们只需重新回到想象中的熟悉地点，并提取需要记住的物品。如第 4 章所示，这种记忆技巧现在被称为位置法，至今仍在使用。

An example of the early use of an imagery-based mnemonic is found in Marcus Tullius Cicero’s De Oratore, which was written in 55 BC (Yates, 1966). In De Oratore, Cicero conveys the story of Simonides of Ceos (556 BC–448 BC) who was hired to deliver a lyric poem as part of a celebration honoring the host’s victory in chariot race. Over the course of Simonides’ performance, the host became offended by what he perceived to be excessive praise of the mythological figures Castor and Pollux. As a result, the host paid Simonides only half of the amount agreed upon and suggested that Simonides have Castor and Pollux pay the remainder of the fee. Soon after the confrontation with the host, Simonides was called out of the banquet hall by a pair of visitors. After Simonides left the banquet hall, the roof collapsed inside, killing the host and all of his guests. It was then revealed that the visitors wishing to speak with Simonides were Castor and Pollux, who had arrived to save his life. Later, while recovering the bodies from the disaster site, people determined that the bodies were too disfigured to be identified. However, Simonides was able to recall the location at which each guest was sitting in the banquet hall and thus was able to identify each corpse. On the basis of this experience, Simonides developed a mnemonic system that first involves forming a mental image of a familiar place (Yarmey, 1984). Then, using an ordered arrangement, one mentally places to-be-remembered items in various locations of the imagined familiar place. At the time of recall, one simply revisits the imagined familiar place and retrieves the to-beremembered items. As will be shown in Chapter 4, this mnemonic technique is now known as the method of loci and is still used today.

古希腊和古罗马的演说家也提倡利用奇异的心理意象来增强记忆。现存最古老的拉丁文本修辞学（Rhetorica Ad Herennium）提供了大量关于演讲记忆指导的论述。该指导的核心论点是，将幽默或滑稽的图像与待记忆信息联系起来，将最大限度地提高从记忆中检索该信息的可能性（Yates，1966）。值得注意的是，使用奇异意象是现代记忆和认知心理学文献中倡导的几种记忆技巧的组成部分。关于奇异意象记忆有效性的现代研究将在第3章讨论。

Ancient Greek and Roman orators also advocated the use of bizarre mental imagery to enhance memory. The oldest surviving Latin text on rhetoric (Rhetorica Ad Herennium) provides a good deal of discourse devoted to instruction on the memorization of speeches. A centerpiece of that instruction is the argument that construction of humorous or ridiculous images in association with to-be-remembered information will maximize the likelihood of retrieving that information from memory (Yates, 1966). It is interesting to note that the use of bizarre imagery is a component of several mnemonic techniques advocated in modern texts on memory and cognitive psychology. Modern research on the mnemonic effectiveness of bizarre imagery will be discussed in Chapter 3.

□中世纪

□ The Middle Ages

记忆策略的广泛使用一直延续到中世纪。在此期间，良好的记忆力备受推崇，记忆训练是教育体系中不可或缺的一部分（Carruthers，1990）。此外，据信当时的律师使用各种记忆技巧将整套法律和法典牢记于心（Fentress & Wickham，1992）。Carruthers（2002）提供的关于圣维克多的休所倡导的记忆技巧的翻译尤其引人入胜。与他的前辈一样，圣维克多的休也大力提倡使用心理意象来增强记忆。然而，圣维克多的休教学中最显著的特点是强调对待记忆信息的组织。具体来说，他以货币兑换商的细致组织能力为例，后者能够迅速而毫不犹豫地从装有各种硬币的袋子中取出相应的硬币。有人提出，需要记忆的信息也应该以类似的方式组织起来。通过严谨的心理组织，需要记忆的信息会被存储在记忆中的“不同位置”，从而免受干扰并易于检索。虽然古代演说家使用的记忆点法（loci method）能够将信息有序地排列在心理意象中，但圣维克多·休（Hugh of St. Victor）的系统似乎与现代组织记忆技巧（例如分类法和图式组织）更为密切相关。现代组织技巧将在第五章讨论。

The heavy use of mnemonic strategies continued through the Middle Ages. During this time, good memory was highly revered, and mnemonic training was an integral part of the educational system (Carruthers, 1990). Moreover, it is believed that lawyers of this time committed entire sets of laws and codes to memory using a variety of mnemonic techniques (Fentress & Wickham, 1992). Particularly interesting is a translation of the mnemonic techniques advocated by Hugh of St. Victor provided by Carruthers (2002). Like his predecessors, Hugh of St. Victor strongly advocated the use of mental imagery to enhance memory. However, the most striking characteristic of Hugh of St. Victor’s instruction is the emphasis that was placed on the organization of to-be-remembered information. Specifically, he used the analogy of the meticulous organization of a money changer who could quickly and without hesitation retrieve the appropriate coins from a pouch that contained numerous coins of different types. It was suggested that information to be remembered should be organized similarly. With rigorous mental organization, the to-be-remembered information would be stored in “distinct locations” in memory and would thus be immune from interference and easily retrieved. Although the method of loci used by ancient orators provided an ordered placement of information within a mental image, Hugh of St. Victor’s system appears to be more strongly related to modern organizational mnemonic techniques such as categorical and schematic organization. Modern organizational techniques will be discussed in Chapter 5.

与更为局限的记忆法（loci method）相比，强调组织性记忆法似乎是中世纪的一种趋势。根据 Carruthers (1990) 的研究，记忆法在公元一世纪至十二世纪之间逐渐失宠，因为当时它被认为是一种噱头。取而代之的是诸如押韵之类的记忆技巧。Carruthers 对约翰·奥古斯丁（John Ougustin）倡导的一种基于押韵的记忆技巧的描述尤其令人感兴趣。加兰。加兰的约翰建议，应该利用陌生术语和熟悉术语之间的发音相似性来增强对陌生术语含义的记忆。这种方法与现代用于增强二语习得的关键词法非常相似。关键词法将在第四章讨论。

The emphasis on organizational mnemonics as opposed to the more circumscribed method of loci appears to have been a trend in the Middle Ages. According to Carruthers (1990), the method of loci fell out of favor between the first and 12th centuries as it was considered somewhat of a gimmick during that time. In its place, mnemonic techniques such as the use of rhymes began to emerge. Of particular interest is Carruthers’s description of a rhyme-based mnemonic technique advocated by John of Garland. John of Garland suggested that one should make use of similarities between the sounds of unfamiliar and familiar terms in order to enhance memory for the meaning of the unfamiliar terms. This technique is very similar to the modern keyword method that is used to enhance second-language acquisition. The keyword method will be discussed in Chapter 4.

在整个中世纪，使用怪诞意象作为记忆法的风潮一直盛行。Carruthers (1990) 在描述托马斯·布拉德沃丁（约 1290-1349 年）提出的记忆黄道十二宫符号的系统时，阐明了这一点。布拉德沃丁建议，每个黄道十二宫符号都应该通过互动意象与相邻的符号联系起来。例如，狮子座、处女座、天秤座和天蝎座通过一幅图像联系起来：一头血淋淋的狮子（狮子座）正在攻击一位美丽的少女（处女座），而少女的手臂因被蝎子（天蝎座）螫伤而肿胀不堪，而少女则正将蝎子（天蝎座）放在天秤上保持平衡。卡拉瑟斯指出，布拉德沃丁提出的所有意象都极其极端，而这种极端“符合记忆意象的一个基本原则，即不寻常的事物比常规的事物更容易被记住”（卡拉瑟斯，1990，第134页）。这清楚地表明，在中世纪，怪诞是记忆意象的常态。还值得注意的是，布拉德沃丁的系统与现代的故事连接法有着惊人的相似之处，后者将在第五章中讨论。

The advocacy of bizarre imagery as a mnemonic remained strong throughout the Middle Ages. Carruthers (1990) illustrated this point in her description of the system offered by Thomas Bradwardine (c. 1290– 1349) to memorize the signs of the zodiac. Bradwardine suggested that each symbol of the zodiac should be connected to an adjacent symbol via interactive imagery. For example, Leo, Virgo, Libra, and Scorpio were associated by an image consisting of a bloodied lion (Leo) attacking a beautiful maiden (Virgo) whose arm is extremely swollen from the sting of a scorpion (Scorpio) that the maiden is balancing on her scales (Libra). Carruthers noted that all of Bradwardine’s suggested imagery was extreme and that this extremity was “in conformity with a basic principle for memory images, namely, that what is unusual is more memorable than what is routine” (Carruthers, 1990, p. 134). This clearly suggests that bizarreness was the norm for mnemonic imagery in the Middle Ages. It should also be noted that Bradwardine’s system bares a striking resemblance to the modern linking-by-story method, which will be discussed in Chapter 5.

□文艺复兴

□ The Renaissance

人们普遍认为，位置记忆法在文艺复兴时期重新出现，成为一种具有根本重要性的记忆术（Carruthers，1990；Engel，1991）。鉴于对古代文献的引用通常被认为是文艺复兴的标志，一些最早的记忆术在此期间重新出现也就不足为奇了。然而，令人惊讶的是，一些思想家甚至没有意识到位置记忆法在古代文献中已被广泛提及，他们独立地得出了该方法的基本原理（Engel，1991）。这可能部分归因于一种思想氛围，这种氛围使得所有记忆术比以前更普遍地被接受。此外，人文主义对心智能力的重视可能也激发了人们对记忆术主题的更多思考（Carruthers，1990）。

It is widely believed that the method of loci reemerged as a fundamentally important mnemonic during the Renaissance (Carruthers, 1990; Engel, 1991). Given that reference to ancient texts is generally considered a hallmark of the Renaissance, it is not particularly surprising that some of the earliest mnemonics reappeared during this period. However, what is striking is that some thinkers who were not even aware that the method of loci had been covered extensively in ancient texts arrived at the basic principles of the method independently (Engel, 1991). This may have been due in part to an intellectual climate that allowed for a more general acceptance of all mnemonic techniques than had existed previously. Moreover, the humanistic emphasis on mental capabilities may have also spurred additional intellectual thought on the topic of mnemonics (Carruthers, 1990).

尽管在文艺复兴时期，记忆术的使用被普遍接受，但英国清教徒对基于意象的记忆术提出了质疑（Couliano，1987）。清教徒认为基于意象的记忆术是盲目的，这种记忆术常常引发怪异的意象。记忆术是淫秽的。这场争论的焦点是亚历山大·迪克森和威廉·珀金斯。迪克森是乔达诺·布鲁诺记忆术系统的学生，该系统是位置记忆法的一种变体。布鲁诺的系统大量使用心理意象，与赫尔墨斯神秘主义有关（Yates，1966）。珀金斯是一位神学家和清教徒领袖，他提倡彼得·拉姆斯的组织记忆术。因此，迪克森和珀金斯之间的争论既关乎宗教，也关乎记忆术。具体而言，在珀金斯的带领下，清教徒将基于意象的记忆术与神秘学以及天主教会联系在一起（Couliano，1987）。清教徒提出了与他们针对天主教会崇敬圣徒的论点类似的论点，他们认为使用心理意象等同于异端，因为它反映了一种偶像崇拜。此外，清教徒尤其反对布鲁诺的助记系统中使用黄道十二宫符号（Yates，1966）。

Although the use of mnemonics was generally accepted during the Renaissance, English Puritans took issue with imagery-based mnemonics (Couliano, 1987). The Puritans believed that imagery-based mnemonics were idolatrous and that the bizarre imagery often elicited by such techniques was obscene. At the center of this controversy were Alexander Dicson and William Perkins. Dicson was a student of Giordano Bruno’s mnemonic system, which was a variation of the method of loci. Bruno’s system involved heavy use of mental imagery and was associated with Hermetic occultism (Yates, 1966). Perkins was a theologian and Puritan leader who advocated Petrus Ramus’s organizational mnemonic techniques. Thus, the dispute between Dicson and Perkins was just as much about religion as it was about mnemonic techniques. Specifically, as led by Perkins, the Puritans associated imagery-based mnemonics with the occult as well as with the Catholic Church (Couliano, 1987). Making an argument similar to that which they directed at the Catholic Church for the veneration of saints, the Puritans maintained that the use of mental imagery amounted to heresy as it reflected a form of idol worship. Moreover, the Puritans were especially opposed to the use of zodiac symbols in Bruno’s mnemonic system (Yates, 1966).

□科学方法的介绍

□ The Introduction of the Scientific Method

在文艺复兴后期，学者们不再受权威来源的影响，开始将系统的观察和实验作为获取知识的首选方法。弗朗西斯·培根是这些经验方法的发展和普及的主要贡献者，他也是记忆术的支持者。正如耶茨 (1966) 所指出的，培根完全赞同使用心理意象来增强记忆。然而，培根认为修辞学家和演说家使用记忆术是花哨的表演技巧，记忆术的主要价值在于它们在科学研究中的潜在应用。例如，培根建议，可以使用位置法的变体来促进发明，使知识易于创造性地使用 (Engel, 1997)。这样，人们可以将培根的记忆术观点视为教育者使用记忆术工具的先驱。记忆术在教育中的现代应用将在第 7 章中讨论。

In the latter stages of the Renaissance, scholars were less influenced by authoritative sources and began to embrace systematic observation and experimentation as preferred methods for the acquisition of knowledge. Francis Bacon, a major contributor to the development and popularity of these empirical methods, was also a proponent of mnemonic techniques. As noted by Yates (1966), Bacon fully embraced the use of mental imagery to enhance memory. However, Bacon believed that the use of mnemonics by rhetoricians and orators was gimmicky showmanship and that the main value of mnemonics was tied to their potential applications to scientific investigation. For example, Bacon suggested that variations of the method of loci could be used to facilitate invention by making knowledge readily available for creative use (Engel, 1997). In this way, one might consider Bacon’s view of mnemonics as a precursor to the use of mnemonics as a tool for educators. The modern use of mnemonics in education will be discussed in Chapter 7.

还应注意的是，培根并不提倡使用奇异的意象（Yates，1966；Yeo，2004）。因此，培根在记忆术方面的立场似乎在某种程度上是古典记忆术与清教徒所推崇的无意象组织记忆术之间的一种妥协。培根接受基于意象的记忆术，例如位置记忆法及其变体，但他认为意象应该合情合理，主要用于以有序的方式构建待记忆的信息。

It should also be noted that Bacon was not an advocate of the use of bizarre imagery (Yates, 1966; Yeo, 2004). Thus, it appears that Bacon’s position on mnemonics was a bit of a compromise between classic mnemonic techniques and the imageless organizational mnemonics espoused by the Puritans. Bacon accepted the use of image-based mnemonics such as the method of loci and its variants but suggested that imagery should be sensible and used mainly to structure to-be-remembered information in an orderly fashion.

尽管弗朗西斯·培根对记忆术有一定的接受，但后来的有影响力的思想家断然拒绝使用内部记忆术并提倡使用外部助记符。反对使用内部助记符的人的共同点是相信记忆系统极其脆弱。由于这种脆弱性，思想之间的内部关联很容易被扭曲，以至于它们不再反映其与世界的自然联系，甚至可能近乎疯狂（Yeo，2004）。与此观点一致，约翰·洛克（John Locke）的《人类理解论》（169​​0）标志着英国经验主义的开端（Schultz & Schultz，1992），提倡使用一种被称为“普通书”（Jeo，2004）的外部助记符。普通书是一种学习方法，其中需要记住的信息以笔记的形式总结在有组织的标题下。通常，这些笔记会包含相关主题和引文，作为检索所学信息的线索。洛克认为，这种方法可以让人避免与内部联想有关的所谓陷阱，并养成“训练”心智的习惯。

Despite the qualified acceptance of mnemonics by Francis Bacon, succeeding influential thinkers flatly rejected the use of internal mnemonics and instead advocated the use of external mnemonics. A common thread among those who rejected the use of internal mnemonics was the belief that the memory system was extremely fragile. As a result of this fragility, internal associations among ideas could be easily distorted such that they no longer reflected their natural connections with the world and could possibly even approximate madness (Yeo, 2004). In keeping with this sentiment, John Locke, whose An Essay Concerning Human Understanding (1690) marked the beginning of British empiricism (Schultz & Schultz, 1992), advocated the use of an external mnemonic known as a “commonplace book” (Yeo, 2004). A commonplace book was a method of study in which to-be-remembered information was summarized in the form of notes written under organized headers. Typically, these notes would include relevant themes and quotations that would serve as cues for the retrieval of learned information. Locke believed that this method allowed one to avoid the supposed pitfalls associated with internal associations and to develop habits that “disciplined” the mind.

洛克去世时，普通方法已失宠，到了18世纪，它甚至成为知识分子厌恶的对象（Yeo，2004）。反对普通方法的主要论点是，它被视为那些寻求学习捷径的人所青睐的方法。具体来说，人们认为这种方法鼓励的是要点学习，而不是更深层次的理解。因此，就像现代教育家抱怨学生使用CliffsNotes一样，当时的学者认为普通方法助长了知识的伪装。当然，将普通方法作为捷径而不是提示检索的方式显然与洛克对该方法的使用不一致。然而，普通方法的声誉却一落千丈，到了19世纪，“普通”一词被用来指代琐碎的事实，就像今天的用法一样（Yeo，2004）。

By the time of Locke’s death, the commonplace method had fallen out of favor, and by the 18th century, it had become a target of intellectual loathing (Yeo, 2004). The main argument against the commonplace method was that it was viewed as the method preferred by those seeking a shortcut to learning. Specifically, it was believed that the method encouraged gist learning rather than deeper understanding. Thus, much like the modern educator who bemoans the use of CliffsNotes by his or her students, scholars of that time believed that the commonplace method facilitated intellectual pretense. Of course, using the commonplace method as a shortcut rather than a way to cue retrieval is clearly inconsistent with Locke’s use of the method. Nonetheless, the reputation of the commonplace method deteriorated to the point that by the 19th century, the term commonplace was being used to refer to trivial facts, much like the use of the term today (Yeo, 2004).

尽管洛克的方法已然失宠，但他对组织、存储和检索的重视，为现代记忆研究者研究的一些基本课题奠定了基础。此外，这种常用方法的基本组成部分与现代用于促进记忆的“预先组织者”方法非常相似。第五章将再次讨论“预先组织者”的使用。

Notwithstanding the fall from grace of his method, Locke’s emphasis on organization, storage, and retrieval was a precursor to some of the fundamental topics studied by modern memory researchers. Moreover, the essential components of the commonplace method are very similar to the modern method of advance organizers that has been used to facilitate memory. The use of advance organizers will be discussed again in Chapter 5.

尽管文艺复兴末期人们逐渐淡忘了内部记忆法，但在此期间至少出现了一种颇具影响力的内部记忆法。约翰·贾斯特·温克尔曼（Johann Just Winkelmann）以斯坦尼斯劳斯·明克·冯·温斯海因（Stanislaus Mink von Wennsshein）的笔名，开发了一套用于记忆数字的音素系统，该系统涉及用字母代替数字（Lorayne，1957）。例如，数字 1 用字母 T 和 D 表示，因为这些字母的书写方式是向下划一。数字 2 则用……用字母 N 表示，因为它是用两笔向下书写的。同样，每个数字（0-9）都与一个或多个字母相关联。在最初的系统中，只有辅音与数字相关联。将数字编码为辅音后，再添加元音以使字母可发音，通过这种方式，日期等重要数字可以转换为更容易记住的音素甚至单词。该方法后来由理查德·格雷 (1730) 改进，也包括分配给数字的元音。这种方法——通常被称为“记忆大调系统”或“语音系统”——与现代的挂钩词方法相关，后者将在第 4 章中讨论。

Despite the movement away from internal mnemonics at the end of the Renaissance, there was at least one influential internal mnemonic devised during this time. Using the pseudonym Stanislaus Mink von Wennsshein, Johann Just Winkelmann developed a phonemic system for remembering numbers that involved substituting letters for numbers (Lorayne, 1957). For example, the number 1 was represented by letters T and D because these letters were written with one down stroke. The number 2 was represented by the letter N because it was written with two down strokes. Similarly, each digit (0–9) was associated with one or more letters. In the original system, only consonants were associated with digits. Once the numbers were coded to consonants, vowels were added to render the letters pronounceable, and in this manner, important numbers such as dates could be converted to more memorable phonemes or even words. The method was later refined by Richard Grey (1730) to also include vowels assigned to numbers. This method—often referred to as the “mnemonic major system” or the “phonetic system”—is related to the modern peg-word method, which will be discussed in Chapter 4.

□记忆科学的出现

□ The Emergence of Memory Science

影响学者对记忆术态度的最重要发展之一是心理学中对记忆的实证研究的出现。这一发展由赫尔曼·艾宾浩斯一手发起，他在 1885 年出版的专著宣布了第一个关于记忆的科学研究计划。艾宾浩斯的广泛目标是将费希纳开创性的心理测量方法应用于记忆。他从英国联想主义者那里获得了记忆的主题（Boring，1950）。为了检查未受先前经验影响的记忆中联想的发展，艾宾浩斯发明了无意义音节作为目标材料，默认了意义对学习和记忆的重要性。根据经验频率是学习和记忆新材料的主要决定因素的假设，艾宾浩斯使用的主要操作是重复。例如，他的一项实验（Ebbinghaus，1885/1964）比较了学习拜伦勋爵史诗《唐璜》中80个音节的重复次数和学习80个无意义音节的重复次数。结果表明，学习无意义音节所需的重复次数是学习有意义信息的九倍。

Among the most important developments to impact scholarly attitudes toward mnemonics was the emergence of empirical research on memory in psychology. That development was initiated single-handedly by Hermann Ebbinghaus, whose 1885 monograph announced the first scientific program of research on memory. Ebbinghaus’s broad goal was to adapt Fechner’s pioneering methods of mental measurement to memory. The subject matter of memory he took from the British associationists (Boring, 1950). To examine the development of associations in memory uncontaminated by prior experience, Ebbinghaus invented the nonsense syllable to be used as the target material, a tacit admission of the importance of meaning to learning and memory. In keeping with the assumption that frequency of experience is the primary determinant of learning and remembering new material, the principle manipulation used by Ebbinghaus was repetition. For example, one of his experiments (Ebbinghaus, 1885/1964) compared the number of repetitions required to learn 80-syllable stanzas of Lord Byron’s epic poem Don Juan to the number of repetitions required to learn 80 nonsense syllables. The results indicated that it took nine times more repetitions to learn the nonsense syllables than to learn the meaningful information.

由于艾宾浩斯对记忆的基本习得过程感兴趣，他的大部分实验都是用无意义音节进行的。为了进一步确保他对联想学习的观察是纯粹的，他没有使用任何助记技巧来学习音节；“他没有尝试通过发明记忆术式的特殊联想来连接无意义音节；学习完全依靠简单重复对自然记忆的影响”（Ebbinghaus, 1885/1964, 第25页）。为了进一步防止学习过程受到非自然因素的影响，艾宾浩斯采用了快速的呈现和背诵速度，具体来说是每秒2.5个项目。在这样的速度下，自然语言或视觉意象的媒介几乎无法发挥作用（Slamecka, 1985）。

Because of Ebbinghaus’s interest in the basic acquisition of memory, the bulk of his experiments were conducted just with nonsense syllables. To further ensure that his observations of associative learning were pure, he did not use any mnemonic techniques to learn the syllables; “there was no attempt to connect the nonsense syllables by the invention of special associations of the mnemotecknik type; learning was carried on solely by the influence of the mere repetitions upon natural memory” (Ebbinghaus, 1885/1964, p. 25). As further insurance against unnatural contamination of the learning process, Ebbinghaus used a rapid rate of presentation and recitation, specifically 2.5 items per second. At such a pace, little in the way of natural language or visual imagery mediators could occur (Slamecka, 1985).

艾宾浩斯项目的最终结果是，它不仅使记忆的科学研究合法化，也使整个人类学习领域在接下来的80年里僵化。正如杨（1985）所论证的，后者导致了人们对记忆技巧的兴趣长期消退。人类学习被概念化为通过死记硬背获得联想的过程。这种观点的应用削弱了人们对记忆技巧的兴趣，尽管人们知道它们很有效。

The end result of Ebbinghaus’s project was to legitimate the scientific study of memory as well as to rigidify the entire field of human learning for the next 80 years. This latter effect, as argued by Young (1985), began a long hiatus of interest in mnemonic techniques. Human learning became conceptualized as the acquisition of associations through rote repetition. The application of this view diminished interest in the use of mnemonic techniques even though they were known to be effective.

威廉·詹姆斯的开创性著作《心理学原理》 （1890 年）讨论了艾宾浩斯的理论，该书在艾宾浩斯发表手稿后不久出版。在书中，詹姆斯探讨了学习效率和记忆提高的问题，对单纯重复的强调远不如艾宾浩斯。具体而言，他认为，将待记忆信息与其他信息进行系统关联，比简单的重复能提供更多帮助记忆的线索。这一论点将编码的精细加工与检索所需的线索直接联系起来。编码和检索相互依存的概念至今仍被广泛接受，我们将在第 3 章中进一步讨论。

Ebbinghaus’s work is discussed in William James’s groundbreaking book Principles of Psychology (1890), which appeared not long after Ebbinghaus published his manuscript. In his book, James addressed questions of efficiency of learning and improvement in retention, placing much less emphasis on sheer repetition than did Ebbinghaus. Specifically, he argued that considering to-be-remembered information in systematic relations with other information provides more cues to assist remembering than simple repetition. This argument directly links elaboration at encoding with cues necessary for retrieval. The notion of the interdependence of encoding and retrieval remains widely accepted today and will be discussed further in Chapter 3.

除了讨论记忆的基本过程外，詹姆斯（1890）还探讨了如何提高记忆力。具体来说，詹姆斯描述了三类用于提高记忆力的方法：机械方法、明智方法和巧妙方法。机械方法涉及通过多种模态进行编码。例如，詹姆斯认为，可以通过听、看、说和写需要记住的信息来提高记忆力。这些方法抓住了现代多重代码理论的精髓，例如帕维奥（1971，1991）的双重编码理论（参见第三章）。正如詹姆斯所描述的，明智方法是一种强调分类的组织技巧。虽然詹姆斯没有区分外部记忆法和内部记忆法，但我们可以假设这类方法包括清教徒认可的拉姆斯方法以及笛卡尔和洛克倡导的外部记忆法。巧妙方法是正式的记忆系统。詹姆斯只描述了一种巧妙方法——一种与斯坦尼斯劳斯·明克·冯·温斯海因提出的相同的语音数字系统。有趣的是，詹姆斯将这套系统描述为最著名、最常用的巧妙方法。因此，当艾宾浩斯的著作首次传入美国时，记忆术仍然被认为是获取和保留新知识的可靠方法。事实上，当时人们的注意力主要集中在提高记忆力上。然而，随着世纪之交，艾宾浩斯的影响导致记忆术再次失宠（Young，1985）。

Besides discussing the essential processes of memory, James (1890) also addressed the topic of improving memory. Specifically, James described three classes of methods used to improve memory: mechanical methods, judicious methods, and ingenious methods. Mechanical methods involve encodings through multiple modalities. For example, James suggested that memory can be improved by hearing, seeing, speaking, and writing the information to be remembered. These methods capture the essence of modern multiple-code theories such as Paivio’s (1971, 1991) dual-coding theory (see Chapter 3). As described by James, judicious methods are organizational techniques that emphasize categorization. Although James did not distinguish between external and internal mnemonics, we can assume that this class of methods included the Puritan-endorsed Ramus method as well as the external mnemonics advocated by Descartes and Locke. Ingenious methods were formal mnemonic systems. James described only one ingenious method—a phonetic number system identical to that put forth by Stanislaus Mink von Wennsshein. Interestingly, this system is described by James as the most well-known and most frequently used ingenious method. Thus, when Ebbinghaus’s work was first introduced in the United States, mnemonic techniques were still considered to be respectable methods for acquiring and retaining new material. Indeed, much of the focus at that time was on improving memory. However, as the century turned, Ebbinghaus’s influence led to mnemonic techniques falling out of favor again (Young, 1985).

□助记符贬值

□ Mnemonics Devalued

20 世纪早期发生的事件逐渐降低了人们对记忆术的重视程度。最重要的是，修辞学开始从标准大学课程中消失。几个世纪以来，修辞学一直是文科教育的核心，而记忆术是修辞学不可或缺的组成部分 (Yates, 1966)。修辞学的主要目标是培养学生构建和进行有效的口头辩论的能力。记忆术训练通过教授学生记住论证结构和细节的人工技巧来支持这一使命。到了 19 世纪的最后十年，人们认为对口头辩论进行专门教育的必要性正在减弱。修辞学开始分裂。逻辑和批判性分析等一些主题被纳入英语、哲学和数学系的课程 (Kinneavy, 1990)。其他一些主题，包括记忆术训练，则完全失去了在课程中的地位。不久之后，人们对记忆术的普遍看法发生了变化，它们不再被视为修辞学中受人尊敬的组成部分，而是被视为用来支持浮夸记忆技巧的花招。

Events of the early 20th century coalesced to diminish the seriousness with which mnemonics were taken. Most important, the discipline of rhetoric began its demise from the standard university curriculum. For centuries, rhetoric had been the core of liberal studies, and mnemonics was an integral component of rhetoric (Yates, 1966). A principal goal of rhetoric was to train students in the construction and delivery of effective oral argument. Mnemonics training supported this mission by teaching students artificial techniques to remember the structure and details of their arguments. By the last decade of the 19th century, the perceived need to provide dedicated education to oral argument was waning. The discipline of rhetoric began to splinter. Some topics such as logic and critical analysis were absorbed into the curricula of departments of English, philosophy, and mathematics (Kinneavy, 1990). Others, mnemonic training included, lost their place in the curriculum altogether. Before long, the common view of mnemonic techniques changed such that they were no longer considered a respected component of rhetoric. Instead, they were viewed as gimmicks used to support pretentious memory tricks.

心理学中两种截然不同的发展汇聚在一起，导致记忆术失去了学术地位。首先是艾宾浩斯思想的广泛影响。杨 (1985) 认为，艾宾浩斯工作的成功对人们对记忆术的兴趣产生了负面影响。杨尤其认为，艾宾浩斯对重复对于联想发展的重要性的关注很快就被应用于心理学对提高学习和记忆效率的功能兴趣。尽管我们已经看到詹姆斯鼓励使用记忆术，但不久之后，他的一些杰出学生，如安吉尔和桑代克1就积极劝阻将记忆术用于严肃的学习。具体来说，安吉尔将它们描述为“骗人的把戏”，用途狭隘得令人无法接受。安吉尔对记忆术的批评在很多方面与中世纪和文艺复兴后期知识分子的批评相似——他们认为正式的记忆术体系不过是花招。桑代克（1907）曾说，学习和永久记忆的唯一可靠途径是重复；他从未提及记忆策略的使用。科尔文（1911）的观点更为尖锐：“最初通过记忆技巧掌握的东西，必须后来才能理解，否则这种学习就毫无意义了”（第172页；Young，1985年，第492页引用）。

Two distinct developments in psychology converged to abet the fall of mnemonics from academic grace. The first of these was the spreading influence of Ebbinghaus’s ideas. Young (1985) argued that the success of Ebbinghaus’s work became a negative influence on interest in mnemonics. In particular according to Young, Ebbinghaus’s focus on the importance of repetition for the development of associations was quickly applied to psychology’s functional interest in improving the efficiency of learning and memory. Whereas we have seen that James encouraged the use of mnemonics, it was not long before some of his prominent students such as Angell and Thorndike1 actively discouraged mnemonic techniques for serious learning. Specifically, Angell described them as “catchpenny” and unacceptably narrow in their usefulness. In many ways, Angell’s criticism of mnemonics was similar to the criticism that was levied by intellectuals in the Middle Ages and in the latter stages of the Renaissance—that formal mnemonic systems are gimmicks. Thorndike (1907) said that the only sure route to learning and permanent memory was through repetition; he never mentioned the use of mnemonic strategies. Colvin (1911) was more pointed: “That which was first mastered by tricks of memory must be later comprehended else the learning is worse than useless” (p. 172; as cited by Young, 1985, p. 492).

20世纪初，美国心理学受到教育界的密切关注。教育工作者们对促进高效学习的最佳方法感兴趣，而还有什么比这门宣称对“规律”感兴趣的科学更好的地方呢？学习的本质”？实验心理学的主导论题是，学习只有在大量重复之后才能发展。在这种环境下，记忆技巧的成果不被视为学习。杨（1985）提出了一个颇具启发性的论点：艾宾浩斯研究的成功将问题从如何更有效地学习转变为学习是如何发生的。这一转变有效地用重复取代了记忆技巧，开启了教育中死记硬背的时代。

In the early 20th century, psychology in the United States was closely watched by the education community. Educators were interested in the best ways to facilitate efficient learning, and what better place to look for advice than to the science that proclaimed its interest in the “laws of learning”? The dominant theme from experimental psychology was that learning developed only after substantial repetition. In this climate, the product of mnemonic devices was not considered learning. Young’s (1985) provocative argument is that the success of Ebbinghaus’s research changed the question from one of how to learn more efficiently to one of how learning occurs. That change effectively replaced mnemonics with repetition and ushered in the era of rote drill in education.

心理学中加速记忆术消亡的第二个影响因素是约翰·沃森（John Watson）1914年发表的行为主义宣言。行为主义的根本原理是，心理概念不应在行为的科学分析中发挥作用。此外，行为主义的成功也使得意象的讨论从心理学研究及其应用中被排除。记忆术从一开始就与意象有着千丝万缕的联系，心理学忽视意象就等于忽视记忆术。在沃森提出这一倡议50年后，美国心理学界才再次青睐意象研究以及随之而来的记忆术。

The second influence from psychology that accelerated the demise of mnemonics was the behaviorist manifesto of John Watson (1914). The motivating rationale of behaviorism was that mental concepts should play no role in the scientific analysis of behavior. Among other things, the success of behaviorism eliminated discussion of imagery from psychological research and its application. Mnemonics had inextricable ties to imagery from its very outset, and the neglect of imagery in psychology was tantamount to neglecting mnemonics. It would be 50 years after Watson’s initiative before the tenor of American psychology would again favor the study of imagery and with it mnemonics.

总而言之，19 世纪末 20 世纪初，多种因素共同作用，降低了记忆术的受人尊敬程度，并将其从标准大学课程中剔除。修辞学的流失是一次根本性的打击。只要修辞的目的受到高度尊重，记忆术就能稳固存在，但随着对训练有素的演说家的需求减少，记忆技巧在学术界失去了地位，并披上了马戏表演的外衣。心理学的发展进一步加剧了记忆术的衰落。对发展学习规律的强调将提高学习效率的兴趣抛在了一边，随着重复成为学习的基本规律，记忆术的名声变得更加低俗。美国心理学界的强大影响力主张将心理概念从科学分析中驱逐出去，而这一法令的接受不仅将记忆术，而且将所有记忆都从积极的研究中剔除出去。在这些影响之下，致力于分析现有记忆技术和开发新技术的研究变得停滞不前。

In summary, several factors converged in the late 19th and early 20th centuries to reduce the respectability of mnemonics and eliminate it from the standard university curriculum. The diaspora of rhetoric was a fundamental blow. As long as the purpose of rhetoric was held in high esteem, mnemonics would be secure, but with the decreased perceived need for trained orators, mnemonic techniques lost their place in academics and took on the aura of circus tricks. Developments in psychology furthered the decline. The emphasis on developing laws of learning pushed aside interest in facilitating the efficiency of learning, and as repetition settled in as the fundamental law of learning, mnemonic devices took on an even bawdier reputation. Powerful influences in American psychology advocated the banishment of mental concepts from the scientific analyses, and acceptance of that edict removed not just mnemonics but all of memory from active research. In the wake of these influences, research devoted to the analysis of existing mnemonic techniques and development of new ones languished.

□时代越来越好

□ Times Get Better

尽管20世纪初记忆术研究领域一片荒芜，但那些为数不多的研究却令人鼓舞，因为其重点在于对特定技巧的有效性进行实证检验。早在1918年，大卫·希尔在《心理学公报》上发表的一篇论文就提出了这一关注点。希尔提倡在课堂上使用特定的记忆术技巧，以便“对记忆术原理进行正确的评估”。“这可能”（第 103 页）。他在研究中使用的助记符是由他的实验室构建的，但深受助记符大调系统的影响，并且与现代的挂钩词系统几乎相同。

As barren as the early-20th-century scene was for mnemonics research, the sparse work that was done was encouraging in that the emphasis was on empirical examination of the efficiency of specific techniques. This focus appeared as early as 1918 with a paper by David Hill in the Psychological Bulletin. Hill advocated the use of specific mnemonic techniques in the classroom to allow “a right evaluation of the mnemonic principle is made possible” (p. 103). The mnemonic used in his study was constructed by his laboratory but was heavily influenced by the mnemonic major system and is nearly identical to the modern peg-word system.

Hill 的助记法涉及单词与数字的系统关联，以便记住一个包含代表数字 1 到 100 的单词的助记符列表。然后，此助记符列表被用作记住后续列表的框架。例如，在 Hill 的列表中，单词air代表数字 1，而bar代表数字 2。根据说明，当学习者看到待记列表的第一个单词时，他们会在脑海中形成一个将该单词与助记符列表的第一个单词联系起来的心理图像。因此，如果待记列表上的第一个单词是dog，学习者可能会在脑海中形成一只狗嗅空气的心理图像。在回忆时，学习者只需检索已经记住的助记符列表。然后，助记符列表中的每个单词都应该根据心理图像形成的联想提示检索待记单词。虽然希尔在文章中没有提供定量数据，但他确实表示，该系统让他能够在24小时的记忆间隔后成功回忆起一份包含30个项目的清单。希尔还指出，该演示的价值在于“几乎每个学生都在课堂作业中取得了成功”（第103页）。

Hill’s mnemonic involved the systematic association of words with numbers such that a mnemonic list with words representing the numbers 1 to 100 is memorized. This mnemonic list is then used as a framework to remember succeeding lists. For example, in Hill’s list, the word air represented the number 1, and bar represented the number 2. According to instructions, when presented with the first word of a to-be-remembered list, the learner would form a mental image that associates the word with the first word of the mnemonic list. So, if the first word on the to-beremembered list was dog, the learner might form a mental image of a dog sniffing the air. At the time of recall, the learner simply retrieves the mnemonic list, which has already been committed to memory. Each word on the mnemonic list should then cue the retrieval of the to-be-remembered words as a result of the association formed by the mental image. Although Hill did not report quantitative data in his article, he did state that the system allowed him to successfully recall a 30-item list after a 24-hour retention interval. Hill also stated that the value of the demonstration was that “success upon the part of practically every student was obtained in class work” (p. 103).

希尔（Hill，1918）的演示也标志着首次在已发表的期刊文章中默认了奇异意象的助记优势。具体来说，希尔指出，生动的意象，即使是荒谬的，也能帮助学习者记住许多只出现过一次的单词。然而，希尔的研究在20世纪初至中期是一个罕见的例子。

Hill’s (1918) demonstration also marks the first tacit acceptance of the mnemonic benefits of bizarre imagery to appear in a published journal article. Specifically, Hill stated that vivid imagery, even if it is ridiculous, will allow a learner to remember numerous words presented only once. Hill’s work, however, is a rare example in the early to mid-20th century.

为了确定20世纪助记术研究的流行程度，我们查看了一个流行学术数据库使用关键词“助记符”或“记忆辅助”生成的已发表文章数量。然后，作为中心性的粗略指数，我们计算了每1000篇记忆领域出版物中由我们的关键词生成的文章数量。图1.1展示了每个十年的结果。该图表明，从20世纪30年代开始，助记术讨论的中心性急剧下降，并在20世纪50年代达到最低点。这是行为主义的黄金时代。

To determine the prevalence of mnemonic research in the 20th century, we examined the number of published articles generated by a popular academic database using either the keyword mnemonic or memory aid. Then, as a crude index of centrality, we computed the number of articles generated by our keywords per 1,000 publications in the area of memory. The results for each decade are depicted in Figure 1.1. The figure indicates a steep decline in the centrality of the discussion of mnemonics beginning in the 1930s and reaching its nadir in the 1950s. These were the halcyon days of behaviorism.

到20世纪50年代中期，一场变革正在酝酿，这导致了认知心理学的复兴（参见Lachman, Lachman & Butterfield, 1979）。新的时代思潮对记忆术更加包容，这一点从认知复兴初期的一篇经典论文中可见一斑。米勒（1956）在其著名的“神奇数字7”论文中，报道了西德尼·史密斯使用记忆术对数字进行编码并提高其广度测试成绩的案例。重要的是，米勒敦促读者不要将记忆术视为技巧，而应将其视为重要的记录手段，以提高功能记忆容量。编码注定要成为学习和记忆的核心概念（Hunt，2008），而将助记符作为编码的辅助手段是其恢复的重要一步。事实上，图 1.1中的数据显示，从 20 世纪 60 年代到 80 年代，有关助记符的论文数量有所增加，这反映了心理学普遍回归认知主题。然而，助记符研究活动的增加跟不上记忆和认知研究活动的持续上升。如图 1.1所示，自 1980 年以来，出版物索引的助记符研究急剧下降。人们不禁要问，为什么在如此有利的知识环境中，在人们对记忆如此关注的情况下，对助记符的研究却如此之少。

By the middle of the 1950s, a change was building that would lead to a renaissance of cognitive psychology (see Lachman, Lachman, & Butterfield, 1979). The new zeitgeist would be much more hospitable to mnemonics as was evident from a classic paper from the beginning of this cognitive renaissance. In his famous “magic number 7” paper, Miller (1956) reported the case of Sidney Smith’s use of mnemonics to code digits and increase his performance on a span test. Importantly, Miller urged the reader to view mnemonic devices not as tricks but as important recoding devices that increase functional memory capacity. Coding was destined to become a core concept in learning and memory (Hunt, 2008), and casting mnemonics as an aid to coding was an important step toward its rehabilitation. Indeed, the data in Figure 1.1 show that the number of papers on mnemonics increased through the 1960s into the 1980s, mirroring psychology’s general return to topics of cognition. However, the increased activity in mnemonic research would not keep pace with the continued upswing in research activity in memory and cognition. As shown in Figure 1.1, mnemonic research as indexed by publications has experienced a sharp decline since 1980. One has to wonder why, in such a favorable intellectual milieu and with so much attention directed to memory, that so little is being done with mnemonics.

图 1.1按十年划分的记忆领域中每 1,000 篇文章中与助记词相关的文章数量。

FIGURE 1.1 The number of mnemonic articles per 1,000 articles published in the area of memory by decade.

□ 记忆术和

记忆的科学研究

□ Mnemonics and the Scientific

Study of Memory

虽然我们无法确定当代心理学中记忆术研究相对缺乏的原因，但人们怀疑有几个因素。其中包括我们之前讨论中遗留的问题，例如，人们认为正式的记忆术是一套旨在人为增强记忆的技术，除了制造一些花哨的记忆技巧外，几乎没有其他用途。另一个持续存在的障碍是，心理学对记忆的研究目标仍然是理解记忆过程，而不是提高这些过程的效率。最近的一些发展扩大了记忆科学与传统记忆术之间的差距。当前对自然记忆的概念化，将成功记忆中刻意记忆的必要性降到了最低。“加工层次”框架（Craik & Lockhart, 1972）的一个持久影响是，它假设记忆是感知和理解的副产品。也就是说，记忆是在我们正常经历之后自然产生的；记住一段经历并不需要，也不一定受益于刻意记住它。这种关于记忆运作方式的假设，并不能顺利地过渡到刻意使用正式的记忆术来记忆。

Although we cannot identify with certainty the causes for the relative lack of research on mnemonics in contemporary psychology, suspicion falls on several factors. Among these are hangovers from our earlier discussion such as the perception that formal mnemonics is a set of techniques designed to artificially enhance memory, with little purpose other than to produce gimmicky tricks of memory. Another persisting impediment is that the goal of psychological research on memory continues to be to understand the processes, not to increase the efficiency of those processes. Several more recent developments have widened the gap between the science of memory and traditional mnemonics. Current conceptualizations of natural memory minimize the necessity of intent to remember for successful memory. A lasting influence of the levels of processing framework (Craik & Lockhart, 1972) is the assumption that memory is a by-product of perception and comprehension. That is, memory comes for free in the wake of our normal experiences; remembering an experience does not require or necessarily benefit from intending to remember it. This assumption about how memory works does not segue smoothly into the intentional use of formal mnemonic devices in order to remember.

处理水平也强调了语义处理对于良好记忆的重要性。表面信息的处理与较差的记忆力有关。一方面，这种强调与历史上对重复的关注相悖，这种关注始于艾宾浩斯，最终强调通过死记硬背将短期记忆转移到长期记忆。另一方面，对语义处理的强调与对理解的研究相吻合，得出结论：正常的记忆产物是经验的意义或要点。正式的助记符几乎总是以产生逐字记忆为目标。科学心理学关于正常记忆的运作与助记符技术的目标应用之间的假设和结论之间的差异，加剧了人们对助记符与记忆的重要功能脱节的看法。

Levels of processing also emphasized the importance of semantic processing for good memory. Processing of surface information was associated with poor retention. On the one hand, this emphasis counters the historical focus on repetition that began with Ebbinghaus and culminated with the emphasis on rote rehearsal for transfer from short-term to long-term memory. On the other hand, the emphasis on semantic processing converges with research on comprehension to conclude that the normal memory product is the meaning or gist of an experience. Formal mnemonics almost always has the goal of yielding verbatim memory. This discrepancy between the assumptions and conclusions from scientific psychology about the operation of normal memory and the target application for mnemonic techniques increases the perception of mnemonics as out of touch with the important function of memory.

科学心理学忽视记忆术的另一个潜在因素是过去20年来人们对错误记忆兴趣的激增。从Roediger和McDermott（1995）那篇影响深远的论文开始，研究就强调了人类记忆的易错性，并将大量精力投入到记忆错误研究上。这项研究的一个重要发现是，错误记忆在很多情况下是由正常的理解操作造成的。在这种背景下，强调记忆精确性和准确性的记忆术再次与记忆研究的主流思潮格格不入。

Another potential factor in the neglect of mnemonics by scientific psychology is the explosion of interest in false memory over the past 20 years. Beginning with Roediger and McDermott’s (1995) influential paper, research has highlighted the fallibility of human memory and turned significant amounts of effort toward memory errors. An important discovery in this research is that false memory results, in many instances, from the normal operation of comprehension. Against this backdrop, mnemonics, with its emphasis on precision and accuracy of memory, again finds itself at odds with the prevailing zeitgeist of memory research.

记忆研究专注于自然记忆过程的运作，而​​助记符（其定义本身就属于人工）在很大程度上仍不在该研究的范围内。与此同时，对人工记忆的需求却并未减弱。技术的发展在很大程度上旨在减少或取代对人类认知的需求，这大大增加了逐字记忆的负担。在互联网上比在图书馆更容易找到书籍和期刊，信件和备忘录正在被电子邮件取代，纸币被银行卡取代，人们经常在电脑前购物，而不是在商店购物。这些变化并非昙花一现，而是预示着一种将持续整个世纪的趋势。所有这些变化有什么共同点呢？上述每一项变化都对记忆提出了更高的要求。在线访问书籍、发送电子邮件、访问银行记录以及进行金融交易通常都需要使用单独的密码和用户名。此外，身份盗窃和计算机劫持等历史上从未遇到过的问题要求我们尽可能地设置复杂且不暴露个人信息的用户名和密码。因此，记忆几乎随机的数字和字母串已成为现代生活的必需品。重要的是，这些对记忆的要求，是除了我们需要记住的无数与我们对信息处理技术的新依赖无关的内容之外的。

Memory research concentrates on the operation of natural memory processes, and mnemonics, which by definition is artificial, remains largely outside the purview of that research. Meanwhile, the demands for artificial uses of memory have not abated. The development of technology whose function is in large part to reduce or replace demands on human cognition has added significantly to the burden of verbatim memory. Books and journals are being found more easily on the Internet than at a library, letters and memos are being replaced by e-mail, paper money has given way to bank cards, and purchases are often made in front of a computer rather than at a store. These changes are not the result of a passing fad but an indication of a trend that will continue throughout the century. And what do all of these changes have in common? Each of the changes mentioned place increased demands on memory. Separate passwords and usernames are often needed for accessing books online, for sending e-mail, for accessing bank records, and for making financial transactions. Moreover, problems that have not been encountered at other points in history such as identity theft and computer hijacking require that we make our usernames and passwords as difficult and personally unrevealing as possible. As a result, the memorization of nearly random strings of digits and letters has become a necessity of modern life. Importantly, these demands on memory are in addition to the myriad things we need to commit to memory that are unrelated to our new dependence on information processing technology.

我们编写本书的目的是使记忆术的传统用途与科学心理学中对人类自然记忆的研究达成和解。

Our goal for this book is to begin a rapprochement between the traditional purpose of mnemonics and the study of natural human memory in scientific psychology.

我们的目标是认真努力地将最前沿的科学成果应用于提升记忆力，同时也将最优秀的记忆术进行科学分析。这项努力超越了传统意义上的记忆术，因为我们计划利用记忆研究提供的任何机会来促进记忆，包括制定针对特定需求的个性化策略。由于“记忆术”一词代表了一套非常清晰的实践，其中许多实践可能被科学心理学所鄙视，因此我们建议将我们的努力命名为“记忆学”。我们非常谦虚地推荐这个新术语，主要有两个原因。首先，我们打算将这项练习的范围扩展到人们通常认为的记忆术之外，而且添加这个新术语比要求人们重新定义他们长期以来对记忆术的理解更容易。其次，“记忆学”比“记忆术”一词更能体现我们的目标。我们将在第一章的结尾简要讨论这一差异。

What we have in mind is a serious effort to bring the best of science to bear on improving memory but as well to subject the best of mnemonics to scientific analysis. The effort goes beyond what is traditionally considered mnemonics in that we intend to exploit any opening offered by memory research to facilitate memory, including the development of individual strategies tailored for specific needs. Because the word mnemonics denotes a very clear set of practices, many of which are arguably disdained by scientific psychology, we propose to name our endeavor mnemonology. We recommend this new terminology with all due modesty and for two principal reasons. First, we intend to broaden the scope of the exercise beyond what people usually think of as mnemonics, and adding the new term is easier than asking people to redefine their long-standing interpretation of what mnemonics means. Second, mnemonology captures a meaning that is closer to our goal than does the term mnemonics. We close the first chapter with a brief discussion of that difference.

□ 从记忆学到

记忆术再到记忆术

□ From Mnemonology to

Mnemonics and Back

记忆科学相对忽视记忆术，可能反映了正式的记忆系统与科学观点相去甚远的事实当今的正常记忆，就像艾宾浩斯强调重复的“记忆术”（mnemotecknik）一样。对大多数人来说，记忆术的含义已被正式的记忆技巧所穷尽，但实际上，它的定义是“一种记忆辅助工具”，或者，对于那些喜欢字典定义的人来说，是“一种提高记忆力的技巧”（《韦氏大学词典》 ，2007年）。因此， “记忆术”一词的真正含义并非通过一套正式的程序就能捕捉到的。

The relative neglect of mnemonics by memory science likely reflects the fact that formal mnemonic systems are as removed from the scientific view of normal memory today as was the “mnemotecknik” from Ebbinghaus’s emphasis on repetition. For most people, the meaning of mnemonics is exhausted by the techniques of formal mnemonics, but, in fact, the definition is “a memory aid” or, for those preferring a dictionary definition, “a technique of improving the memory” (Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary, 2007). Thus, the true meaning of the word mnemonics is not captured by a set of formal procedures.

基础记忆研究在分离记忆运作的基本过程方面取得了实质性进展，可以想象，成功的记忆技巧会运用这些过程的组合。重要的是，相关的认知过程可以通过几乎无限数量的操作来激活。因此，理论上，创造成功的增强记忆的新方法的可能性是无限的。然而，根据狭义的记忆术定义，这些方法甚至可能不被归类为记忆术，因此它们可能会迷失在学术研究人员和科学知识消费者之间经常存在的鸿沟之中。

Basic memory research has made substantial progress in isolating processes fundamental to the operation of memory, and one could imagine that successful mnemonic techniques engage combinations of these processes. Importantly, the relevant cognitive processes can be activated by an almost infinite number of operations. Thus, theoretically, there are unlimited possibilities for the creation of successful new methods for enhancing memory. However, according to the narrow definition of mnemonics, these methods might not even be classified as mnemonics, and thus they could be lost in the chasm that often exists between the academic researcher and the consumer of scientific knowledge.

也许，通过明确认识到记忆研究中成功识别促进记忆的过程的部分，可以加强记忆科学和记忆术之间的联系。我们建议将基础研究中的这个感兴趣的领域称为记忆学。随着这些过程的识别，可以从基础研究中开发出辅助记忆的技术。因此，记忆学将产生记忆术。此外，记忆学将包括对现有记忆技术的分析，既包括它们在不同环境中的有效性，也包括它们潜在的心理机制。在这方面，对记忆术的记忆学分析将有助于记忆科学基础理论的发展。

Perhaps the affiliation between memory science and mnemonics can be strengthened by explicitly recognizing the portion of memory research that successfully identifies processes that facilitate memory. We suggest that this area of interest in basic research be called mnemonology. With the identification of those processes, techniques to aid memory could be developed from the basic research. Thus, mnemonology would yield mnemonics. Moreover, mnemonology would include analysis of existing mnemonic techniques both for their effectiveness in various settings and for their underlying psychological mechanisms. In this regard, a mnemonological analysis of mnemonics would contribute to the development of basic theory in memory science.

例如，有人提出，对于许多助记符来说，为了提高有效性，需要结合精细化和组织化的过程（Worthen & Hunt，2008）。位置法包含一个鼓励精细化的组成部分、一个鼓励组织的组成部分以及一个同时鼓励精细化和组织的组成部分。这是否意味着古代体系中的一个或多个组成部分是多余的？如果是这样，可以使用拆解设计来测试该方法，以确定提高助记符有效性所必需的组成部分。此类研究的价值在于可以降低方法的复杂性，最终使其更加方便用户使用。此类研究不仅可以进行，而且应该针对每个正式助记符进行。

For example, it has been suggested that, for many mnemonics, a combination of the processes of elaboration and organization is required for effectiveness (Worthen & Hunt, 2008). The method of loci involves a component that encourages elaboration, a component that encourages organization, and a component that encourages both elaboration and organization. Does this mean that one or more of the components of the ancient system are superfluous? If so, the method could be tested using a dismantling design to determine the components necessary for mnemonic effectiveness. The value of such research would be the possibility of a reduction in the complexity of the method, which would ultimately make it more user friendly. Research such as this not only could be conducted but should be conducted for each formal mnemonic.

正如本章前面提到的，我们的助记方法强调的是助记背后的过程，而不是提供关于助记有效性的有限指导。我们采用这种方法的理由是，如果一个人理解了助记背后的基本过程，如果一个人掌握了多种记忆技巧，那么他就应该能够自己创造各种简单的记忆技巧。这些自创的记忆术可以补充个人的学习风格和目标。毋庸置疑，人们不太可能为自己创造一种他们认为花哨或浪费时间的记忆术。新记忆术的创造也可能产生能够有效地帮助各种用户记住广泛知识的记忆系统。此外，通过记忆法研究记忆术，研究实验室既可以用来测试现有的记忆术，也可以用来开发具有广泛应用的新的、用户友好的技术（参见 Henshel，1980）。

As mentioned earlier in the chapter, our approach to mnemonics emphasizes the processes that underlie mnemonics rather than provides circumscribed instructions for mnemonic effectiveness. Our rationale for this approach is that if one understands the basic processes underlying mnemonic devices, then one should be able to generate a variety of simple mnemonics techniques for himself or herself. These self-generated mnemonics would have the advantage of complementing individual learning styles and objectives. Needless to say, it is unlikely that people would create a mnemonic for their own use that they would consider gimmicky or otherwise a waste of time. The creation of new mnemonics could also result in mnemonic systems that are effective for remembering a broad range of knowledge by a variety of users. Moreover, with the mnemonological approach to mnemonics, the research laboratory could be used both to test existing mnemonics and to develop new, user-friendly techniques that have broad applications (cf. Henshel, 1980).

通过采用本文所倡导的记忆学，过去二十年记忆学领域研究的下滑趋势有望迅速而轻松地扭转。原因在于，尽管记忆学研究有所衰落，但与记忆提升相关的过程研究始终是记忆研究的核心。因此，记忆学研究的复兴并不需要依赖于具有记忆学或记忆教学背景的研究人员。相反，记忆学研究的未来在于那些对基本记忆过程的应用感兴趣的研究人员。

By adopting the mnemonology advocated here, the downward trend in research conducted in the area of mnemonics during the past two decades has the potential to be reversed quickly and easily. The reason being is that although mnemonic research has declined, research on processes related to memory improvement is and has always been central to the study of memory. As such, the revival of mnemonic research need not rely on researchers with a background in mnemonics or mnemonic instruction. Rather, the future of mnemonic research lies with researchers interested in the applications of basic memory processes.

总而言之，我们每个人在日常生活中都依赖于记忆——就像旧石器时代晚期的狩猎采集者、古希腊和古罗马人、中世纪和文艺复兴时期的居民，以及所有对记忆术持批评态度的人一样。关键在于，人类依靠记忆来应对日常生活，只要人类继续这样做，提升记忆力的兴趣就永远不会消失。我们希望我们的努力能够激发对记忆术的更多研究，并复兴这门古老的记忆术。

In summary, we all depend on our memory throughout the course of our day—just like the hunter-gatherers of the Upper Paleolithic, the ancient Greeks and Romans, the inhabitants of the Medieval and Renaissance periods, and all of the critics of mnemonic techniques. The point is that humans rely on memory to negotiate their daily lives, and as long as they continue to do so, there will always be an interest in improving memory. It is our hope that our efforts here will inspire additional research on mnemonics and revive the ancient art of memory.

2

摄氏度哈一个磷T埃R		 



选择助记符的一般考虑因素

General Considerations in

Selecting Mnemonics

助记符几乎适用于任何以学习和记忆为目标的情况，但并非放之四海而皆准。助记符的有效性取决于其应用的具体情况。问题在于，具体情况可能千差万别。例如，有人可能只想记住一份包含12项的购物清单。又有人可能想学习演奏拉赫玛尼诺夫的第二钢琴协奏曲。同样的技巧在这些情况下不太可能同样有效。考虑到使助记符适应具体情况的目标，如果我们能够明确选择助记符时需要考虑的维度，将会大有裨益。在本章中，我们将结合实际考虑，讨论基础记忆研究中确定的一些更重要的维度。例如，我们有充分的理由相信，特定事件记忆背后的过程与知识获取背后的过程不同。我们也知道，不同类型的记忆测试对不同类型的学习有不同的敏感度。在为特定个体选择策略时，必须考虑到个体差异。对你有用的方法可能对我有用，也可能对我没用。另一个重要的考虑因素是助记符的创建者是谁，是用户还是其他人。这些问题都会在本书的不同情境中不时出现。因此，我们将在本章中对这些问题进行一般性描述，因为它们与在特定情况下选择助记符技巧有关。

Mnemonics are useful in almost any situation in which learning and memory are the goals, but one size does not fit all. The effectiveness of a mnemonic requires that the technique be matched to the particular circumstances of application. The rub is that the particular circumstances can differ in countless ways. For example, one simply might want to commit a 12-item grocery list to memory. Then again one might want to learn to play Rachmaninoff’s Piano Concerto no. 2. The same technique is unlikely to be equally effective in these circumstances. Given the goal of fitting the mnemonic to the circumstances, it would be helpful if we can specify dimensions to consider when selecting a mnemonic. In this chapter we discuss some of the more important of those dimensions as identified by basic memory research in conjunction with practical considerations. For example, we have good reason to believe that the processes underlying memory for particular events differ from the processes underlying the acquisition of knowledge. We also know that different kinds of memory tests are differentially sensitive to different kinds of learning. Individual differences among people must be taken into account when selecting a strategy for a particular individual. What works for you may or may not work for me. Another important consideration is who creates the mnemonic, the user or someone else. Each of these concerns will crop up periodically throughout the book in various contexts. Consequently we shall devote the chapter to a general description of these issues as they relate to the selection of mnemonic techniques for particular situations.

□内存类型

□ Type of Memory

在选择合适的助记符时，要建立的记忆类型是一个重要的考虑因素。这里，我们从两个不同的维度简要描述记忆的“类型”。第一个维度涉及要建立的表征类型，要么是依赖于上下文的表征，要么是与上下文无关的表征。这种区别对应于记忆和知识之间的区别。第二个区别是回顾性记忆和前瞻性记忆之间的区别。这种区别体现了记住过去事件和记住将来要做的事情之间的区别。这两个维度上的记忆类型对不同的线索有不同的反应，有效的助记符在这些维度上也会有所不同。

The kind of memory that is to be established is an important consideration in selecting a proper mnemonic. Here we briefly describe “kind” of memory on two separate dimensions. The first involves the type of representation to be established, either a context-dependent or a context-independent representation. This distinction corresponds to the difference between memory and knowledge. The second distinction is between retrospective and prospective memory. This distinction captures the difference between remembering an event in the past versus remembering to do something in the future. The kinds of memory on both of these dimensions respond differently to different cues, and effective mnemonics will differ across these dimensions.

记忆与知识

Memory Versus Knowledge

在决定哪种助记符最适合特定的学习情境时，首先必须考虑在检索时将访问哪种类型的记忆。根据 Tulving (1985) 的说法，记忆有两种基本类型，它们分别存在于不同的记忆系统中。情景记忆是指针对特定时间事件和经历的记忆。例如，你最近一次度假去了哪里，上次在泰国餐厅点了什么，以及你观看的 Nickelback 乐队演唱会的开场嘉宾是谁，都被视为情景记忆。这些事件代表在特定时间和特定情境中发生的特定情节。相比之下，语义记忆反映的是与特定时间事件无关的常识。例如，蓝色加黄色会变成绿色，巴仙吉犬是唯一不会吠叫的犬种，以及功 = 力 × 距离，这些都被视为语义记忆。值得注意的是，情景记忆和语义记忆是同时编码的，但被认为是分开存储的。例如，假设一个人在从西雅图飞往休斯顿的飞机上阅读一本书，并了解到美洲原住民奇蒂马查部落曾经居住在如今的新奥尔良地区。奇蒂马查部落与新奥尔良的关系体现在语义记忆中。然而，关于如何（从某本书中）以及何时（从西雅图飞往休斯顿的途中）获得这些知识的信息则体现在情景记忆中。

When deciding which mnemonic is most appropriate for a given learning situation, one must first consider what type of memory will be accessed at the time of retrieval. According to Tulving (1985), there are two basic types of memory that are represented in separate memory systems. Episodic memory consists of memories for specific, time-dated events and experiences. For example, where you went on your most recent vacation, what you ordered the last time you ate at a Thai restaurant, and who was the opening act at the Nickelback concert you attended are all considered episodic memories. These events represent specific episodes that occurred at specific times and within a specific context. In contrast, semantic memory reflects general knowledge that is not tied to a specific time-dated episode. Knowing that blue and yellow make green, that the basenji is the only breed of dog that does not bark, and that work = force × distance would each be considered semantic memories. It is important to note that episodic and semantic memories are encoded simultaneously but are believed to be stored separately. For example, consider a situation in which, while reading a book on an airplane traveling from Seattle to Houston, one learns that the Native American Chitimacha tribe once inhabited the area now known as New Orleans. Knowledge of the relationship between the Chitimacha tribe and New Orleans is represented in semantic memory. However, the information about how (from a particular book) and when (during a trip from Seattle to Houston) the knowledge was acquired is represented in episodic memory.

除了情景记忆和语义记忆之外，Tulving (1985) 还描述了程序记忆，它被认为存储在语义记忆系统的一个子系统中。程序性知识包括以下记忆：学习程序和技能。骑自行车、罚球和削苹果等知识都属于程序性记忆。

In addition to episodic and semantic memories, Tulving (1985) described procedural memories, which are thought to be stored in a subsystem of the semantic memory system. Procedural knowledge includes memory for learned procedures and skills. Knowledge pertaining to riding a bicycle, shooting a free throw, and peeling an apple are examples of procedural memories.

就目前而言，需要注意的是，上述每种记忆类型在最佳记忆方式上各不相同。特定于事件发生情境的线索可以增强情景记忆的检索。也就是说，当使用与待记忆事件一起编码的检索线索时，情景事件最有可能被从记忆中回忆起来 (Tulving, 1972)。例如，当你试图回忆第一次约会去了哪里时，关于谁陪你约会的信息将有助于回忆地点。鉴于情境对情景记忆的重要性，最适合用于记忆情景信息的助记符是那些能够在学习过程中增强特定情境线索编码的助记符。

For the present purposes, it is important to note that each of the memory types described differ in terms of how they are best remembered. The retrieval of episodic memories is enhanced by cues specific to the context in which the event occurred. That is, an episodic event is most likely to be recalled from memory when a retrieval cue that was encoded along with the to-be-remembered event is used (Tulving, 1972). For example, when trying to remember where you went on your first date, information about who accompanied you on that date would be helpful to the retrieval of the location. Given the importance of context to episodic memory, the most appropriate mnemonics to use for remembering episodic information are those that enhance the encoding of specific contextual cues during learning.

由于语义记忆不受特定语境的约束，线索特异性对于语义记忆的检索而言并不那么重要。相反，语义记忆依赖于与先前存在的知识结构的关联。因此，如果一个学生试图回忆谁创办了第一本心理学期刊，那么如果被告知她是在2007年9月5日在图书馆时读到的心理学入门教科书中的信息，她不太可能从中受益。然而，如果提供相关信息作为线索，例如创办第一本期刊的人也创办了第一个心理学实验室，学生就更有可能记住答案是威廉·冯特。因此，强调与先前存储知识关联的记忆法比强调语境特定线索的记忆法对语义记忆更有效。

Because semantic memories are not bound to a specific context, cue specificity is less important for retrieval in semantic memory. Rather, semantic memory depends on associations with preexisting knowledge structures. As such, a student who is trying to remember who established the first journal in psychology is unlikely to benefit from being told that she read the information in her introductory psychology textbook while at the library on September 5, 2007. However, when cued with associated information such as the fact that the person who established the first journal also established the first psychological laboratory, the student is far more likely to remember that the answer is Wilhelm Wundt. Thus, mnemonics that emphasize associations with previously stored knowledge are more effective for semantic memories than those that emphasize context-specific cues.

程序性记忆被认为是在无意识的情况下被提取和运用的（Tulving，1985）。此外，有意识地感知程序性信息可能会干扰技能的发挥。设想一位吉他手独奏一首高难度乐曲。如果他专注于演奏每个音符所需的手指和手部特定动作，而不是专注于最终的旋律，他的演奏几乎肯定会受到影响。因此，在大多数情况下，程序性记忆根本不需要有意识地提取。然而，这并不是说助记符与程序性记忆无关。通过强化与特定程序相关的行为来增强编码的助记符，即使没有有意识地提取，最终也会提高演奏表现。

Procedural memories are thought to be retrieved and utilized without conscious awareness (Tulving, 1985). Furthermore, conscious awareness of procedural information can interfere with performance of a skill. Consider the case of a guitarist giving a solo performance of a difficult composition. If he were to attend to the specific movements of his fingers and hands required to play each note rather than devoting his attention to the resulting melody, his performance would almost certainly suffer. Thus, in most cases, procedural memories do not require conscious retrieval at all. However, that is not to say that mnemonics are not relevant to procedural memories. Mnemonics that enhance encoding by reinforcing the behaviors associated with a given procedure will ultimately enhance performance even without conscious retrieval.

回顾性记忆和前瞻性记忆

Retrospective and Prospective Memory

选择合适的助记符时要考虑的另一个区别是，需要增强的记忆是回顾性的还是前瞻性的自然。回溯记忆涉及回忆以前学过的信息，例如去朋友家的路。前瞻性记忆涉及记住将来要做的事情，例如记得带上答应带到朋友家的那瓶酒。虽然回溯记忆比前瞻性记忆研究得更广泛，但这两种记忆都很重要，而且相互依存。考虑一位老年人，她每天需要服用几种药物。她不仅必须记住在适当的时间服用每种药物，还必须记住药物的位置。如果前瞻性记忆失败，那么她就会忘记在适当的时间服药，她的健康可能会受到危害。如果她记得在适当的时间服药，但不记得最后把药放在哪里，那么结果是一样的：没有服用必要的药物。

Another distinction to consider when choosing an appropriate mnemonic is whether the memory to be enhanced is retrospective or prospective in nature. Retrospective memory involves recalling information that has been learned previously such as directions to a friend’s house. Prospective memory involves remembering to do something in the future such as remembering to take the bottle of wine you promised to bring to your friend’s house. Although retrospective memory has been researched much more extensively than prospective memory, both types of memory are important, and they are interdependent. Consider an older person who has been prescribed several daily medications. Not only must she remember to take each medication at the appropriate time, but she must also remember where the medications are located. If prospective memory fails, then the person forgets to take the medicine at the appropriate time, and her health could be jeopardized. If she remembers to take the medication at the appropriate time but cannot remember where she last placed it, then the result is the same: The necessary medication is not taken.

前瞻性记忆失败——有时也称为心不在焉的遗忘（Schacter & Wiseman, 2006）——在注意力分散于多项不同任务时尤其严重。此外，如果预期任务与高度脚本化或常规化的任务相冲突，则更容易发生遗忘（Hay & Jacoby, 1996; Sellen, 1994）。例如，假设一个人的日常生活包括工作到下午4:30，从4:45到5:30在健身房锻炼，然后沿着特定的路线开车回家，正好赶上吃丈夫准备好的晚餐。与日常生活变化较大的人相比，这个人回家路上忘记买汉堡包的可能性要大得多。

Prospective memory failure—sometimes referred to as absentminded forgetting (Schacter & Wiseman, 2006)—can be especially problematic when attention is divided among several different tasks. Moreover, if the intended task competes with a highly scripted or routinized task, then forgetting is even more likely (Hay & Jacoby, 1996; Sellen, 1994). For example, consider a person whose daily routine involves working until 4:30 p.m., working out at the gym from 4:45 to 5:30, and then driving a particular route that will bring her home just in time to eat dinner that has been prepared by her husband. This person will be far more likely to forget to pick up hamburger buns on the way home than a person whose routine is more variable.

考虑情境是否涉及回顾性记忆、前瞻性记忆，或两者兼而有之，是确定合适助记符的重要因素。一般而言，当所使用的助记符在待执行的具体任务与执行该任务的适当时间和情境之间建立紧密关联时，记忆力会得到提升 (Engelkamp, 1998)。此外，提供独特或独特线索的助记符尤其有用 (McDaniel & Einstein, 1993)。重要的是，回顾性记忆和前瞻性记忆任务都可以从这两个因素中受益。

Consideration of whether a situation involves a retrospective memory, a prospective memory, or both is an important factor for determining an appropriate mnemonic. In general, memory improves when the mnemonic used creates a strong association between the specific task to be performed and the appropriate time and context in which the task is to be performed (Engelkamp, 1998). In addition, mnemonics that provide unusual or distinctive cues can be especially helpful (McDaniel & Einstein, 1993). Importantly, both retrospective and prospective memory tasks may benefit from both factors.

□测试因素

□ Test Factors

人们在很多情况下都可能依赖助记符来提高记忆力。这些情况通常在需要从记忆中恢复哪些信息方面有所不同。一个主要的区别是识别和回忆。识别需要对特定的先前经验做出判断，而回忆需要再现。以某种形式记录经验。在回忆过程中，各种不同类型的信息和测试环境都会影响表现。因此，在选择合适的助记符时，务必考虑特定情境对记忆系统的要求。

There are numerous situations in which people may rely on mnemonics to improve memory. Often these situations differ in terms of what sort of information must be recovered from memory. A major demarcation is that between recognition and recall. Recognition requires a decision about a particular prior experience, whereas recall requires reproduction of the experience in some form. Within recall, a variety of different types of information and test environments can influence performance. Thus, it is important to consider the demands a particular situation places on the memory system when choosing an appropriate mnemonic.

记起

Recall

自由回忆。最难的记忆情况之一是自由回忆测试。测试自由回忆时，受试者必须在没有外部线索或极其笼统的线索的帮助下检索目标信息。想象一下，你周末参加了一个聚会，周一早上回到工作岗位后，被要求记住所有出席者。这项测试要求你对出席者的信息进行适当的编码，以易于获取的方式存储信息，并仅借助内部生成的线索进行检索。因此，自由回忆涉及三个基本的记忆过程：编码、存储和检索。为了成功地增强自由回忆，助记符必须包含能够强化每个过程的程序。然而，正如第三章将要讨论的那样，任何影响编码的过程也会影响检索。因此，助记符不需要为每个基本过程分别包含单独的程序。另一方面，需要注意的是，纯粹的组织性助记符（例如，图式和类别组织图式）可能会导致大量的回忆干扰。

Free Recall. One of the most difficult memory situations involves a test of free recall. When free recall is tested, one must retrieve target information without the aid of external cues or with cues that are extremely general. Imagine having attended a party over the weekend, and upon returning to work on Monday morning, you are asked remember all who were in attendance. This test requires proper encoding of information about the attendees, storage of the information in a way that is easily accessible, and retrieval with the benefit of only internally generated cues. Thus, free recall involves three fundamental memory processes: encoding, storage, and retrieval. To successfully enhance free recall, a mnemonic must include procedures that strengthen each of these processes. However, as will be discussed in Chapter 3, any procedure that affects encoding will also influence retrieval. So, a mnemonic need not include separate procedures for each of the fundamental processes. On the other hand, it should be noted that purely organizational mnemonics (e.g., schema and category organizational schemes) are likely to result in a high number of recall intrusions.

序列回忆。序列回忆是一种自由回忆，其中目标信息必须按照特定顺序回忆。例如，在没有菜谱的情况下，尝试回忆如何制作海鲜秋葵浓汤时，必须记住所有必要的食材以及食材组合的有序步骤。未能记住所有食材或未能按正确顺序回忆步骤都可能对秋葵浓汤的口感产生负面影响。事实上，在美国某些地区，如果海鲜秋葵浓汤的制作过程中没有先调好面糊，就会被视为亵渎！在这个例子中，记住食材需要自由回忆，但记住食材的添加顺序则需要序列回忆。控制序列回忆的过程与控制自由回忆的过程相似。然而，序列回忆比自由回忆更依赖于组织过程。因此，在测试序列回忆的情境中，成功的记忆方法必须包含能够有效增强待记忆信息组织结构的编码程序。也许是由于这种类型的记忆测试相对困难，人们设计了几种正式的助记符来增强序列回忆。

Serial Recall. Serial recall is a form of free recall in which target information must be recalled in a specified order. For example, when attempting to remember how to make seafood gumbo in the absence of a recipe, one must remember all of the necessary ingredients as well ordered steps for the combination of ingredients. Either failure to remember all of the ingredients or failure to recall the steps in the correct order could negatively affect the taste of the gumbo. Indeed, a preparation of seafood gumbo that does not begin with a good roux is considered sacrilege in some parts of the United States! In this example, remembering the ingredients would involve free recall, but remembering the order of inclusion of the ingredients would involve serial recall. The processes that govern serial recall are similar to the processes that govern free recall. However, serial recall is far more dependent on the organizational process than is free recall. As such, a successful mnemonic for situations in which serial recall is tested must include encoding procedures that strongly enhance the organizational structure of the to-be-remembered information. Perhaps as a result of the relative difficulty of this type of memory test, several formal mnemonics have been devised to enhance serial recall.

线索回忆。在线索回忆测试中，学习者会在测试时获得线索，以帮助其检索目标信息。可以很容易假设线索回忆总是比自由回忆更容易。然而，线索回忆的成功率会因所提供线索的质量和恰当性而有很大差异。如前所述，情境线索对语义记忆的检索不如对情景记忆的检索那么有效。此外，有些线索甚至会对检索产生抑制作用。

Cued Recall. In a cued recall test, the learner is provided with a cue to aid retrieval of the target information at the time of testing. One may be tempted to assume that cued recall is always easier than free recall. However, cued recall success varies widely with the quality and appropriateness of the provided cue. As mentioned earlier, a contextual cue will not facilitate retrieval of a semantic memory as well as it might facilitate an episodic memory. In addition, some cues can even have an inhibitory effect on retrieval.

Brown (1979) 的一项研究很好地证明了线索回忆的抑制效应。在该研究中，受试者被呈现了一些出现频率相对较低的词汇定义。在每个定义之后，研究人员会提供一个语义相关、一个正字法相关或一个无关的线索，用于检索目标词。结果表明，正字法线索促进回忆，而语义线索则抑制回忆。同样，Roediger、Stellon 和 Tulving (1977) 发现，相对于自由回忆，对包含目标词列表的词汇进行线索回忆会抑制回忆。这两项研究的结果都可以解释为，每项研究中引起抑制的线索与待回忆的信息非常相似。线索与目标信息之间的高度相似性会导致激活，从而导致在检索时线索和目标之间产生竞争。因此，目标信息的检索可能会受到相关信息的阻碍——这种情况被称为“丑姐妹效应”（Reason & Lucas，1984）。抑制性线索的问题凸显了选择合适的助记符的重要性，因为在测试线索回忆时，这些助记符能够产生高度可辨别的记忆表征。例如，那些在编码过程中利用独特加工或想象加工的助记符，对于增强线索回忆而言，是比较安全的选择。

A study by Brown (1979) provides a good demonstration of an inhibitory effect in cued recall. In that study, participants were presented with definitions of words with a relatively low frequency of occurrence. Following each definition, a semantically related cue, an orthographically related cue, or an unrelated cue was provided for the retrieval of the target word. The results indicated that orthographic cues facilitated recall, but semantic cues inhibited recall. Similarly, Roediger, Stellon, and Tulving (1977) found that cueing recall of a list of words with items from the target list inhibited recall relative to free recall of the list. The results of both studies can be explained by the fact that the cues causing inhibition in each study were very similar to the information to be recalled. High similarity between a cue and target information can result in activation that leads to competition between the cue and the target at the time of retrieval. As such, the retrieval of target information can be blocked by the related information—a situation referred to as an “ugly sister effect” (Reason & Lucas, 1984). The problem of inhibitory cues underscores the importance of choosing a mnemonic, which results in a highly discriminable memory representation when cued recall will be tested.
