For example, mnemonics that capitalize on distinctive processing or imaginal elaboration at encoding would be safe bets for enhancing cued recall.

同样值得注意的是，能够有效增强自由回忆的记忆术并不一定能提高线索回忆的表现，反之亦然。例如，Wollen 和 Cox (1981) 证明，奇异意象的记忆效果取决于记忆测试的类型。具体而言，他们的结果表明，在提高自由回忆方面，奇异意象比普通意象更有效，但在测试线索回忆时，普通意象比奇异意象更有效。然而，需要注意的是，这种结果模式可能会受到其他变量的影响（参见“保留间隔”部分）。

It is also important to note that mnemonics that are effective in enhancing free recall do not necessarily improve cued recall performance and vice versa. For example, Wollen and Cox (1981) demonstrated that the mnemonic effectiveness of bizarre imagery depends on the type of memory test. Specifically, their results indicated that bizarre imagery was more effective than common imagery in improving free recall but that common imagery was more effective than bizarre imagery when cued recall was tested. It should be noted, however, that this pattern of results can be moderated by other variables (see the Retention Interval section).

认出

Recognition

在再认测试中，学习者会被展示一个物品，并被要求判断该物品是否在学习情境中出现过。因此，再认测试包含一些先前学习过的信息，以及一些相对于待学习信息而言是新的信息。在这种情境中，一个人必须从警方的排队是再认测试的一个例子。在这种情况下，犯罪者可能在队伍中，也可能不在。因此，正确的再认需要确定队伍中的每个人是否与记忆中存储的犯罪者表征相符。需要注意的是，成功的再认较少依赖于目标信息的检索，而是依赖于回忆，2因为在前一种情况下，待评估的项目会在测试中呈现，而在后一种情况下则不会。因此，与适用于提示回忆的助记符一样，用于测试再认记忆情境的助记符也应包含能够最大程度提高记忆表征可辨别性的程序。

In a test of recognition, the learner is presented with an item and asked to determine whether it had been present in the learning situation. As such, a recognition test includes some previously learned information and some information that is new relative to the to-be-learned information. A situation in which a person must identify a perpetrator from a police lineup is an example of a recognition test. In this situation, the perpetrator may or may not be present within the lineup. Thus, correct recognition involves determining whether each person in the lineup matches the representation of the perpetrator stored in memory. Notice that successful recognition depends less on the retrieval of target information than recall, 2 because in the former case the item to be assessed is presented at testing whereas in the latter case it is not. Thus, like those appropriate for cued recall, mnemonics used for situations in which recognition memory is tested should include procedures that maximize the discriminability of the memory representation.

人们通常认为识别比回忆更容易。然而，如果待记忆目标与非目标干扰项（陪衬或诱饵）之间存在高度相似性，则识别会比回忆更困难。此外，这种相似性的存在可能会导致较高的错误识别率。另一方面，陪衬之间明显缺乏相似性也会增加错误识别的可能性 (Loftus, 1979)。例如，如果犯罪嫌疑人被描述为有纹身，而陪衬人员主要没有纹身，那么从陪衬人员中误认出有纹身的陪衬人员的概率，要高于从所有嫌疑人都有纹身的陪衬人员中误认出同一有纹身的陪衬人员的概率。毋庸置疑，将无辜者误认为犯罪者可能会造成毁灭性的后果。这种可能性进一步强调了记忆术的重要性，因为记忆术可以在测试再认记忆的情境中提供高度可辨别的记忆痕迹。

Recognition is often assumed to be easier than recall. However, high similarity between the to-be-remembered target and nontarget distractors (foils or lures) can make recognition more difficult than recall. Moreover, the existence of such similarities can result in a high level of misidentification. On the other hand, a blatant lack of similarity among foils can also increase the possibility of misidentification (Loftus, 1979). For example, if the perpetrator of a crime is described as having a tattoo and the lineup includes mainly foils without tattoos, the probability of mistakenly identifying a tattooed foil from the lineup is greater than the probability of identifying the same tattooed foil from a lineup in which all suspects have tattoos. Needless to say, the mistaken identification of an innocent person as a perpetrator could have devastating consequences. This possibility further underscores the importance of mnemonics that lead to highly discriminable memory traces for situations in which recognition memory will be tested.

决策过程对再认记忆的影响是选择合适助记符时需要考虑的另一个因素。Tanner 和 Swets (1954) 发展了一种目标刺激检测理论，该理论与再认记忆判断尤为相关。应用于再认，该理论表明，再认判断既受待记忆信息的可辨别性影响，也受决策过程的影响。例如，如果正确识别的回报大于错误识别的成本，则决策阈值会降低，导致正确识别和错误识别的概率都会增加。回到我们之前提到的警方列队的例子，高回报和低成本会增加识别罪犯的可能性。然而，这也会增加证人从列队中误认无辜嫌疑人的概率。这种模式——被称为“自由反应偏差”——反映了识别所需的证据门槛较低。相反，如果成本大于回报，则需要更多证据才能做出正确识别。这被称为“保守反应偏差”。这些偏见是一个重要的考虑因素，因为一些记忆策略是专门为减少识别偏见而设计的。

The influence of decision-making processes on recognition memory is another factor to consider when selecting an appropriate mnemonic. Tanner and Swets (1954) developed a theory of the detection of target stimuli that is especially relevant to recognition-memory judgments. Applied to recognition, this theory suggests the recognition judgments are influenced by both the discriminability of the to-be-remembered information and the decision-making processes. For example, if the rewards for correct recognition outweigh the costs of misidentifications, then the decision-making threshold lowers, resulting in an increase in both correct identifications and misidentifications. Going back to our example of a police lineup, high reward and low cost would increase the likelihood of identifying the perpetrator. However, it would also increase the probability that the witness misidentifies an innocent suspect from the lineup. This pattern—known as a liberal response bias—reflects a lower threshold of evidence required for identification. Conversely, if costs outweigh rewards, then more evidence is required for a positive identification. This is known as a conservative response bias. These biases are an important consideration because some mnemonic strategies are designed specifically to reduce recognition bias.

McAllister、Bearden、Kohlmaier 和 Warner（1997）提供了一个旨在减少偏见的外部记忆法示例。这些作者考察了可能影响使用“嫌疑人识别簿”程序识别犯罪嫌疑人的因素。具体而言，他们考察了包含语音和步态等动态嫌疑人特征的计算机化“嫌疑人识别簿”能否减少对无辜嫌疑人的错误识别。本研究的参与者观看了一段犯罪录像，然后观看了以下三种类型的“嫌疑人识别簿”中的一种：始终包含动态信息的计算机化“嫌疑人识别簿”；如果参与者选择查看，则显示动态信息的“嫌疑人识别簿”；以及不包含动态信息的“嫌疑人识别簿”。结果表明，如果参与者选择查看，则显示动态信息的“嫌疑人识别簿”的错误识别率低于不包含动态信息的“嫌疑人识别簿”。重要的是，错误识别率的下降并没有导致正确识别率的相应下降。这表明，动态信息提供的额外线索减少了自由主义反应。

McAllister, Bearden, Kohlmaier, and Warner (1997) provided an example of an external mnemonic designed to reduce bias. These authors examined factors that could influence identification of a perpetrator using a mug book procedure. Specifically, they examined the possibility that a computerized mug book that includes dynamic suspect characteristics such as voice and gait could reduce the number of misidentifications of innocent suspects. Participants in this study watched a videotaped crime and then viewed one of three types of mug books: a computerized mug book that always included dynamic information, a mug book that made dynamic information available if the participant chose to examine it, or a mug book that contained no dynamic information. The results indicated that mug books that made dynamic information available if the participant wished to examine it resulted in fewer misidentifications than mug books that did not include dynamic information. Importantly, the decrease in misidentifications occurred without a corresponding decrease in the number of correct identifications. This suggests that the additional cues provided by the dynamic information led to a reduction in liberal responding.

保留间隔

Retention Interval

选择助记符时需要考虑的另一个重要因素是从学习到记忆测试之间的时间间隔。事实上，一些研究人员（例如，Wang & Thomas，2000）认为，长期记忆力的提升能力是衡量助记符整体有效性的重要试金石。值得注意的是，有些助记符在短保留间隔内能增强记忆力，但在长保留间隔内则无效。而有些助记符在长保留间隔后有效，但在短保留间隔后无效。

Another important factor to consider when choosing a mnemonic is the amount of time that will elapse between learning and the memory test. Indeed, some researchers (e.g., Wang & Thomas, 2000) have suggested that the ability to improve memory over an extended period of time is an important litmus test for determining the overall effectiveness of a mnemonic. Importantly, some mnemonics enhance memory at short retention intervals but not at long intervals. Other mnemonics are effective after long retention intervals but not after short ones.

Krinsky 和 ​​Krinsky (1994, 1996) 的研究表明，挂钩词法的有效性可能会随着记忆间隔的长短而波动。具体来说，这两位作者考察了挂钩词法作为一种提高五年级学生连续回忆言语材料的技巧的有效性。两项研究的结果都表明，在立即进行记忆测试时，接受过挂钩词法训练的学生的回忆效果优于未经训练的对照组。然而，在48小时的延迟后，挂钩词法并没有改善对照组的记忆效果。

Research by Krinsky and Krinsky (1994, 1996) suggests that the effectiveness of the peg-word method may fluctuate depending on the length of the retention interval. Specifically, these authors examined the effectiveness of the peg-word method as a technique for improving serial recall of verbal material among fifth graders. The results of both studies indicated better recall for those who were trained to use the peg-word method relative to untrained controls when memory was tested immediately. However, after a 48-hour delay, the peg-word method did not improve memory relative to the control condition.

另一方面，有些记忆法在延迟一段时间后比立即进行记忆测试时更有效。在本章前面，我们提出，在线索回忆测试中，常见意象比奇异意象更有效。然而，研究表明，这种效应受到保留间隔长度的调节。具体来说，O'Brien 和 Wolford (1982) 发现，尽管没有显著差异短暂延迟后的图像类型之间，在 1 周的保留间隔后，奇怪的图像比常见的图像导致明显更好的提示回忆表现。

On the other hand, some mnemonics are more effective after a delay than when memory is tested immediately. Earlier in this chapter, we suggested that common imagery is more effective than bizarre imagery when cued recall is tested. However, research has shown that this effect is moderated by the length of retention interval. Specifically, O’Brien and Wolford (1982) found that although there were no significant differences between imagery types after a short delay, bizarre imagery led to significantly better cued recall performance than common imagery after a 1-week retention interval.

正如奇异想象的例子所示，许多情境因素决定了特定助记符的有效性。一个助记符在某些情况下可能非常有效，但在其他情况下却完全无效。因此，为了在不同的测试情境中获得一致的记忆增强效果，可能需要运用多种助记符。

As the example of bizarre imagery demonstrates, numerous situational factors determine the effectiveness of a given mnemonic. A mnemonic may be very effective in some situations but not at all effective in others. As such, an arsenal of mnemonics may be necessary to obtain consistent memory enhancement across different testing situations.

□个体差异

□ Individual Differences

能力差异

Differences in Aptitude

记忆技巧的有效性也因人而异。例如，Griffith 和 Actkinson (1978) 证明，挂钩词法的有效性与一般能力相关。在本研究中，使用军队职业能力倾向测验的算术推理和语言分量表来测量一般能力。代表高、中、低能力的参与者要么没有接受任何指导，要么在学习三个数字-名词关联列表之前接受了挂钩词法的使用指导。结果表明，只有高能力的参与者受益于记忆训练。基于这些结果，有人可能会认为挂钩词法仅对少数人群有用。然而，更可能的解释是，中、低能力的参与者在按照指导使用该方法时比高能力的参与者遇到更多困难。无论如何，本研究的结果与以下观点一致：不熟练的学习者不太可能立即有效地使用具有大量或复杂程序的助记符。

The effectiveness of mnemonic techniques also varies among individuals. As an example, Griffith and Actkinson (1978) demonstrated that the effectiveness of the peg-word method was related to general aptitude. In this study, general aptitude was measured using the arithmetic reasoning and verbal subscales of the Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery. Participants representing high, medium, and low aptitude either received no instructions or were instructed in the use of the peg-word method prior to learning three lists of digit–noun associations. The results indicated that only the high-aptitude participants benefited from the mnemonic training. On the basis of these results, one might argue that the peg-word method is useful for only a minority of the population. However, a more likely explanation is that the medium- and low-aptitude participants had more difficulty using the method as instructed than did the high-aptitude participants. Regardless, the results of this study are consistent with the notion that mnemonics with numerous or complicated procedures are unlikely to be immediately and effectively utilized by unskilled learners.

语言能力强的学习者可能比语言能力较弱的学习者更容易运用即使是简单的记忆术。事实上，先前的研究表明，词汇量强的人比词汇量弱的人更善于进行精细化处理和建立联想（Kyllonen、Tirre & Christal，1991）。此外，高能力个体的精细化处理通常比低能力个体的精细化处理更有效（Wang，1983）。

It may also be the case that learners with strong verbal abilities have an easier time employing even simple mnemonics than do those with lesser ability. Indeed, previous research suggests that individuals with strong vocabularies are better at generating elaboration and forming associations than individuals with weak vocabularies (Kyllonen, Tirre, & Christal, 1991). Moreover, the elaboration produced by high-ability individuals is generally more effective than elaboration produced by low-ability individuals (Wang, 1983).

上文描述的天赋与记忆术之间的关系，可能会让人认为记忆术对那些最需要它的人可能无效。然而，事实并非如此。虽然天赋高的人确实可能更多地学习和受益于记忆术，但研究表明，几乎任何能力水平的学习者，只要有足够的学习时间和适当的指导，都能从正式的记忆术中获益 (Bellezza, 1996)。然而，对于能力低下的学习者来说，程序复杂的记忆术可能尤其难以掌握。当我们在第8章讨论记忆术在认知康复中的应用时，这个问题将会变得尤为突出。

The relationship between aptitude and mnemonics described above may lead one to believe that mnemonics may be ineffective for those who need them most. However, this is not the case. Although it is true that high-aptitude individuals may learn and benefit from mnemonics more rapidly than those displaying low aptitude, research suggests that learners at nearly any level of ability, given enough learning time and proper instruction, can benefit from even formal mnemonics (Bellezza, 1996). Regardless, it is likely that mnemonics with complicated procedures are especially cumbersome for low-aptitude learners. This issue will loom very large when we take up the discussion of mnemonics in cognitive rehabilitation in Chapter 8.

性格差异

Personality Differences

关于人格变量与记忆术有效性之间关系的研究很少。然而，现有研究表明，人格差异可能会影响某些记忆术的有效性。例如，Moss、Worthen、Haydel、Mac Mahon 和 Savoy（2008）研究了几种人格变量与怪异意象在增强自由回忆方面的有效性之间的关系。结果表明，较高的唤醒寻求倾向和较高的保守性都与怪异意象的有效性增强相关。然而，值得注意的是，本研究中的参与者并没有生成他们自己的怪异和常见的阐释，而是被要求根据提供的句子（一半怪异，一半常见）形成心理意象。因此，尚不清楚这些人格变量是否也与自我生成的阐释的记忆术有效性相关。此外，作者还提出，保守性和怪异阐释有效性之间的关系与对怪异的防御性反应有关。因此，保守性较高的个体可能不太可能主动选择包含奇异修饰的助记符。尽管如此，本研究至少表明，当外部来源（例如课堂上的教师）将包含奇异修饰的助记符强加给学习者时，个体差异可能会影响其有效性。

Very little work is available on the relationship between personality variables and mnemonic effectiveness. However, the existing research suggests that personality differences may influence the effectiveness of some mnemonics. For example, Moss, Worthen, Haydel, Mac Mahon, and Savoy (2008) examined relationships among several personality variables and the effectiveness of bizarre imagery in enhancing free recall. The results indicated that high arousal-seeking tendency and high conservatism were each related to increased effectiveness of bizarre imagery. However, it is important to note that participants in this study did not generate their own bizarre and common elaboration but instead were asked to form mental images based on provided sentences (half bizarre and half common). Thus, it is not clear whether these personality variables would also be related to the mnemonic effectiveness of self-generated elaboration. Also, the authors suggested that the relationship between conservatism and the effectiveness of bizarre elaboration was related to a defensive response to bizarreness. Thus, it may be that individuals high in conservatism would be unlikely to willingly choose a mnemonic that incorporates the use of bizarre elaboration. Nonetheless, at the very least, this study shows that individual differences may govern the effectiveness of mnemonics that incorporate bizarre elaboration when such mnemonics are imposed upon learners by an external source (e.g., an instructor in a classroom).

类似地，Cimbalo、Clark 和 Matayev（2003）研究了感觉寻求与隔离效应之间的关系。隔离效应是指对某个在显著维度上与所有其他待记忆项目不同的项目的记忆增强。结果表明，高感觉寻求与隔离效应增强有关，当列表项目同时呈现 10 秒时，但当呈现 2 秒时则无关紧要。虽然这些结果可能对基于独特性的助记符的使用有所启发，但它们与先前的研究（Gratzinger、Sheikh、Friedman 和 Yesavage，1990 年；Moss 等人，2008 年；Zoller、Workman 和 Kroll，1989 年）不一致，这些研究未能发现感觉寻求与记忆有效性之间的显著关系。

In a similar vein, Cimbalo, Clark, and Matayev (2003) examined the relationship between sensation seeking and the isolation effect. The isolation effect refers to enhanced memory for an item that differs from all other to-be-remembered items on some noticeable dimension. The results indicated that high sensation seeking was related to an increased isolation effect with a 10-second simultaneous presentation of list items but not with a 2-second presentation. Although these results may have implications for the use of distinctiveness-based mnemonics, they are inconsistent with previous research (Gratzinger, Sheikh, Friedman, & Yesavage, 1990; Moss et al., 2008; Zoller, Workman, & Kroll, 1989), which has failed to find a significant relationship between sensation seeking and mnemonic effectiveness.

两项涉及老年人的研究（Finkel & Yesavage，1989；Gratzinger 等人，1990）发现，开放性经验和记忆力提高之间的关系取决于记忆训练期间使用的教学方法。开放性经验是一个人格变量，它区分了愿意接受新体验的人和喜欢更熟悉体验的人（Costa & McCrae，1976）。Finkel 和 Yesavage 发现，在使用位置法接受计算机辅助教学的老年参与者中，开放性经验和记忆力提高之间存在显著的正相关关系。然而，对于接受标准教学的参与者，开放性经验与记忆力提高无关。此外，Gratzinger 等人发现，开放性经验量表的幻想分量表与某些记忆训练方法后的记忆力提高之间存在显著的关系。幻想分量表衡量一个人的想象力和活跃幻想生活的程度。因此，当记忆训练辅以想象训练时，幻想分数越高，从记忆训练中获得的益处也就不足为奇了。然而，当记忆训练辅以放松训练时，幻想分数越高，从记忆训练中获得的益处就越小。

Two studies involving older adults (Finkel & Yesavage, 1989; Gratzinger et al., 1990) found a relationship between openness to experience and memory improvement that is dependent on the method of instruction used during mnemonic training. Openness to experience is a personality variable that differentiates between people who are open to new experiences and those who prefer more familiar experiences (Costa & McCrae, 1976). Finkel and Yesavage found a significant positive relationship between openness to experience and memory improvement among older participants who received computer-aided instruction in the use of the method of loci. However, openness to experience was not related to memory improvement for participants who received standard instruction. In addition, Gratzinger et al. found a significant relationship between the fantasy subscale of the openness to experience scale and memory improvement after certain methods of mnemonic training. The fantasy subscale measures the extent to which one is imaginative and has an active fantasy life. Thus, it is not surprising that high fantasy scores were related to greater benefit from mnemonic training when that training was supplemented with imagery training. However, when the mnemonic training was supplemented with relaxation training, high fantasy scores were related to less mnemonic benefit.

一般来说，学习者应该选择适合自己学习风格和能力的助记符。例如，视觉型学习者可能最适合基于图像的助记符。另一方面，听觉型学习者可能最适合基于押韵的助记符。无论学习风格和能力如何，都应该选择一种舒适的、能让人自信地进入学习状态的助记符。

As a general statement, learners should choose mnemonics that fit well their own personal learning style and abilities. For example, highly visual learners may benefit most from imagery-based mnemonics. On the other hand, primarily auditory learners may benefit most from rhyme-based mnemonics. Regardless of learning style and ability, one should always select a mnemonic that is comfortable and allows one to enter into a learning situation with confidence.

□内部与外部助记符

□ Internal Versus External Mnemonics

在第一章中，我们将外部助记符定义为为了提高记忆力而置于环境中的提示。内部助记符则被定义为一种认知策略，旨在增强信息的编码，从而可能增强信息的存储和检索。虽然本书主要关注内部助记符背后的过程，但外部助记符也被广泛使用，并且在某些情况下非常有效。

In Chapter 1, we defined an external mnemonic as a cue placed in the environment in order to improve memory. An internal mnemonic was defined as a cognitive strategy designed to enhance the encoding of information and, as a result, may enhance storage and retrieval. Although the processes that underlie internal mnemonics are the primary focus of this book, external mnemonics are widely used and quite effective in some circumstances.

区分助记符和记录

Distinguishing Mnemonics From Records

首先，我们希望区分外部记忆和需要记住的信息记录。一份书面的购物清单

First, we wish to draw a distinction between an external mnemonic and a record of to-be-remembered information. A written grocery list that

表 2.1杂货商品完整清单和简明助记符列表
购物清单 助记符列表
西红柿意大利面晚餐的材料
蘑菇早餐食品
面条化妆品
法式面包
红葡萄酒
鸡蛋
熏肉
果冻
饼干
橙汁
卫生纸
牙膏
肥皂
联系解决方案
剃须刀片

包含所有必须购买的物品的清单不是外部助记符。但是，如果清单包含提示而不是具体物品，则该清单就是助记符。考虑表 2.1 第一列中的购物清单。此清单包含假设的杂货店之旅所需的所有物品，因此不是助记符。它不是助记符，因为它不帮助记忆——它只是取代了记忆的需要。另一方面，表 2.1第二列中的清单是外部助记符，因为它由一组旨在帮助检索所有要购买物品的提示组成。这种特殊的外部助记符使用分类组织将购物清单压缩为更小、更易于管理的列表。请注意，此助记符旨在通过启动列表中所代表的项目类别来提示列表项目的记忆。因此，这种类型的助记符可能会受到回忆入侵的影响。事实上，“早餐食品”这个分类标签可能会导致召回某种商品，例如华夫饼糖浆，而这种商品原本并没有出现在清单上。考虑到在大多数情况下，忘记一件需要的商品比购买一件并非立即需要的商品更糟糕，这个问题相对较小。

includes every item that must be purchased is not an external mnemonic. However, if the list contains cues rather than specific items, then the list is a mnemonic. Consider the grocery list in the first column of Table 2.1. This list contains all items needed from a hypothetical trip to the grocery store and is thus not a mnemonic. It is not a mnemonic because it does not aid memory—it simply replaces the need to remember. On the other hand, the list in the second column of Table 2.1 is an external mnemonic because it is composed of a set of cues designed to aid the retrieval of all items to be purchased. This particular external mnemonic uses a categorical organization to condense the grocery list into a smaller more manageable list. Notice that this mnemonic is designed to cue memory for list items by priming the categories of items represented in the list. As such, this type of mnemonic may be subject to recall intrusions. Indeed, the category label “breakfast foods” could lead to the recall of an item such as waffle syrup that did not appear on the original list. This problem is relatively minor considering that, in most cases, it would be worse to forget a needed item than to purchase an item that is not needed immediately.

列表构造的助记属性

Mnemonic Properties of List Construction

如前所述，如果在检索时参考列表，则完整列表不被视为助记符。然而，研究这表明，构建完整列表可能具有助记特性。Intons-Peterson 和 Fournier (1986) 发现，即使在检索时无法获取列表，准备列表也能增强对待记杂货商品的记忆（另见 Barnett、Di Vesta 和 Rogozinski，1981）。显然，构建列表足以增强编码，从而提高记忆力。在这种情况下，构建列表可以被视为一种死记硬背的形式，因此可以被视为一种内部助记符。

As mentioned previously, a complete list is not considered a mnemonic if one refers to the list at the time of retrieval. However, research has indicated that construction of a complete list may have mnemonic properties. Intons-Peterson and Fournier (1986) found that preparing a list enhanced memory for to-be-remembered grocery items even when the list was not available at the time of retrieval (see also Barnett, Di Vesta, & Rogozinski, 1981). Apparently, the construction of the list sufficiently enhances encoding to the point that it results in memory improvement. In this case, list construction would be a form of rote rehearsal and would thus be considered a type of internal mnemonic.

在一项与Intons-Peterson和Fournier（1986）的研究略有类似的研究中，Brooks、Friedman和Yesavage（2003）发现，指导老年人准备一份文字的基因位点列表，可以增强他们对单词列表的记忆，尽管测试时参与者不允许查看他们的基因位点列表。虽然这项研究同时涉及内部和外部的记忆因素，但它再次证明了列表构建的记忆特性。

In a study somewhat similar to that of Intons-Peterson and Fournier(1986), Brooks, Friedman, and Yesavage (2003) found that instructing older adults to prepare a written list of loci enhanced memory for a list of words despite the fact that participants were not allowed to view their loci list at testing. Although this study involved both internal and external mnemonic factors, it again demonstrates the mnemonic properties of list construction.

常用外部助记符

Common External Mnemonics

与上面提供的例子相比，大多数外部助记符与记录和内部助记符的区别更明显。谚语中系在手指上的绳子是一种经常被提及但很少使用的外部助记符。更常用的例子包括个人闹钟、大纲、图片和将物品放置在特定位置作为记忆的提示。个人闹钟通常包括发出音调或旋律，以发出必须完成任务的信号。但请注意，要成功完成任务，需要记住音调所表示的行动方针。人们很容易想象这样一种情况，一个人忘记了自己最初为什么要设置闹钟。这种失败与我们之前讨论的前瞻记忆相对应，在前瞻记忆中，人们记得需要做某事，但记不住那是什么事。

Most external mnemonics are more obviously distinguished from records and internal mnemonics than the examples provided above. The proverbial string tied around a finger is an often mentioned, but rarely used, external mnemonic. More commonly used examples include personal alarms, outlines, pictures, and placing items in locations as cues for remembering. A personal alarm typically involves the sounding of an auditory tone or melody that serves a signal that a task must be completed. Note, however, that successful completion of the task requires that one remembers what course of action is being signified by the tone. One could easily imagine a situation in which a person fails to remember why he set the alarm in the first place. Such a failure corresponds to our previous discussion of prospective memory in which one remembers that something needs to be done but cannot remember what that something is.

提纲是一种助记符列表，它为学习者提供了一组主题，旨在提示记忆每个主题下包含的更详细的信息。图片和照片也可以用来提示记忆。虽然徒步旅行中露营地的照片可以永久记录该地点，但它也可以提示关于照片中未直接呈现的旅行其他方面的记忆。后一种功能是如何将图片用作助记符的一个例子。放置法是指将一个物体放在某个位置，作为要执行的操作的提醒。例如，如果需要记住将书归还图书馆，可以把书放在门口。请注意，这本书起到了提示的作用，提醒人们执行将其归还图书馆的任务。因此，在这种情况下，要记住的信息是使用这本书要执行的任务，而不是这本书本身。

Outlines are a type of mnemonic list that provides the learner with a set of topics designed to cue memory for more detailed information subsumed under each topic. Pictures and photographs can also be used to cue memories. Although a photograph of the campsite from a hiking trip provides a permanent record of the site, it can also cue memories about other aspects of the trip that are not directly represented in the picture. The latter function is an example of how pictures can be used as mnemonics. The place method involves leaving an object in a location that will serve as a reminder of an action to be performed. For example, if one needs to remember to return a book to the library, one could leave the book by the door. Notice that the book serves as a cue to remind one to perform the task of returning it to the library. Thus, the to-be-remembered information in this situation is the task to be performed with the book, not the book itself.

使用外部助记符的原因

Reasons for the Use of External Mnemonics

有趣的是，助记符列表和放置方法是非心理学家最常用的记忆辅助工具（Park、Smith 和 Cavanaugh，1990）。此外，研究（Cavanaugh、Grady 和 Perlmutter，1983）表明外部助记符比内部助记符使用得更频繁。这一发现可能有几个原因。首先，公众可能不知道有各种各样有效的内部记忆技巧可供使用。即使粗略地了解这些技巧的存在，潜在用户也可能不知道任何给定助记符的具体应用。如第 1 章所述，助记符的误用——尤其是正式助记符——可能会导致对所有内部助记符的普遍怀疑。

Interestingly, mnemonic lists and the place method are the memory aids most frequently used by nonpsychologists (Park, Smith, & Cavanaugh, 1990). Moreover, research (Cavanaugh, Grady, & Perlmutter, 1983) suggests that external mnemonics are used more frequently than internal mnemonics. There are several possible reasons for this finding. First, it is likely that the general public is not aware of the variety of effective internal techniques available for improving memory. Even if there is cursory knowledge of the existence of such techniques, it is likely that potential users are unaware of the specific application for which any given mnemonic is designed. As mentioned in Chapter 1, a misapplication of a mnemonic— especially a formal mnemonic—may lead to a general skepticism related to all internal mnemonics.

外部助记符比内部助记符使用更频繁的第二个原因可能与易用性有关。一般来说，使用外部助记符可以减少认知负荷，为学习者提供记忆的捷径。这种可能性似乎意味着外部助记符比内部助记符更有效。然而，情况并非一定如此。考虑这样一种情况，一个人完全依靠个人闹钟和助记符列表来帮助记忆。每天的记忆要求这个人每天设置大量的闹钟并管理大量的列表。在某种程度上，管理这样的列表本身就会给记忆系统带来负担。此外，可以想象，在不同时间间隔内频繁出现的声音警报会多么让朋友和同事感到不安。

A second reason that external mnemonics are more frequently used than internal mnemonics may be related to ease of use. In general, the use of external mnemonics reduces cognitive load and provides the learner with a shortcut to remembering. This possibility seems to imply that external mnemonics are more efficient than internal mnemonics. However, this is not necessarily the case. Consider a situation in which a person relies solely on personal alarms and mnemonic lists to aid remembering. The daily demands on memory would require this person to set numerous alarms and manage numerous lists per day. At some point, the management of such lists would itself tax the memory system. Moreover, one could imagine how frequent audible alarms occurring at variable intervals could unnerve friends and coworkers.

最适合使用

外部助记符的情况

Situations Most Amenable to the

Use of External Mnemonics

使用外部助记符还是内部助记符通常取决于个人偏好。然而，在某些情况下，一种或另一种类型的助记符可能最为合适。Intons-Peterson 和 Fournier (1986) 提出了六种使用外部助记符可能最为合适的情况：

The decision to use an external or internal mnemonic often boils down to personal preference. However, there may be situations in which one or the other type of mnemonic is most appropriate. Intons-Peterson and Fournier (1986) offered six situations in which the use of external mnemonics may be most appropriate:

  1. 当测试预期记忆时，
  2. when prospective memory will be tested,
  3. 当在一段极长的保留间隔后测试记忆时，
  4. when memory is tested after an extremely long retention interval,
  5. 当记忆不准确造成的后果很严重时，
  6. when the consequences of inaccurate remembering are steep,
  7. 当需要记住的信息特别复杂或难以理解时，
  8. when to-be-remembered information is especially complicated or otherwise difficult to comprehend,
  9. 当没有时间进行编码时，
  10. when there is little time for elaboration at encoding, and
  11. 当记忆负荷高或注意力分散时。
  12. when memory load is high or attention is divided.

虽然我们同意这些情况可以使用外部助记符，但需要注意的是，Intons-Peterson 和 Fournier (1986) 构建他们的列表时使用的外部助记符操作定义与本文所用的定义不同。具体而言，这些作者没有区分待记忆信息的记录和外部助记符。他们将诸如将待记忆信息写在手上之类的方法描述为外部助记符，而我们认为这些方法是待记忆信息的记录。尽管如此，Intons-Peterson 和 Fournier 列出的使用外部助记符的情况与本文所采用的方法非常吻合。

Although we agree that these situations are amenable to the use of external mnemonics, it should be noted that Intons-Peterson and Fournier (1986) constructed their list using an operational definition of external mnemonics different from that used here. Specifically, those authors did not make the distinction between a record of to-be-remembered information and an external mnemonic. They described methods such as writing to-beremembered information on one’s hand as an external mnemonic, whereas we consider such methods to be records of information to be remembered. Nevertheless, Intons-Peterson and Fournier’s list of situations for use of external mnemonics fits nicely with the approach taken here.

□ 自生成助记符与他人

生成的助记符

□ Self-Generated Versus Other-

Generated Mnemonics

在选择助记符时，一个常见的顾虑是学习者应该选择他人设计的现有助记符，还是自己生成助记符。使用他人生成的助记符的优势在于，通常存在其有效性的实证证据。此外，不了解助记符有效性背后机制的学习者可能会创建出有效性有限甚至完全无效的助记符。此外，创建助记符需要一定的创造力以及时间和精力。当然，学习他人生成的助记符——尤其是正式的助记符——也需要时间和精力。

A common concern in the selection of a mnemonic is whether learners should choose a preexisting mnemonic devised by someone else or generate the mnemonic themselves. An advantage of using other-generated mnemonics is that there often exists empirical evidence of their effectiveness. Moreover, learners who are unaware of the processes that underlie mnemonic effectiveness may create mnemonics that are limited in effectiveness or completely ineffective. In addition, the creation of mnemonics takes some amount of creativity as well as time and effort. Of course, other-generated mnemonics—especially formal mnemonics—also require time and effort to learn.

其他助记符的一个主要缺点是，使用者通常不了解特定方法的具体用途。由于构建助记符的人肯定知道其构建目的，因此误用其他助记符的概率远高于误用自创助记符的概率。自创助记符的另一个优势在于，它们可以根据个人的学习风格和偏好进行定制。

A major disadvantage of other-generated mnemonics is that those who use them are often unaware of the specific applications for which a given method is designed. Because the person who constructs a mnemonic is sure to know the purpose for which the mnemonic is constructed, the probability of misapplying an other-generated mnemonic is much higher than the probability of misapplying a self-generated mnemonic. Self-generated mnemonics are also advantageous in that they can be tailored to fit individual learning styles and preferences.

自创助记符的另一个主要优势是，它充分利用了一项公认的研究成果：自创信息比提供的信息更容易被记住 (Bobrow & Bower, 1969; Slamecka & Graf, 1978)。然而，在助记符的语境中，自创精加工的有效性取决于助记符的复杂性。例如，在使用简单的助记符时，自创精加工已被证明比其他助记符更有效 (Ironsmith & Lutz, 1996; Jamieson & Schimpf, 1980; Kuo & Hooper, 2004)，但对于难以理解的助记符则并非如此。使用（Patton、D'Agaro 和 Gaudette，1991）。这些发现强调了自我和他人生成的阐释以及自我和他人生成的记忆术之间的区别。自我生成的记忆术显然会包含自我生成的阐释，但他人生成的记忆术可能依赖于自我或他人生成的阐释。以常用于增强二语习得的关键词法为例。这种形式化方法涉及在外来词的含义和已知语言中发音与该外来词相似的单词之间形成心理图像。例如，为了学习西班牙语单词tiesto的意思是“花盆”，英语使用者必须形成一个图像，将花盆与发音与西班牙语单词tiesto相似的英语单词所表示的物体结合起来。在这种情况下，关键词法的支持者可能会建议使用英语单词tea来形成生长在花盆中的茶树的图像。或者，学习者可以选择自己生成英语单词，并结合此助记符使用。例如，学习者可以使用英语单词测试，构建关于花盆主题的多项选择题测试的形象。

Another major benefit of self-generated mnemonics is that they capitalize on the well-established finding that self-generated information is retained better than provided information (Bobrow & Bower, 1969; Slamecka & Graf, 1978). However, in the context of mnemonics, the effectiveness of self-generated elaboration depends on the complexity of the mnemonic. For example, self-generated elaboration has been demonstrated to be more effective than other-generated elaboration when using simple mnemonics (Ironsmith & Lutz, 1996; Jamieson & Schimpf, 1980; Kuo & Hooper, 2004) but not for mnemonics that are difficult to use (Patton, D’Agaro, & Gaudette, 1991). These findings highlight the distinction between self- and other-generated elaboration and self- and other-generated mnemonics. Self-generated mnemonics will obviously incorporate self-generated elaboration, but other-generated mnemonics may rely on self- or other-generated elaboration. Consider the case of the keyword method that is often used to enhance second-language acquisition. This formal method involves forming a mental image between the meaning of the foreign word and a word from the known language that sounds like the foreign word. For example, in an attempt to learn that the Spanish word tiesto means “flowerpot,” an English speaker must form an image that combines a flowerpot with an object represented by an English word that sounds similar to the Spanish word tiesto. In this case, a proponent of the keyword method might suggest that the English word tea be used to form an image of a tea bush growing in a flowerpot. Alternatively, learners may choose to generate their own English words for use with this mnemonic. For instance, a learner might use the English word test to form an image of a multiple-choice test on the topic of flowerpots.

正如本书将要阐明的，我们相信，了解有效助记符背后的过程，对于根据特定学习情境选择合适的助记符至关重要。此外，了解助记符的过程，能够帮助学习者创建适合自身学习风格的助记符，并自信地运用这些自创的助记符。

As will be evident throughout this book, we believe that knowledge of the processes that underlie effective mnemonics is crucial to selecting an appropriate mnemonic for a given learning situation. Moreover, knowledge of mnemonic processes will allow learners to create mnemonics that are well suited to their personal learning style and to use such self-generated mnemonics with confidence.

□ 自我强加的记忆术与外部

强加的记忆术

□ Self-Imposed Versus Externally

Imposed Mnemonics

与自我生成与他人生成助记符相关的一个问题是，助记符是自我强加的还是他人强加的。自我生成与他人生成涉及谁构建了助记符，而自我强加与他人强加则涉及谁促使其使用。有意学习与偶然学习之间的区别是自我强加与外部强加助记符问题的核心。有意学习涉及有意识地将信息记忆下来。另一方面，偶然学习发生在没有学习意图或不知道即将进行的记忆测试的情况下。当学生使用助记符来增强对考试中出现信息的记忆时，他使用的是自我强加的助记符。然而，有时助记符是外部强加的。例如，一位教授用幽默的例子来解释重要概念，本质上是在以一种可能增强记忆的方式呈现信息，即使……如果学生在讲座中没有明确地尝试记住信息。这种外部强加的助记符可能会带来偶然学习，即使不学习的学生也能在考试中取得好成绩。基于这一观点的一个直观结论是，教育工作者肯定应该使用有效的助记方法向学生传授信息。虽然我们非常同意这一结论，但我们也承认，个体差异（例如性格差异）可能会缓和任何给定外部强加的助记符的有效性。因此，为了帮助尽可能多的学生，我们建议在课堂上使用各种助记符方法。助记符在教育中的应用将在第 7 章中进一步讨论。

An issue related to self-generated versus other-generated mnemonics is whether a mnemonic is self imposed or other imposed. Whereas a self versus other generation deals with who constructs the mnemonic, self versus other imposition deals with who instigates its use. The difference between intentional and incidental learning is at the heart of the issue of self-imposed versus externally imposed mnemonics. Intentional learning involves a conscious effort to commit information to memory. On the other hand, incidental learning occurs without intention to learn or without knowledge of an impending memory test. When a student uses a mnemonic to enhance memory for information that will appear on a test, he is using a self-imposed mnemonic. However, there are occasions in which mnemonics are externally imposed. For example, a professor who uses humorous examples to illustrate important concepts is essentially presenting information in a way that is likely to enhance memory even if the students are not explicitly attempting to memorize the information during the lecture. This type of externally imposed mnemonic can potentially lead to incidental learning, which results in strong test performance even among students who do not study. An intuitive conclusion based on this notion is that educators should most certainly present information to students using mnemonically effective methods. Although we strongly agree with this conclusion, we also acknowledge that individual differences (e.g., personality differences) may moderate the effectiveness of any given externally imposed mnemonic. Thus, to assist as many students as possible, we recommend the use a variety of mnemonic methods in the classroom. The use of mnemonics in education will be discussed further in Chapter 7.

□摘要

□ Summary

在为特定学习情境选择助记符时，必须考虑诸多因素。测试的记忆类型、测试的性质以及个体能力和风格的差异都会影响助记符的有效性。因此，在选择助记符时，务必了解特定助记符的设计目的，并牢记学习情境的目标。此外，学习者应选择适合自身学习风格的助记符。无论学习者希望使用自创助记符还是他人生成的助记符，都应考虑这些因素。

There are numerous factors that must be considered when selecting a mnemonic for a given learning situation. The type of memory being tested, the nature of the test, and individual differences in ability and style can each influence the effectiveness of a mnemonic. Thus, it is important to know the purpose for which a given mnemonic is designed and keep in mind the goals of the learning situation when choosing a mnemonic. Furthermore, learners should select mnemonics that fit with their individual learning style. These factors should be considered regardless of whether one wishes to use a self-generated or other-generated mnemonic.

3

C哈一个磷T埃R		 

基本认知和

记忆过程

Basic Cognitive and

Mnemonic Processes

记忆法的核心假设是，成功的记忆技巧能够利用重要的基本记忆过程，从这个意义上讲，记忆法的人工记忆和基本认知过程的自然记忆本质上是共生的。无论这个假设多么明显，明确认识到记忆法与基本过程之间的这种关系都至关重要，原因有三。最重要的是，记忆法明确指出，理解基本记忆过程有助于创造性地开发记忆技巧；同样，任何具有可证明有效性的特定记忆法，都为了解基本过程提供了一个窗口。从这个意义上讲，基础研究与其应用之间存在着健康的共生关系。记忆法的一个不太明显的优势是它有可能消除自然学习和记忆与人工学习和记忆之间的紧张关系。一切都依赖于自然记忆过程，包括人工技巧，因此，从逻辑上讲，这些技巧并非人工的。在本章中，我们首先讨论基本认知过程，我们将看到这些过程在现有的记忆技巧中是可识别的。然后，我们继续识别许多记忆技巧所共有的其他过程，表明这些过程也是基本记忆理论的潜在重要目标。

At the heart of the mnemonological approach is the assumption that successful mnemonic techniques tap important basic memory processes, and in that sense, the artificial memory of mnemonics and the natural memory of basic cognitive processes are inherently symbiotic. However obvious this assumption may be, explicit recognition of this relationship between mnemonics and basic processes is important for three reasons. Most important, the mnemonological approach makes explicit that understanding basic memory processes allows for creative development of mnemonic devices, and likewise, any particular mnemonic that has demonstrable effectiveness offers a window into the basic processes. In that sense, basic research and its application have a healthy symbiotic relationship. A less tangible asset of the mnemonological approach is the possible elimination of the tension between natural and artificial learning and memory. Everything relies on the natural memory processes, including the artificial techniques, and for that reason these techniques logically are not artificial. In this chapter, we first discuss basic cognitive processes, which we shall see are identifiable in established mnemonic devices. We then go on to identify additional processes that are common to many mnemonic techniques, indicating that these processes are also potentially important targets for basic memory theory.

□基本认知过程

□ Basic Cognitive Processes

编码

Encoding

信息最初被加工并转化为心理表征的过程被称为编码。因为编码是在主动学习过程中，这一过程对于决定助记符的成功尤为重要。强调基本编码过程对于理解有效的助记符至关重要，因为大多数内部助记符的设计都是为了方便对待记忆信息进行编码，以便能够成功地存储和检索信息。考虑到这一点，重要的是要注意编码、存储和检索是高度相互依赖的过程。未正确编码的信息将难以（甚至不可能）存储和检索。同样，即使待记忆信息编码良好，如果存储方式妨碍了准确检索，它也不会被记住。反过来，正确编码和存储的信息除非被成功检索，否则不会被记住。因此，由于编码必然先于存储和检索，后者过程的成功取决于前者过程。此外，正确编码的好处很可能在检索时实现。例如，某种特定的记忆技巧可能涉及一些程序，这些程序会导致对具有高度诊断意义的检索线索进行编码。因此，记忆效益源于对线索的编码，而这些线索的最终作用是促进检索（参见 Tulving，1983）。

The initial processing and transformation of information into a mental representation is known as encoding. Because encoding is the first step in the active learning process, this process is especially important in determining the success of a mnemonic. The emphasis on basic encoding processes is central to understanding effective mnemonics because the majority of internal mnemonics is designed to facilitate encoding of to-be-remembered information in such a way that allows the information to be successfully stored and retrieved from memory. With this in mind, it is important to note that encoding, storage, 3 and retrieval are highly interdependent processes. Information that is not encoded properly will be difficult (if not impossible) to store and retrieve. Similarly, even if to-be-remembered information is encoded well, it will not be remembered if it is stored in such a way that hinders accurate retrieval. In turn, properly encoded and stored information will not be remembered unless it is successfully retrieved. Thus, because encoding necessarily precedes storage and retrieval, the success of the latter processes depends on the former process. Furthermore, it may very well be the case that the benefits of proper encoding are realized at retrieval. For example, a particular mnemonic technique may involve procedures that lead to the encoding of highly diagnostic retrieval cues. As a result, the mnemonic benefit results from encoding of cues whose ultimate effect is to facilitate retrieval (cf. Tulving, 1983).

选择性编码。亨特（Hunt，2008）认为编码过程可能通过三种方式影响记忆。首先，编码可能起到引导注意力的作用，使得只有一小部分待记忆信息被记录在记忆中。大量基于记忆加工层次法（Craik & Lockhart，1972）的研究表明，成功的记忆取决于对待记忆信息特定特征的定向。例如，Craik 和 Tulving（1975）向参与者展示了一个单词列表，并指示他们判断每个单词是大写还是小写，每个单词是否与呈现的单词押韵，或者每个单词是否与提供的句子框架有意义地契合。结果表明，后一种情况比前两种情况更能使参与者对目标单词的记忆更深刻。这一结果表明，相对于对待记忆信息的表面特征的定向，对语义特征的定向更能产生更好的记忆。扩展到记忆术，这些结果表明，为了达到最大的效果，记忆术必须鼓励对意义的导向，而不是对要记住的信息的感知特征的导向。

Selective Encoding. Hunt (2008) suggested that encoding processes may influence memory in three ways. First, encoding may function to direct attention such that only a select portion of the to-be-remembered information is represented in memory. A good deal of research from the levels-of-processing approach to memory (Craik & Lockhart, 1972) suggests that successful memory depends on orientation toward specific features of to-be-remembered information. For example, Craik and Tulving (1975) presented participants with a list of words with instructions to determine whether each was typed in uppercase or lowercase, whether each word rhymed with a presented word, or whether each word fit meaningfully into a provided sentence frame. The results indicated that the latter condition led to better memory for target words than either of the former conditions. This outcome indicates that orientation toward semantic features leads to better memory than orientation toward superficial features of to-be-remembered information. Extended to mnemonics, these results suggest that to achieve maximal effectiveness, a mnemonic technique must encourage orientation toward meaning rather than the perceptual features of to-be-remembered information.

这一结论的一个重要警告是，任何编码过程的有效性完全取决于记忆测试的性质。虽然以意义为导向通常能产生最佳记忆，但大多数记忆需求也确实以意义为导向。如果记忆测试探究先前经验的感知方面，感知编码将产生更好的表现。在基础研究中，这种资格体现在从处理层次到迁移适切处理。迁移适切处理是一个简单的原则，即当测试要求与早期习得相同的过程时，表现会最佳 (Blaxton, 1989; Jacoby, 1983; Morris, Bransford, & Franks, 1977)。成功应用这一原则需要了解测试要求的性质，而这在我们大多数日常经验中几乎不可能实现。谁知道未来世界会想知道我们大多数日常活动的哪些信息呢？然而，鼓励使用助记符的情况则有所不同。我们有意使用编码策略这一事实本身就表明我们知道需要记住什么。这些情况是应用迁移适切处理的绝佳场所。

An important caveat to this conclusion is that the effectiveness of any encoding process is completely dependent on the nature of the memory test. Although orientation to meaning usually yields the best memory, it is also true that most demands on memory are oriented to meaning. If the memory test probes perceptual aspects of the prior experience, perceptual encoding will produce better performance. In basic research, this qualification is represented by the transition from levels of processing to transfer-appropriate processing. Transfer-appropriate processing is the simple principle stating that performance will be best when the demands of the test require the same processes as those engaged by earlier acquisition (Blaxton, 1989; Jacoby, 1983; Morris, Bransford, & Franks, 1977). Successful application of this principle requires that one know the nature of the test demands, something that is rarely possible in most of our daily experiences. Who knows what the world will want to know in the future about most of our mundane activities? However, situations that encourage the use of mnemonics are different. The very fact that we intentionally employ encoding strategies indicates that we know what needs to be remembered. These situations are perfect venues for the application of transfer-appropriate processing.

转换编码。编码也可能起到转换待记忆信息的作用，使最终的心理表征与原始刺激在性质上有所不同。当然，根据定义，心理表征并非同构地捕捉刺激输入。因此，当我们谈到“转换”时，我们指的是刺激输入的显著改变，例如将一个冗长复杂的陈述转化为一个简单的概念。例如，设想这样一个场景：一个学生面对桑代克（1911）的“效果定律”：

Transformational Encoding. Encoding may also function to transform the to-be-remembered information such that the resulting mental representation is qualitatively different from the original stimulus. Of course, by definition, a mental representation does not capture stimulus input isomorphically. Thus, when we speak of “transformation,” we refer to a gross alteration of stimulus input such as the transformation of a lengthy and complex statement into a simple concept. For example, consider a situation in which a student is presented with Thorndike’s (1911) Law of Effect:

在同一情境下产生的几种反应中，那些伴随或紧随其后令动物感到满足的反应，在其他条件相同的情况下，会与情境产生更紧密的联系，因此，当情境再次出现时，它们更有可能再次出现；那些伴随或紧随其后令动物感到不适的反应，在其他条件相同的情况下，会与情境产生更弱的联系，因此，当情境再次出现时，它们不太可能再次出现。满足感或不适感越大，这种联系的加强或减弱就越大。（第244页）

Of several responses made to the same situation, those which are accompanied or closely followed by satisfaction to the animal will, other things being equal, be more firmly connected with the situation, so that, when it recurs, they will be more likely to recur; those which are accompanied or closely followed by discomfort to the animal will, other things being equal, have their connections with that situation weakened, so that, when it recurs, they will be less likely to occur. The greater the satisfaction or discomfort, the greater the strengthening or weakening of the bond. (p. 244)

鉴于措辞的长度和相对复杂性，学生几乎肯定不会逐字逐句地记住这句话。更有可能的是，这句话的编码方式是保留其主旨，但舍弃与学生无关的确切措辞和细节。例如，效果律的心理表征可能是这样的：“如果你做的事情导致了好的结果，那么在类似的情况下你会再次做这件事，反之亦然。” 在这种情况下，原始刺激输入在编码时被转换，从而将原始冗长陈述的简洁解释存储在记忆中。另一个转换编码的例子是一位吉他手，他听到一系列音符后，识别出该模式是五声音阶，并因此在记忆中将其表示出来。请注意，原始输入是单个音乐音符本身并非编码，而是一个抽象的音乐概念。因此，音符从离散的单元转化为单一的模式，从听觉层面转化为语义层面。

Given the length and relative complexity of the wording, it is almost certain that the student will not store this statement verbatim in memory. It is more likely that the statement will be encoded in such a way that the gist of the statement is maintained, but the exact wording and the details irrelevant to the student are discarded. For example, the resulting mental representation of the Law of Effect might be something like, “If you do something that leads to a good outcome, you will do it again in a similar situation and vice versa.” In this case, the original stimulus input was transformed at encoding such that a succinct interpretation of the original lengthy statement was stored in memory. Another example of transformation encoding would be a guitar player who, upon hearing a series of notes, recognizes the pattern as the pentatonic scale and thus represents it as such in memory. Notice that the original input was individual musical notes but that the encoding was an abstract musical concept. Thus, the notes were transformed from discrete units to a singular pattern and from being auditory to being semantic in nature.

与助记符相关的另一个常见基本编码过程是模态转换。也就是说，经验的表征可以从最初的感觉形式转换为另一种形式。最常见的是视觉形式和言语形式之间的双向转换。言语描述可以编码为视觉图像，就像图片可以编码为言语体验一样。在这些基本编码转换中，视觉意象是研究最多的，但原则上，所有模态都是此类转换的候选对象。重要的是，这些转换并不需要替换原始表征。事实​​上，大多数关于视觉意象基本过程的理论都假设同一事件的多种表征可以存储在记忆中（Paivio，1991）。

Another common basic encoding process that is relevant to mnemonics is the transformation of modality. That is, the representation of the experience may be transformed from the initial sensory form to a different form. Most common is the two-way transformation between visual and verbal forms. A verbal description may be encoded as a visual image just as a picture may be encoded as a verbal experience. Visual imagery is the most studied of these basic encoding transformations, but in principle, all modalities are candidates for such transformations. Importantly, these transformations do not necessitate that the original representation be replaced. Indeed, most theories of the basic process of visual imagery assume that multiple representations of the same event can be stored in memory (Paivio, 1991).

由于意象在助记符中占有突出地位，因此视觉意象是编码转换过程基本关注点与助记技巧之间的明显接口。转换编码也是多种助记符技术的重要组成部分。首字母缩略词的使用涉及编码转换，以便将要记住的信息缩小为更小的单位。例如，首字母缩略词“KISS”可用于记住计算机程序员和生活教练的口头禅：“保持简单，笨蛋！”主要系统助记符也使用转换编码。如第 1 章所述，主要系统涉及将大数字转换为字母以帮助记忆。因此，从字母到数字的转换是在编码过程中发生的转换。

Visual imagery is an obvious interface between basic concerns with transformational processes at encoding and mnemonic devices because of the prominence of imagery in mnemonics. Transformational encoding is also an essential component of several mnemonic techniques. The use of acronyms involves transformation at encoding such that the to-beremembered information is reduced to a smaller unit. For example, the acronym “KISS” can be used to remember the mantra of both the computer programmer and the life coach: “Keep it simple, Stupid!” The major system mnemonic also uses transformational encoding. As mentioned in Chapter 1, the major system involves converting large numbers to letters to aid memory. Thus, the conversion from letters to numbers is a transformation that occurs during encoding.

精细编码。在记忆法中，精细化或许是编码最常见的功能。精细化是用附加特征修饰待记忆信息的过程。例如，形成心理意象来修饰语用学习材料，可以被认为是想象性精细化。类似地，挂钩词教学法也使用精细编码，通过交互式心理意象将待记忆信息与先前学过的挂钩词列表关联起来。在这种情况下，待记忆信息通过与挂钩词的关联和心理意象的结合得到了修饰。

Elaborative Encoding. Elaboration is perhaps the most common function of encoding in the context of mnemonics. Elaboration is the process of embellishing to-be-remembered information with additional features. For example, the formation of mental images to embellish verbal learning material would be considered imaginal elaboration. Similarly, the peg-word method uses elaborative encoding such that to-be-remembered information is associated with a previously learned list of peg words using interactive mental imagery. In this case, the to-be-remembered information is embellished by both association with the peg words and mental imagery.

还应注意，上述三种编码功能并非相互排斥。助记符通常利用多种编码过程来增强记忆。例如，关键词法利用交互式心理意象，将外来词的翻译与其发音联系起来。因此，这种助记符涉及对语义和音素特征的选择性定向，以及利用心理意象对待记忆信息的阐释。同样，阐释可以与使用首字母缩略词时的转换编码。例如，研究发现，首字母缩略词与心理意象相结合时效果更佳，人们可以想象以演奏简单摇滚歌曲而闻名的炫酷乐队 KISS 来帮助记住“保持简单，愚蠢”的口头禅。

It should also be noted that the three encoding functions described above are not mutually exclusive. Mnemonics often capitalize on more than one encoding process to enhance memory. For example, the keyword method uses interactive mental imagery to form an association between the translation of a foreign word and what it sounds like when pronounced. Thus, this mnemonic involves selective orientation toward both semantic and phonemic features and elaboration of to-be-remembered information using mental imagery. Similarly, elaboration can be combined with transformational encoding when using acronyms. For example, as acronyms have been found to be more effective when combined with mental imagery, one might imagine the band KISS—a glitzy band renowned for playing simple rock songs—to assist in remembering the “Keep it simple, Stupid” mantra.

贮存

Storage

存储的概念意味着编码的记忆会被保存在某个地方。“记忆被存储”这一简单的概念是主流记忆框架的重要组成部分，也是大多数人对记忆运作方式的直觉。其假设是，不同类型的记忆被存储在不同的记忆存储器中。每个存储系统都有其自身的特性，包括可存储的表征类型、系统中痕迹的时间特性，以及在这些痕迹的形成和使用过程中运作的记忆过程 (Schacter & Tulving, 1994)。例如，Atkinson 和 Shiffrin (1968) 描述了三种存储位置：感觉存储器、短期存储器和长期存储器。来自环境的信息进入感觉存储器，它只包含原始物理能量的感觉表征。如果将注意力分配给该信息，它将被转移到短期存储器。短期存储器被认为是一个容量非常有限的临时存储位置，最初被认为只包含语音表征（声音模式）。复述过程在短期记忆中运行，使得短期记忆痕迹得以保存，并转移到长期记忆中。长期记忆中的痕迹具有持久性，最初被认为是作为意义存储的。Atkinson 和 Shiffrin 理论引发的研究导致了该框架某些参数的修订，但描述记忆的基本方法依然存在，并已扩展到短期记忆和长期记忆中独立的系统（Baddeley，2000；Schacter、Wagner 和 Buckner，2000）。

The concept of storage implies that encoded memories are held somewhere. This simple notion that memories are stored is part and parcel of the dominant frameworks for memory, as well as of most people’s intuitions about how memory works. The assumption is that different kinds of memories are held in different memory stores. Each storage system has it own characteristics, which include the type of representation that can be stored, the temporal characteristics of the traces in that system, and the memory processes that operate in the formation and use of these traces (Schacter & Tulving, 1994). For example, Atkinson and Shiffrin (1968) described three storage locations: sensory store, short-term store, and long-term store. Information from the environment enters sensory store, which contains only the sensory representation of the original physical energy. If the attention process is allocated to the information, it will be transferred to short-term store. Short-term store is thought to be a temporary storage location with a very limited capacity and originally was assumed to contain only phonetic representations (sound patterns). The process of rehearsal operates within the short-term store, allowing maintenance of the short-lived trace as well as transfer to long-term store. The trace in long-term store enjoyed the temporal characteristic of permanence and was originally assumed to be stored as meaning. Research provoked by the Atkinson and Shiffrin theory resulted in revisions to particular parameters of the framework, but the basic approach to descriptions of memory remains in place and has been extended to include separate systems within both short- and long-term memory (Baddeley, 2000; Schacter, Wagner, & Buckner, 2000).

一个极具影响力的记忆模型，即 Craik 和 Lockhart (1972) 提出的处理层次理论，并不主张将信息存储于单独的存储位置。该理论认为，处理的质量——而非存储位置——决定了待记忆信息在记忆中的持久性。从这个角度来看，存储过程在很大程度上并不重要。相反，重点在于编码的类型以及编码条件是否与检索条件相匹配。后者是 Morris 等人 (1977) 提出的迁移适配性处理原则的精髓。简而言之，该原则指出，所选的编码特征必须与记忆测试的性质相符。成功恢复所学信息的关键在于理解。也就是说，如果记忆测试强调待记忆信息的含义，那么成功的记忆就需要对含义进行编码。因此，迁移适切加工原则意味着编码和检索之间存在相互依赖关系——这一概念得到了编码特异性原则（Thomson & Tulving，1970；Tulving & Thomson，1973）的进一步强化。编码特异性原则简单地指出，成功的检索取决于编码时是否存在检索线索。因此，从加工水平的角度看，成功的记忆可以仅用编码和检索来解释，而无需依赖存储。

A particularly influential memory model that does not appeal to separate storage locations is Craik and Lockhart’s (1972) levels of processing theory. This theory suggests that quality of processing—not a storage location—determines the permanence of to-be-remembered information in memory. From this perspective, the storage process is, for the most part, irrelevant. Rather, emphasis is placed on the type of encoding and whether the encoding conditions match the conditions of retrieval. The latter notion is the essence of Morris et al.’s (1977) principle of transfer-appropriate processing. In a nutshell, this principle states that the features selected for encoding must correspond to the nature of the memory test for successful recovery of learned information. That is, if the memory test emphasizes the meaning of to-be-remembered information, then successful memory will require encoding of meaning. As such, the principle of transfer-appropriate processing implies an interdependence between encoding and retrieval—a notion that is further reinforced by the encoding specificity principle (Thomson & Tulving, 1970; Tulving & Thomson, 1973). The encoding specificity principle simply states that successful retrieval depends on the retrieval cue being present at the time of encoding. Thus, from a levels of processing approach, successful memory can be explained solely in terms of encoding and retrieval without appealing to storage.

虽然存储概念并非解释记忆功能的必要条件，但值得注意的是，记忆中信息的结构可能与记忆成功率有一定关系。例如，人们普遍认为，即使学习到的信息最初并非以有组织的方式呈现（Bousefield，1953），或者表面上看似无关（Tulving，1962），这些信息在记忆中的呈现方式也是高度有序的。这些发现意味着，用于组织待记忆信息的记忆术可以通过以与先前知识的组织方式相匹配的方式排列信息来增强记忆。也就是说，组织方式使待记忆信息能够更有效地融入先前知识结构。人们可以将其解读为组织方式使存储效率更高。然而，从迁移适配加工的角度来看，一个同样合理的解释是，如果测试与组织加工需求相重叠，组织加工有助于提高后期表现。

Although the storage concept is not necessary to explain mnemonic functioning, it is worth noting that the structure of information in memory may have some bearing on mnemonic success. For example, it is widely believed that learned information is represented in memory in a way that is highly organized even when that information is not originally presented in an organized fashion (Bousefield, 1953) or if the information is ostensibly unrelated (Tulving, 1962). The implication of these findings is that mnemonics that serve to organize to-be-remembered information may enhance memory by arranging the information in a way that matches the organization of preexisting knowledge. That is, organization allows the to-be-remembered information to be more efficiently accommodated by preexisting knowledge structures. One could interpret this to mean that organization makes storage more efficient. However, an equally plausible interpretation from the perspective of transfer-appropriate processing is that organizational processing facilitates later performance if the test overlaps with those organizational processing demands.

检索

Retrieval

检索是从记忆中恢复信息的过程。如前所述，信息的检索高度依赖于编码过程的性质。只有当编码条件与检索条件相匹配（迁移适应性加工），并且用于访问所学信息的线索在编码时存在（编码特异性）时，检索才能成功。从这个角度来看，检索仅仅是一个利用线索缩小可能的反应范围的过程，直到只剩下目标信息需要恢复，或者直到所有可能的响应都用尽而无法成功恢复目标信息。因此，记忆的成功取决于特定技术在多大程度上鼓励对检索时有用的线索进行编码。唯一地标识特定学习信息的线索将比提供对目标信息更一般方面的提示更有效。

Retrieval is the process of recovering information from memory. As noted earlier, the retrieval of information is highly dependent on the nature of the encoding process. Successful retrieval can occur only when the conditions of encoding match the conditions of retrieval (transfer-appropriate processing) and if the cue being used to access learned information was present at the time of encoding (encoding specificity). From this perspective, retrieval is simply a process of using cues to narrow the set of possible responses until only target information remains to be recovered or until the set of possible responses is exhausted without successful recovery of the target. Thus, mnemonic success will depend on the extent to which a given technique encourages encoding of cues that are useful at the time of retrieval. Cues that uniquely identify specific learned information will be more effective than cues that provide access to more general aspects of the target information.

当考虑到干扰信息在检索过程中的潜在影响时，唯一识别线索的重要性就显得尤为突出。干扰发生在两种情况：新学到的信息使检索先前学到的信息更加困难（逆向干扰），或先前学到的信息使检索新学到的信息更加困难（前摄干扰）。额外学习对目标信息检索的干扰程度取决于干扰信息与目标信息之间的相似性。具体而言，与目标信息高度相似的信息比不相似的信息更容易造成干扰 (McGeoch & McDonald, 1931)。因此，与目标信息高度诊断的唯一识别线索将比更通用的线索更能抵抗干扰。线索诊断性的概念在助记符的背景下非常重要，因为许多助记符都涉及提供线索的程序，这些线索将使待记忆的信息在检索时具有高度可辨别性。例如，人们认为，为了增强对待记忆信息的独特处理，结合精细编码的记忆程序是成功的，部分原因是它们能产生高效的检索线索（Hunt & McDaniel，1993；Hunt & Smith，1996；McDaniel，DeLosh & Merritt，2000；Waddill & McDaniel，1998）。

The importance of uniquely identifying cues is made salient when one considers the potential influence of interfering information at retrieval. Interference occurs when either newly learned information makes retrieval of previously learned information more difficult (retroactive interference) or when previously learned information makes the retrieval of newly learned information more difficult (proactive interference). The extent to which additional learning interferes with the retrieval of target information depends on the similarity between the interfering information and the target information. Specifically, information that is highly similar to target information is more likely to cause interference than is dissimilar information (McGeoch & McDonald, 1931). Thus, uniquely identifying cues that are highly diagnostic of the target information will be more resistant to interference than more general cues. The notion of cue diagnosticity is important in the context of mnemonics because many mnemonics involve procedures that function to provide cues that will make the to-be-remembered information highly discriminable at retrieval. For example, mnemonic procedures that incorporate elaborative encoding in order to enhance distinctive processing of to-be-remembered information are believed to be successful in part because they result in highly effective retrieval cues (Hunt & McDaniel, 1993; Hunt & Smith, 1996; McDaniel, DeLosh, & Merritt, 2000; Waddill & McDaniel, 1998).

记忆测试在检索时可用的线索信息类型方面有所不同。所谓的自由回忆测试通常被描述为不提供任何线索，但这其实是夸大其词，因为自由回忆情境总是伴随着线索。然而，这些线索比较笼统，对特定项目的诊断性较低。例如，“你在芝加哥做了什么？”这样的问题类似于实验室指令“回忆我给你看过的所有物品”。与“你做了什么？”这样的要求相比，这两种情况下都存在有用的线索信息，但这些信息限定了一个必须从中生成特定项目的一般事件。线索回忆测试提供更多的诊断信息，因为线索指定了感兴趣的特定事件或项目。例如，“你在芝加哥艺术学院最喜欢的作品是什么？”这个问题中的线索信息比“你在芝加哥做了什么？”更具体。在再认测试中，线索信息更具支持性，因为在再认测试中，受试者需要判断某个项目是否属于特定的先前经验。识别并不需要生成项目本身，但它确实需要对特定的过去经验做出辨别性决策。

Memory tests differ in the kind of cue information available at the time of retrieval. So-called free recall tests are often characterized as providing no cues, but this is an overstatement in that the free recall situation always is accompanied by cues. These cues, however, are general and low in diagnosticity for particular items. For example, a question such as “What did you do in Chicago?” is analogous to the laboratory instruction to “recall all of the items that I showed you.” In both cases, there is useful cue information as contrasted with the request “What did you do?” but this information circumscribes a general event from which the specific items must be generated. Cued recall tests offer more diagnostic information in that the cue specifies a particular event or item of interest. For example, the cue information in the request “What was your favorite piece at the Art Institute in Chicago?” is much more specific than “What did you do in Chicago?” Even more supportive is the cue information in a recognition test where one is required to decide whether an item was or was not part of a specified prior experience. Recognition does not require the generation of the item itself, but it does demand discriminative decisions about particular past experiences.

不同的线索环境对提取时的心理过程有不同的要求。因此，这并不奇怪记忆技巧的有效性会因记忆测试类型的不同而变化。例如，与标准言语编码相比，绩效编码在再认方面比在自由回忆方面更能提高记忆力（Mohr、Engelkamp & Zimmer，1989）。同样，当学习者在短保留间隔后接受测试时，奇异图像通常能提高自由回忆，但对线索回忆无益（Wollen & Cox，1981）。这些发现表明，某些记忆术可能主要通过增强目标信息的辨别能力来增强记忆，而另一些记忆术可能主要有助于促进检索的生成性方面。

The different cue environments impose different demands on psychological processes at the time of retrieval. Consequently it is not surprising that the effectiveness of mnemonic techniques varies as a function of the type of memory test. For example, compared to standard verbal encoding, performance encoding leads to greater memory improvement in recognition than in free recall (Mohr, Engelkamp, & Zimmer, 1989). Similarly, when learners were tested after short retention intervals, bizarre imagery typically improved free recall but not cued recall (Wollen & Cox, 1981). These findings suggest that certain mnemonics may enhance memory mainly by enhancing discriminability of target information, whereas others may serve mainly to facilitate the generative aspects of retrieval.

□ 特定编码过程

是记忆成功的基础

□ Specific Encoding Processes

Fundamental to Mnemonic Success

组织

Organization

组织是根据不同项目之间的共享关系对各个项目进行分组的过程。例如，像Audrey、Andrew、Carla、Floyd、Rita、Hugo、Katrina和Ivan这样的列表可以根据项目之间的几种不同关系来组织。也许最常见的组织方式是将列表分成一组女性名字（Audrey、Carla、Rita和Katrina）和一组男性名字（Andrew、Floyd、Hugo和Ivan）。但是，气象学家可能会将同一张列表归入一个类别：已退役的飓风名称。第三种可能的组织方式是将列表分成一组以元音结尾的名称和一组以辅音结尾的名称。在这三个例子中，列表项都是根据可以通过类别标签提示的共享特征进行分组的。因此，组织只是对项目之间的相似性进行编码 - 这个过程称为关系处理。

Organization is the process of grouping individual items based on shared relationships among differing items. For example, a list such as Audrey, Andrew, Carla, Floyd, Rita, Hugo, Katrina, and Ivan could be organized based on several different relationships among items. Perhaps the most common organization would be to group the list into a set of women’s names (Audrey, Carla, Rita, and Katrina) and a set of men’s names (Andrew, Floyd, Hugo, and Ivan). However, a meteorologist might organize the same list under a single category: retired hurricane names. A third possible organization would be to group the list into a set of names that end in vowels and a set of names that end in consonants. In all three examples, list items are grouped based on shared features that could be cued by a category label. Thus, organization is simply the encoding of similarities among items—a process that is referred to as relational processing.

尽管大量研究（例如 Bower、Clark、Lesgold 和 Winzenz，1969；Cohen，1963）表明，有组织的信息比无组织的信息更容易记住，但其他研究表明，单靠关系处理会限制记忆的有效性。例如，Tulving 和 Pearlstone（1966）向参与者展示了按类别组织的列表。每个列表包含类别标签和每个类别中的一些项目。列表的呈现方式是，来自特定类别的项目紧跟在类别标签之后。列表呈现后，参与者接受了自由回忆测试，随后进行了提示回忆测试。结果表明，与自由回忆相比，通过类别标签提示的回忆增加了至少回忆出一个项目的类别数量（类别访问）。然而，每个类别中回忆出的项目数量并没有随着类别的不同而变化。回忆测试。一项研究（Lewis，1971）也发现了相同的结果模式，该研究未在呈现的列表中包含类别标签。这些发现表明，关系加工能够增强对所学信息一般类别的获取，但无助于区分构成该类别的单个目标项目。此外，这项研究表明，仅依赖关系加工（即分类和图解式记忆法）的记忆技巧的有效性可能有限。与此观点一致，最有效的记忆法包含一些涉及关系加工的程序，但它们并不依赖关系加工作为唯一的有效性机制。

Although a good deal of research (e.g., Bower, Clark, Lesgold, & Winzenz, 1969; Cohen, 1963) suggests that organized information is easier to remember than unorganized information, other research indicates that relational processing alone has limited mnemonic effectiveness. For example, Tulving and Pearlstone (1966) presented participants with lists organized by categories. Each list contained category labels and a number of items from each category. The presentation of the list was such that items from a given category immediately followed the category label. After list presentation, participants were given a free recall test followed by a cued recall test. The results indicated that recall cued by category labels increased the number of categories for which at least one item was recalled (category access) relative to free recall. However, the number of items recalled within each category did not differ as a function of the type of recall test. An identical pattern of results was found in a study (Lewis, 1971) in which category labels were not included in the presented lists. These findings suggest that relational processing enhances access to general categories of learned information, but it does not aid in the discrimination of individual target items composing the category. Moreover, this research suggests that mnemonic techniques that rely solely on relational processing (i.e., categorical and schematic mnemonics) are likely to be limited in their effectiveness. In keeping with this notion, the most effective mnemonics include procedures that engage relational processing, but they do not rely on it as the sole mechanism for effectiveness.

细化

Elaboration

在许多方面，细化作用与组织作用相反。组织加工侧重于待记忆信息之间的关系，而细化作用则用于修饰单个项目的含义。细化加工的效果是通过产生独特的识别线索来区分待记忆信息和竞争信息，从而使项目更易于区分。因此，组织涉及相似性的处理（关系处理），而细化涉及差异性的处理。所处理的特定类型的差异是那些特定于每个待记忆项目的差异。这种类型的处理通常被称为项目特定处理。项目特定处理的重要性在于它鼓励编码，从而产生高度诊断性的检索线索。

In many ways, elaboration serves a function opposite to that of organization. Whereas organizational processing focuses on the relations among to-be-remembered information, elaboration functions to embellish the meaning of individual items. The effect of elaborative processing is to make the items more discriminable by producing uniquely identifying cues that distinguish the to-be-remembered information from competing information. Thus, whereas organization involves processing of similarities (relational processing), elaboration involves processing of differences. The specific types of differences that are processed are those that are uniquely specific to each to-be-remembered item. This type of processing is commonly referred to as item-specific processing. The importance of item-specific processing is that it encourages encoding that results in highly diagnostic retrieval cues.

如前所述，细化是助记技巧的常见组成部分。然而，对于任何给定的助记符，细化既可以是有意义的，也可以是无意义的。下文我们将分别描述这两种不同类型的细化。

As mentioned earlier, elaboration is a common component of mnemonic techniques. However, for any given mnemonic, elaboration can be either meaningful or nonmeaningful. We describe these two different types of elaboration below.

有意义的细化。Craik 和 Tulving (1975) 发现，与确定词格或音位相比，当参与者确定目标词是否适合句子结构时，记忆力会更好，这表明，对词义的细化可以增强记忆。在一项类似的研究中，Bradshaw 和 Anderson (1982) 向参与者展示了一些历史人物的事实，然后参与者要么用相关事实进行细化，要么用不相关事实进行细化，要么根本不进行细化。他们的实验 3 的结果表明，经过相关细化的事实比经过不相关或未经细化的事实记忆得更好。与这些结果一致，Kerr 和 Winograd (1982) 发现，在编码时添加目标人物的描述性短语可以增强面部识别。这些发现表明，以相关主题相关的形式进行的意义加工信息也能增强记忆。在记忆术的背景下，这些结果表明，鼓励学习者思考那些非必要但相关的事实，从而扩展待记忆信息的主旨，是有益的。例如，教师只需在标准信息中添加几个现实世界的例子，就能使学习材料更容易记住。

Meaningful Elaboration. Craik and Tulving’s (1975) finding of better memory when participants determined whether target words fit into a sentence frame compared to when they determined the case or phonology of the words suggests that elaboration of word meaning enhances memory. In a similar study, Bradshaw and Anderson (1982) presented participants with facts of historical figures that were followed by either elaboration with related facts, elaboration with unrelated facts, or no elaboration at all. The results of their Experiment 3 indicated that facts that had received related elaboration were remembered better than facts that had received unrelated or no elaboration. Consistent with these results, Kerr and Winograd (1982) found that facial recognition was enhanced by the addition of descriptive phrases of the target person at encoding. These findings indicate that the processing of meaning in the form of relevant thematically related information also enhances memory. In the context of mnemonics, these results suggest that procedures that encourage the learner to consider nonessential but related facts that expand upon the gist of the to-be-remembered information can be beneficial. For example, a teacher might make learning material more memorable by simply supplementing the standard information with several real-world examples.

Rogers、Kuiper 和 Kirker (1977) 证明了一种略有不同的有意义的细化思维，这种思维能够有效增强记忆。在他们的实验 1 中，参与者看到一份特质形容词列表，并被要求判断每个形容词的拼写是大写还是小写，每个形容词是否与给定的单词押韵，每个形容词的含义是否与给定的单词相同，或者每个形容词是否描述了自身。结果表明，在自我参照条件下，自由回忆比语义条件下的回忆效果更好，并且语义和自我参照条件都比其他两种条件产生了更好的记忆效果。这些结果表明，结合自我（或许是记忆中最成熟的概念）来思考信息是一种特别有效的细化思维形式。与此观点一致的是，其他研究人员（例如 Hyde & Jenkins，1969；Packman & Battig，1978）也发现，涉及主观评价（可能涉及自我参照（即愉悦感））的判断比基于客观或表面特征的判断更能增强记忆（Hyde & Jenkins，1973；Packman & Battig，1978）。这些发现与记忆术具体相关，表明鼓励主观评价的程序应该能大大增强回忆。例如，当呈现新信息时，人们可以简单地问自己一系列问题，例如“我同意这个想法吗？我喜欢它的含义吗？这些信息与我已经知道的相符吗？”根据上述研究，仅仅提出这些问题就应该会导致对新信息的强烈记忆。

A slightly different type of meaningful elaboration that can be effective for enhancing memory was demonstrated by Rogers, Kuiper, and Kirker (1977). In their Experiment 1, participants were presented with a list of trait adjectives with instructions to determine either whether each adjective was typed in small or large letters, whether each adjective rhymed with a provided word, whether each adjective meant the same as a provided word, or whether each adjective described themselves. The results indicated that free recall in the self-referencing condition led to more recall than in the semantic condition and that both the semantic and the self-referencing conditions resulted in better memory than the other two conditions. These results suggest that considering information in relation to the self—perhaps the most well-established concept in memory—is an especially powerful form of elaboration. In keeping with this notion, other researchers (e.g., Hyde & Jenkins, 1969; Packman & Battig, 1978) have also found that judgments that involve subjective evaluations that presumably involve self-referencing (i.e., pleasantness) increase memory relative to judgments based on objective or superficial features (Hyde & Jenkins, 1973; Packman & Battig, 1978). Related specifically to mnemonics, these findings suggest that procedures that encourage subjective appraisal should strongly enhance recall. For example, when presented with new information, one could simply ask oneself a series of questions such as “Do I agree with this idea? Do I like the implications of this? Does this information fit with what I already know?” Based on the research described above, simply asking these questions should result in strong memory for the new information.

无意义的精细加工。尽管研究明确支持有意义的精细加工能够增强记忆的观点，但一些研究表明，促进记忆的是更深入的加工，而非更有意义的加工。例如，Kolers 和 Perkins (1975) 证明，与正常呈现的句子相比，以颠倒方式呈现给参与者的句子记忆效果更佳（另见 Graf, 1982）。基于这些发现，Kolers (1979) 认为颠倒的句子需要额外的加工，这解释了记忆优势。需要注意的是，在本例中，Kolers 提到的额外加工并不涉及有意义的精细加工。因此，即使精细加工本身并无意义，它似乎也能增强记忆。

Nonmeaningful Elaboration. Although research clearly supports the idea that meaningful elaboration enhances memory, some research suggests that it is more extensive processing, not necessarily more meaningful processing, that facilitates memory. For example, Kolers and Perkins (1975) demonstrated better memory for sentences that were presented to participants in an upside-down fashion than if the sentences were presented normally (see also Graf, 1982). On the basis of such findings, Kolers (1979) argued that the upside-down sentences require additional processing, which accounts for the memory advantage. Notice that, in this case, the additional processing referred to by Kolers did not involve meaningful elaboration. Thus, it appears that elaborative processing can enhance memory even if it is not meaningful.

关于生成效应（即自我生成的信息比提供的信息记忆效果更佳）的研究也支持了无意义的细化可以增强记忆的观点。Slamecka 和 Graf (1978) 让参与者阅读同义词或押韵词对，或者生成与呈现的单词含义相同或押韵的单词。与有意义的细化有助于记忆的观点一致，同义词的识别率超过了押韵词的识别率。然而，生成押韵词也比单纯阅读能带来更好的记忆。因此，有意义的和无意义的细化似乎都能增强记忆。

Research on the generation effect—better memory for information that is self-generated than for information that is provided—also supports the notion that nonmeaningful elaboration can enhance memory. Slamecka and Graf (1978) had participants either read synonym or rhyming word pairs or generate words that either shared the same meaning or rhymed with a presented word. In keeping with the notion that meaningful elaboration facilitates memory, recognition of synonyms exceeded that of rhymes. However, generation of rhymes also led to better memory than simply reading. Thus, it appears that both meaningful and nonmeaningful elaboration can enhance memory.

独特处理

Distinctive Processing

如上所述，关系加工（即组织加工）和特定项目加工（即精细加工）似乎都能增强记忆。正如先前研究人员（例如 Hunt，2006；Hunt & McDaniel，1993）指出的那样，这些发现表面上可能有点令人费解。也就是说，加工差异和加工相似性怎么可能都带来更好的记忆呢？答案在于一个众所周知的发现：差异性有助于记忆。

As discussed, both relational processing (i.e., organization) and item-specific processing (i.e., elaboration) appear to enhance memory. As pointed out by previous researchers (e.g., Hunt, 2006; Hunt & McDaniel, 1993), these findings can, on the surface, seem a bit puzzling. That is, how can it be that both processing differences and processing similarities lead to better memory? The answer lies with the well-established finding that distinctiveness facilitates memory.

Hunt (2006) 将独特性定义为“在相似性背景下对差异性的处理”（第 11 页）。本质上，这意味着独特性是特定物品处理和关系处理相结合的结果。先前的研究（例如，Einstein & Hunt，1980；Hunt & Einstein，1981）表明，特定物品处理和关系处理都有助于记忆，但当两种处理类型同时发生时，记忆效果最佳。例如，Einstein 和 Hunt 向参与者展示了可以分为明显或不明显类别的单词列表。收到每种类型列表的参与者要么对列表中每个单词的愉悦度进行评分，要么将单词分类。结果表明，当列表代表明显的类别时，愉悦度评分比排序能带来更好的记忆。然而，当列表代表不太明显的类别时，情况正好相反。假设代表明显类别的列表比不太适合分类的列表更能鼓励关系处理，并且愉悦度评级任务比排序任务更能鼓励特定项目处理，结果表明特定项目处理和关系处理的结合比单独的任何一种处理产生更好的记忆。

Hunt (2006) defined distinctiveness as “the processing of difference in the context of similarity” (p. 11). Essentially, this means that distinctiveness results from a combination of item-specific and relational processing. Previous research (e.g., Einstein & Hunt, 1980; Hunt & Einstein, 1981) has demonstrated that both item-specific and relational processing facilitate memory but that memory is maximized when the two processing types occur together. For example, Einstein and Hunt presented participants with lists of words that could be grouped into either obvious or nonobvious categories. Participants receiving each type of list either rated the pleasantness of each word on the list or sorted the words into categories. The results indicated that with lists representing obvious categories, pleasantness rating led to better memory than sorting. However, the opposite was true with lists representing less obvious categories. Assuming that the lists representing obvious categories encouraged more relational processing than lists that were less amenable to categorization and that the pleasantness-rating task encouraged more item-specific processing than the sorting task, the results suggest that the combination of item-specific and relational processing leads to better memory than either type of processing alone.

特定项目加工和关系加工如何协同作用来辅助记忆？亨特（2006）认为，关系加工的作用是限制我们在检索时寻找待记忆项目的范围。例如，当学习者看到一份北美哺乳动物名称列表时，列表项之间的相似性使得学习者能够回忆起必须记住的一般信息类别：动物名称。然而，从列表中恢复特定项目的能力并非取决于已学项目之间的相似性，而是取决于独特的识别特征。因此，要精确指定类别中需要记住的项目，需要处理项目特定的特征。以上面的例子为例，猎人可能会记得鹿、松鼠和野猪在列表中，因为这些项目与其他项目不同，因为它们是他猎杀过的动物（参见 Van Overschelde、Rawson、Dunlosky 和 ​​Hunt，2005）。总而言之，这意味着关系信息为必须记住的信息类型提供了一个通用的参考框架，而项目特定信息则使人们能够区分列表中是否存在的项目。

How do item-specific and relational processing work together to aid memory? Hunt (2006) suggested that relational processing serves to delimit our search for to-be-remembered items at the time of retrieval. For example, when learners are presented with a list of names of North American mammals, the similarity shared among list items allows learners to recall the general class of information that must be remembered: animal names. However, the ability to recover specific items from the list will depend not on similarities among learned items but on uniquely identifying features. Thus, the precise specification of items to be remembered within the category necessitates the processing of item-specific features. Using the example from above, a hunter might remember that deer, squirrel, and boar were on the list because those items differed from the other items by virtue of them being animals that he has hunted (cf. Van Overschelde, Rawson, Dunlosky, & Hunt, 2005). Taken together, this means that relational information provides a general frame of reference for what type of information must be remembered, and item-specific information allows one to discriminate between items that were and were not on the list.

延伸到记忆术，关于独特性与记忆的研究表明，为了最大限度地提高记忆效果，需要结合特定项目处理和关系处理。因此，用于组织和修饰待记忆信息的记忆技巧将比仅用于组织或修饰的技巧更有效。此外，这也表明，纯粹的组织性记忆术可以通过添加鼓励特定项目处理的程序来提高其有效性。同样，在纯粹的精细化记忆术中添加鼓励关系处理的程序也应该能够提高其有效性。

Extended to mnemonics, research on distinctiveness and memory suggests that a combination of item-specific and relational processing is necessary for maximal memory performance. Thus, mnemonic techniques that serve to organize and embellish to-be-remembered information will be more effective than techniques that function only to organize or only to embellish. Moreover, this also suggests that purely organizational mnemonics can be made more effective by adding procedures that encourage item-specific processing. Similarly, the addition of procedures that encourage relational processing to purely elaborative mnemonics should also increase effectiveness.

然而，需要注意的是，即使结合使用特定项目处理和关系处理，过多的特定项目处理也会导致不利于记忆的效应。例如，Worthen 和 Loveland (2003) 发现，与他人执行的行为相比，怪异性会增加自我执行行为在记忆中破坏性效应与促进性效应的比例。鉴于怪异性 (Wollen & Margres, 1987) 和自我执行 (Engelkamp, 1995; Engelkamp & Dehn, 2000) 都被认为能够引发自发的特定项目处理，作者得出结论，这两个变量引发的特定项目处理会导致特定项目处理过度，最终导致事件构成要素的结合力较差 (参见 Craik, 2006)。因此，在结合不同的记忆程序时，应在特定项目处理和关系处理之间寻求一定程度的平衡。

It should, however, be noted that even when a combination of item-specific and relational processing is used, too much item-specific processing can result in effects detrimental to memory. For example, Worthen and Loveland (2003) found that bizarreness increased the ratio of disruptive to facilitative effects in memory for self-performed acts compared to other-performed acts. Given that both bizarreness (Wollen & Margres, 1987) and self-performance (Engelkamp, 1995; Engelkamp & Dehn, 2000) are thought to elicit spontaneous item-specific processing, the authors concluded that the item-specific processing induced by both variables led to an excess of item-specific processing, which ultimately resulted in poor binding of the elements composing the event (cf. Craik, 2006). Thus, some degree of balance between item-specific and relational processing should be sought when combining different mnemonic procedures.

心理意象

Mental Imagery

正如第一章所讨论的，利用心理意象来促进记忆有着悠久的历史。虽然视觉心理意象是记忆术中最常用的意象形式，但心理意象也可以任何感官都能产生意象。下面我们将讨论最受记忆研究人员关注的三种意象类型。

As discussed in Chapter 1, the use of mental imagery to facilitate memory has a long and storied history. Although visual mental imagery is the most common form of imagery used in mnemonics, mental imagery can be produced for any of the senses. Below we discuss the three types of imagery that have received the most attention from memory researchers.

视觉心理意象。大量研究（例如，Bower，1970b；May & Clayton，1973；Paivio，1969；Richardson，1978）表明，视觉心理意象可以增强记忆。通常，形成交互式心理意象的指令能带来最大的记忆优势（Bower，1970a；Epstein、Rock & Zuckerman，1960）。交互式心理意象是指将特定待记忆项目的组成部分组合成单个图像。例如，在配对联想学习任务中，待记忆目标对之一可能是“桌子-灯”。在这种情况下，想象一盏灯放在桌子上比分别想象这两件物品更容易获得记忆。
