Visual Mental Imagery. A good deal of research (e.g., Bower, 1970b; May & Clayton, 1973; Paivio, 1969; Richardson, 1978) suggests that visual mental imagery enhances memory. Typically, instructions to form interactive mental images lead to the greatest mnemonic advantage (Bower, 1970a; Epstein, Rock, & Zuckerman, 1960). An interactive mental image is one in which the components of a particular to-be-remembered item are combined in a single image. For example, in a paired-associate learning task, one of the to-be-remembered target pairs might be table–lamp. In this case, imagining a lamp sitting on a table would result in better memory than imagining the two items separately.

根据Paivio (1991) 的研究，心理意象通过提供额外的线索来帮助检索，从而增强记忆。也就是说，如果要记住的言语信息也经过想象，那么目标信息就会同时被言语和想象编码。在检索时，任何一个线索都可以用来恢复目标信息。另一方面，如果言语信息没有经过想象编码（仅经过言语编码），在其他条件相同的情况下，只有一个线索可以帮助检索。因此，意象对记忆的有益作用是想象编码提供的额外线索的结果。

According to Paivio (1991), mental imagery enhances memory by providing an additional cue to aid retrieval. That is, if to-be-remembered verbal information is also imagined, then the target information is encoded both verbally and imaginally. At retrieval, either cue could be used to recover the target information. On the other hand, verbal information that is not encoded imaginally (only verbally) will, with all else being equal, have only one cue to aid retrieval. Thus, the beneficial effects of imagery on memory are the result of the additional cue provided by imaginal encoding.

Hunt 和 Marschark (1987) 提出了另一种关于意象对记忆影响的观点。他们认为，心理意象能够促进记忆，因为它能够促进独特的加工过程。具体而言，他们认为，意象提供特定于事物的信息，当这些信息与关系信息结合时，能够增强记忆。为了支持他们的观点，Marschark 和 Hunt (1989) 证明，在阻碍关系加工的条件下，心理意象的有益作用可能会被削弱甚至完全消除。

An alternative view of the influence of imagery on memory is provided by Hunt and Marschark (1987). These authors suggested that mental imagery facilitates memory because it encourages distinctive processing. Specifically, they argued that imagery provides item-specific information that, when combined with relational information, results in better memory. In support of their view, Marschark and Hunt (1989) demonstrated that the beneficial effects of mental imagery can be attenuated or eliminated altogether under conditions that discourage relational processing.

尽管独特性加工观点强调心理意象所提供的特定项目信息，但这并不意味着意象纯粹是精细加工的。正如 Hunt 和 Marschark (1987) 所指出的，意象发挥精细加工或组织功能的程度取决于它应用于整个事件还是事件中的某个项目。例如，如果为 10 个词对列表中的每一对词形成单独的交互式心理意象，那么这些意象将主要发挥精细加工功能，增强每个待记忆词对的可辨别性。然而，如果使用包含列表中所有项目的单个交互式意象将列表项目简化为一个有意义的单元，那么意象也将发挥组织功能。因此，心理意象提供特定项目、关系或两种类型信息的程度，将取决于如何将意象应用于待记忆信息。

Although the distinctive-processing view emphasizes item-specific information provided by mental imagery, that is not to say that imagery is purely elaborative. As noted by Hunt and Marschark (1987), the extent to which imagery serves an elaborative or organizational function depends on whether the imagery is applied to an entire event or to an item within an event. For example, if separate interactive mental images are formed for each pair in a list of 10 word pairs, then the images will serve a mainly elaborative function that enhances the discriminability of each to-be-remembered pair. However, if a single interactive image including all items from the list is used to reduce the list items into a single meaningful unit, then the imagery will also serve an organizational function. Thus, the extent to which mental imagery provides item-specific, relational, or both types of information will depend on how the imagery is applied to the to-be-remembered information.

使用视觉心象时的一个重要考虑因素是应该使用普通心象还是奇异心象。如第一章所讨论的，使用奇异心象来增强记忆已被提倡了数千年。然而，现有的关于奇异心象作为助记符的有效性的实证研究表明，它的有效性是有限的。首先，只有当两种类型的心象都用于同一个列表中时，奇异心象才会比普通心象带来更好的记忆。因此，当使用奇异心象学习一些列表项目，而用普通心象学习其他项目时，就会出现奇异优势，但当将奇异心象应用于整个列表时则不会出现这种情况（McDaniel 等人，2000 年；McDaniel 和 Einstein，1986 年；McDaniel、Einstein、DeLosh、May 和 Brady，1995 年）。或许更能说明问题的是，当两种表象类型同时出现在同一个列表中时，人们会记住用奇异表象编码的信息，而以常见表象编码的信息为代价（Kroll & Tu, 1988; Lang, 1995）。这表明，奇异表象不会增加记忆的总数，而只是让学习者选择最有可能被回忆起来的列表项。然而，值得注意的是，奇异与常见之间权衡的一个例外是，当列表中的大部分（而非全部）信息都使用常见表象进行编码时。也就是说，有时发现使用少量奇异编码和大量常见编码会增加记住的列表项总数（有关讨论，请参阅 Worthen, 2006）。

An important consideration when using visual mental imagery is whether common or bizarre mental imagery should be used. As discussed in Chapter 1, the use of bizarre mental imagery to enhance memory has been advocated for thousands of years. However, existing empirical research on the effectiveness of bizarre imagery as a mnemonic suggests that there are limits to its effectiveness. First, bizarre imagery leads to better memory than does common imagery only when both types of imagery are used within the same list. Thus, the bizarreness advantage occurs when some list items are learned using bizarre imagery and other items are learned with common imagery, but not when bizarre imagery is applied to the entire list (McDaniel et al., 2000; McDaniel & Einstein, 1986; McDaniel, Einstein, DeLosh, May, & Brady, 1995). Perhaps even more revealing is the finding that when both imagery types are used in the same list, memory for information encoded with bizarre imagery is remembered at the expense of items encoded with common imagery (Kroll & Tu, 1988; Lang, 1995). This suggests that bizarre imagery does not increase the total number of items remembered but simply allows the learner to select which list items will have the highest probability of being recalled. It should be noted, however, that an exception to the bizarre– common trade-off has been found when the majority, but not all, of a list is encoded using common imagery. That is, the use of a few bizarre encodings and many common encodings has, on occasion, been found to increase the overall number of list items remembered (see Worthen, 2006, for a discussion).

使用奇异想象作为助记符的另一个问题是，奇异的阐释虽然能增强对目标事件的记忆，但不会增加细节的提取量。例如，关于句子记忆的研究（例如，Burns，1996；Kroll & Tu，1988；McDaniel & Einstein，1986；Worthen、Garcia-Rivas、Green & Vidos，2000）表明，虽然奇异句子的提取量比普通句子多（至少能回忆起一个单词），但普通句子中每句话的单词提取量要大于奇异句子。这一发现与上述局限性相结合，表明奇异想象作为一种独立的助记符可能并非特别有效。

Another problem associated with the use of bizarre imagery as a mnemonic is that bizarre elaboration enhances access of target events from memory, but it does not increase the amount of detail recovered. For example, research on memory for sentences (e.g., Burns, 1996; Kroll & Tu, 1988; McDaniel & Einstein, 1986; Worthen, Garcia-Rivas, Green, & Vidos, 2000) has demonstrated that although more bizarre than common sentences are accessed (at least one word recalled), the number of words recalled per sentence is greater for common than bizarre items. This finding in combination with the limitations described suggests that bizarre imagery may not be particularly effective as a stand-alone mnemonic.

尽管将奇异意象作为记忆功能的唯一机制存在潜在的局限性，但奇异意象作为记忆系统的组成部分却是有效的。例如，Worthen、Fontenelle、Deschamps 和 Foreman（2008）研究了常见和奇异意象在确定关键词记忆法作为西班牙语词汇学习方法的有效性方面的作用。结果表明，关键词记忆法比对照条件更容易回忆起更正确的定义，但前提是同时使用常见意象或奇异意象和常见意象。这些结果表明，在关键词记忆法的背景下，奇异性不会损害对细节的记忆，并且至少与普通意象一样有效。后者很重要，因为使用关键词方法创建普通意象有时很困难。

Despite the potential limitations of using bizarre imagery as the sole mechanism for mnemonic functioning, bizarre imagery can be effective as a component of a mnemonic system. For example, Worthen, Fontenelle, Deschamps, and Foreman (2008) examined the role of common and bizarre imagery in determining the effectiveness of the keyword mnemonic as a method to learn Spanish vocabulary. The results indicated that the keyword method led to the recall of more correct definitions than a control condition but only when common imagery or both bizarre and common imagery was used. These results suggest that in the context of the keyword mnemonic, bizarreness does not impair memory for details and is at least as effective as common imagery. The latter point is important because it is sometimes difficult to create common images while using the keyword method.

毫无疑问，奇异意象能够提供特定于项目的信息，从而有助于检索。然而，奇异意象的相对有效性可能取决于编码时关系信息的可用性。如果没有关系信息，奇异意象很可能导致记忆整合不良。然而，当与关系处理相结合时，与奇异意象相关的问题将会减少。因此，将奇异意象作为记忆系统的组成部分时，必须辅以鼓励关系处理的程序，才能最大限度地提高记忆效果。

There is little doubt that bizarre imagery provides item-specific information that has the potential to aid retrieval. However, the relative effectiveness of bizarre imagery may depend on the extent to which relational information is also available at the time of encoding. Without relational information, bizarre imagery is likely to result in poorly integrated memories. However, when combined with relational processing, the problems associated with bizarre imagery will be diminished. Thus, the use of bizarre imagery as a component of a mnemonic system must be complemented by procedures that encourage relational processing for maximal mnemonic effectiveness.

动觉想象。动觉想象是指想象自己执行某个动作，同时关注肌肉位置和身体动作。这与动觉练习不同，后者是指在不实际执行任务的情况下，执行与特定动作相关的运动。为了明确区别，设想一下一个人想要提高射箭准确度的情况。如果一个人想象自己以正确的姿势拉弓射箭，那么他就是在运用动觉想象。但是，如果一个人在没有弓的情况下练习与正确姿势相关的动作，这便是动觉练习。当然，如果一个人只是在受控条件下以正确的姿势用弓进行额外的射箭，这也将被视为标准的身体练习。

Kinesthetic Imagery. Kinesthetic imagery involves imagining oneself performing a motor action while focusing on muscle positions and physical movements. This is not to be confused with kinesthetic practice, which involves performing the motor movements involved with a particular action without actually performing the task. To clarify the distinction, consider a situation in which one wishes to increase shot accuracy in archery. If one imagined oneself using correct form to draw the bow and release the arrow, then one would be using kinesthetic imagery. However, if one practiced the movements associated with correct form in the absence of the bow, this would be kinesthetic practice. Of course, if one simply took additional shots with the bow using correct form under controlled conditions, this would be considered standard physical practice.

关于动觉想象对记忆影响的实证研究几乎全部集中在程序记忆上。例如，研究表明，动觉想象可以提高篮球罚球命中率。克拉克（Clark，1960）发现，对于经验丰富的球员来说，动觉想象对罚球命中率的提升作用几乎与体能练习相同。然而，对于经验不足的球员来说，体能练习的效果明显优于想象练习。齐格勒（Ziegler，1987）扩展了这一发现，证明动觉练习和动觉想象相结合比单纯的想象练习或单纯的标准练习更能提高罚球命中率。在研究花样滑冰（Mumford & Hall，1985）、空手道（Ryan、Blakeslee & Furst，1986）和游泳（White、Ashton & Lewis，1979）等技能的研究中也发现了这一结果。然而，在各个研究领域，结果的普遍模式是，与不练习相比，心理练习可以提高表现，但标准的身体练习可以带来最佳表现（Murphy，1990）。

Empirical research on the effects of kinesthetic imagery on memory is almost exclusively focused on procedural memory. For example, research has shown that kinesthetic imagery can enhance free throw shooting in basketball. Clark (1960) found that for experienced players, kinesthetic imagery enhanced free throw shooting ability almost to the same extent as physical practice. However, for less experienced players, physical practice was significantly more effective than imagery. Extending this finding, Ziegler (1987) demonstrated that a combination of kinesthetic practice and kinesthetic imagery enhanced free throw shooting performance more than imagery alone or standard practice alone. This result has also been found in studies examining skills such as figure skating (Mumford & Hall, 1985), karate (Ryan, Blakeslee, & Furst, 1986), and swimming (White, Ashton, & Lewis, 1979). However, across research domains, the general pattern of results is that mental practice increases performance compared to no practice at all, but that standard physical practice leads to the best performance (Murphy, 1990).

听觉意象。听觉意象是指在没有相应听觉输入的情况下想象听觉体验（例如，一种或多种声音）（参见 Intons-Peterson，1992）。目前，只有少量研究在听觉意象领域已经开展了大量研究，而对其与记忆的关系的研究则更少。先前的研究表明，听觉意象重现了听觉感官体验的许多方面。例如，研究表明，听觉意象包含有关音高（Farah & Smith，1983）、响度（Intons-Peterson，1992）和音色（Crowder，1989）的信息。与助记符主题更相关的是，先前的研究已经产生了一些证据表明，听觉意象以类似于视觉和动觉意象的方式促进记忆。例如，Tinti、Cornoldi 和 Marschark（1997）发现交互式听觉意象比非交互式听觉意象产生更好的记忆（实验 1），并且交互式听觉意象比口头阐述更能增强记忆（实验 3）。然而，Winnick 和 Brody (1984) 的研究表明，听觉意象的促进作用可能会受到待记忆信息意象价值的调节。具体来说，Winnick 和 Brody 向参与者展示了一些意象价值较低的单词（例如，伪证罪），视觉意象价值较高的单词（例如，桃子），听觉意象价值较高的单词（例如，咯咯笑），以及视觉和听觉意象价值都较高的单词（例如，吉他）。结果表明，对于低意象单词和听觉意象单词，形成视觉或听觉意象的指令并没有增强记忆。然而，形成视觉意象的指令和形成听觉意象的指令都增强了对两种意象价值都高的单词的记忆。同一作者还报告了另一项实验（实验 3）的结果，该实验将绘画与视觉意象以及发声与听觉意象相结合。尽管由于缺乏对照组，结果的解释变得复杂，但对实验间平均值的检查表明，增加准动觉练习比单独的想象练习更能增强记忆。

Auditory Imagery. Auditory mental imagery involves imagining an auditory experience (e.g., a sound or sounds) in the absence of corresponding auditory input (cf. Intons-Peterson, 1992). Only a scant amount of research has been conducted in the area of auditory imagery, and even less has focused on its relationship with memory. Previous research suggests that auditory imagery reproduces many of the facets of auditory sensory experiences. For example, research has demonstrated that auditory imagery contains information about pitch (Farah & Smith, 1983), loudness (Intons-Peterson, 1992), and timbre (Crowder, 1989). More relevant to the topic of mnemonics, previous research has produced some evidence that suggests auditory imagery facilitates memory in ways similar to visual and kinesthetic imagery. For example, Tinti, Cornoldi, and Marschark (1997) found that interactive auditory imagery resulted in better memory than noninteracting auditory imagery (Experiment 1) and that interactive auditory imagery enhanced memory better than verbal elaboration (Experiment 3). However, research by Winnick and Brody (1984) suggests that the facilitative effects of auditory imagery may be moderated by the imagery value of to-be-remembered information. Specifically, Winnick and Brody presented participants with words that were low in imagery value (e.g., perjury), high in visual imagery (e.g., peach), high in auditory imagery (e.g., giggle), and high in both visual and auditory imagery (e.g., guitar). The results indicated that for low-imagery words and auditory imagery words, instructions to form visual or auditory imagery did not enhance memory relative to a control. However, both instructions to form visual imagery and instructions to form auditory imagery enhanced memory for words high in both types of imagery. The same authors also reported results of an additional experiment (Experiment 3), which combined a drawing with visual imagery and vocalization with auditory imagery. Although the interpretation of the results is complicated by the lack of a control group, inspection of the means between experiments suggests that the addition of the quasi-kinesthetic practice enhanced memory more than imagery alone.

□摘要

□ Summary

无论人们的记忆理论方法如何，人们普遍认为编码和检索是相互依存的过程。虽然从我们的角度来看，“存储”的概念并非必需，但也可以安全地假设编码、存储和检索是相互依存的。无论如何，影响编码的因素最终会影响检索，这一点显而易见。如果没有适当的编码，信息就无法被记住。虽然编码可以以多种方式进行，但关键因素在于编码是否促进特定项目加工、关系加工，或两者兼而有之。促进关系加工的编码程序将导致成功获取一般参考框架。包含必须记住的信息类型。鼓励特定项目处理的编码程序将使待记忆信息更易于辨别。因此，在特定情境中准确辨别目标项目需要特定项目处理和关系处理相结合。就创建成功的助记符而言，这意味着任何给定的助记符系统都应包含鼓励特定项目处理和关系处理的过程。具体而言，如何诱导这些类型的处理可能有所不同。然而，一般而言，关系处理将由鼓励组织待记忆信息的程序引发，而特定项目处理将由精细加工引发。由于特定项目处理和关系处理的结合对于成功的助记符功能至关重要，因此评估给定助记符的潜在成功需要能够识别鼓励每种处理类型的程序。这就是助记符学的本质：从其底层过程的角度来审视助记符，以了解其优缺点。在接下来的两章中，我们将从记忆学的角度来研究现有的记忆术。

Regardless of one’s theoretical approach to memory, there is general agreement that encoding and retrieval are interdependent processes. Although the concept of storage is not necessary from our perspective, it can also be safely assumed that encoding, storage, and retrieval are interdependent. Regardless, it is clear that factors that influence encoding will ultimately affect retrieval. Without proper encoding, information will not be remembered. Although encoding can proceed in a variety of ways, the crucial factor is whether encoding encourages item-specific processing, relational processing, or both. Encoding procedures that encourage relational processing will result in successful access of the general frame of reference that contains the type of information that must be remembered. Encoding procedures that encourage item-specific processing will make the to-beremembered information more discriminable. It then follows that accurate discrimination of target items within a specified context requires a combination of item-specific and relational processing. In terms of creating successful mnemonics, this means that any given mnemonic system should include procedures that encourage both item-specific and relational processing. Specifically how these types of processing can be induced can vary. However, in a general sense, relational processing will be induced by procedures that encourage organization of to-be-remembered information, and item-specific processing will be induced by elaboration. Because a combination of item-specific and relational processing is crucial for successful mnemonic functioning, the assessment of the potential success of a given mnemonic requires an ability to identify procedures that encourage each type of processing. This is the essence of mnemonology: examining mnemonics in terms of their underlying processes to understand their strengths and weaknesses. In the following two chapters, we examine existing mnemonics from a mnemonological approach.

4

摄氏度哈一个磷T埃R		 

正式的记忆系统

Formal Mnemonic Systems

正式的助记符是指那些包含严格规定的使用说明的助记符。虽然简单的助记符程序（例如语义阐述）对学习者的限制很少，但正式的助记符提供了有关如何编码和检索信息的更精确的规范。在大多数情况下，使用正式助记符的学习者正在应用其他人开发的技巧。如第 2 章所述，这种学习情况有利有弊。使用预先存在的形式技术的一个优点是，通常有一些证据（即使是轶事）可以证明其有效性。其次，其他生成的技术减轻了从头开始创建助记符的负担。然而，这些优势有时会因为缺乏对助记符设计应用的了解以及学习该技术所需的时间而被抵消。无论如何，本次讨论的目的不是为了推广使用正式的助记符系统，而是为了深入了解此类技术的机制。通过从基本认知过程的角度考察每个系统所涉及的程序，我们可以识别出每个系统背后的功能组件。因此，本章将对那些希望学习和使用正式助记系统的人以及那些希望设计自己的助记技巧的人有所帮助。下面，我们将讨论一些最广泛使用且研究最深入的正式助记技巧。

Formal mnemonics are those that involve highly prescribed instructions for use. Whereas a simple mnemonic procedure such as semantic elaboration puts very few constraints on the learner, formal mnemonics provide a more precise specification of how information should be encoded and retrieved. In most cases, a learner using a formal mnemonic is applying a technique that has been developed by someone else. As discussed in Chapter 2, this type of learning situation has advantages and disadvantages. One advantage of using a preexisting formal technique is that there is usually some evidence—even if anecdotal—that attests to its effectiveness. Second, other-generated techniques relieve one of the burden of creating a mnemonic from scratch. However, these advantages are sometimes offset by a lack of knowledge of the applications for which the mnemonic was designed and the time required to learn the technique. Regardless, the present discussion is offered not to promote the use of formal mnemonic systems but to provide insight into the mechanics of such techniques. By examining the procedures involved in each system in light of basic cognitive processes, we can identify the functional components that underlie each system. Thus, the present chapter will be beneficial both to those who wish to learn and use formal mnemonic systems and to those who wish to devise their own mnemonic techniques. Below, we discuss some of the most widely used and well-researched formal techniques.

□位置法

□ Method of Loci

正如第一章所述，位置记忆法或许是现存最古老的正式记忆法。位置记忆法是一种内部记忆法，可以用来帮助回忆需要长时间处理的有序主题。演讲。因此，与普遍的看法相反，这种方法并不是专门为简单的列表学习而设计的，也不局限于该应用。

As mentioned in Chapter 1, the method of loci is perhaps the oldest surviving formal mnemonic. The method of loci is an internal mnemonic that can be used to aid recall of ordered topics to be addressed in a long speech. Thus, contrary to popular belief, this method was not specifically designed for simple list learning, and it is not limited to that application.

基本步骤。使用位置记忆法首先要在一个非常熟悉的地方——最好是一个有几个区域或房间的地方——形成一个视觉心像。这个想象的地方最终将成为编码和检索待记忆信息的基础。接下来，在脑海中创建每个待记忆物品的视觉心像，并将其放置在先前想象的熟悉地点的特定位置。物品的放置顺序是，第一个物品被放置在靠近想象地点入口的地方，然后每个后续物品逐渐向内放置。当需要回忆信息时，学习者会在脑海中重温这个熟悉的地方，并收集之前放置在那里的物品。除了这些一般性说明外，关于如何实施记忆法几乎没有其他限制。一个可能的例外是，建议待记忆的物品不应隐藏在熟悉地点的图像中。例如，当试图记住像牛奶这样的物品时，不应该想象它放在冰箱里等隐蔽的地方。然而，对于隐藏心理意象的记忆研究结果不一。Kerr 和 Neisser（1983 年；Neisser 和 Kerr，1973 年）证明，隐藏意象的记忆效果与未隐藏意象一样好。另一些人（Iaccino 和 Byrne，1989 年；Keenan 和 Moore，1979 年）则认为，如果严格规定了隐藏指令，未隐藏意象比隐藏意象的记忆效果更好。显然，造成结果差异的调节因素是形成意象所需的时间（Keenan，1983 年；Kerr 和 Neisser，1983 年）。如果形成意象的时间有限，那么隐藏意象比未隐藏意象的回忆效果更差。但是，如果有充足的意象形成时间，隐藏意象和未隐藏意象的记忆效果应该没有差别。

Basic Procedures. Use of the method of loci begins with the formation of a visual mental image of a very familiar place—preferably one with several sections or rooms. This imagined place will ultimately serve as a foundation for both encoding and retrieval of the to-be-remembered information. Next, a visual mental image of each to-be-remembered item is created and placed in a specific location within the previously imagined familiar place. Placement of items proceeds with the first item being placed near the entry of the imagined place and each succeeding item placed increasingly further toward the interior. When the information needs to be recalled, the learner mentally revisits the familiar place and collects the items that had been placed there. Other than these general instructions, there are few additional constraints on how one can implement the mnemonic. One possible exception is the suggestion that to-be-remembered items should not be hidden within the image of the familiar place. For example, when trying to remember an item such as milk, one should not imagine it in a concealed location such as inside a refrigerator. However, the research on memory for concealed mental images has been mixed. Kerr and Neisser (1983; also Neisser & Kerr, 1973) demonstrated that concealed images are just as mnemonically effective as unconcealed images. Others (Iaccino & Byrne, 1989; Keenan & Moore, 1979) have suggested that unconcealed images, with tightly prescribed instructions to conceal, are more mnemonically successful than concealed images. Apparently, the moderating factor underlying the discrepancy between the results is the time required to form images (Keenan, 1983; Kerr & Neisser, 1983). If time to form images is constrained, then concealed imagery leads to poorer recall than unconcealed imagery. However, with ample time for image formation, there should be no difference between the mnemonic effectiveness of concealed and unconcealed images.

使用示例。位置记忆法的使用说明有多种应用方式。因此，该技术不同表现形式的记忆含义可能略有不同。然而，该系统最基本的程序依赖于一些基本认知过程的应用。我们将首先提供一个位置记忆法典型表现的例子，然后探讨该系统背后的过程。

Example of Use. There is a variety of ways to apply the instructions for use of the method of loci. As a result, there may be some slight variability in the mnemonic implications associated with different manifestations of the technique. However, the most fundamental procedures of the system rely on the application of a few basic cognitive processes. We will first provide an example of a typical manifestation of the method of loci and then examine the processes that underlie the system.

设想这样一种情况：一位自然保护主义者即将发表演讲，并希望按顺序讨论五位与野生动物保护相关的著名人物：奥尔多·利奥波德、萨克斯顿·波普和亚瑟·杨、西奥多·罗斯福和约翰·休斯顿。奥尔多·利奥波德是一位渔夫、猎人，也是威斯康星大学的野生动物管理教授。利奥波德通常被认为是“野生动物管理之父”，他死后出版的《沙乡年鉴》 （1949）是生态学领域最具影响力的著作之一。萨克斯顿·波普是加州大学的一名医生和外科讲师，他与亚瑟·杨共同为传统弓箭狩猎制定了道德标准。以他们的名字命名的波普和杨俱乐部是一个重要的自然资源保护组织，倡导负责任的公平狩猎。美国第26任总统西奥多·罗斯福是一位坚定的自然资源保护主义者，他与他人共同创立了美国野牛协会，并在国家森林管理局的建立中发挥了重要作用。约翰·休斯顿是一位演员兼传奇电影导演，他在非洲猎象的经历，为那些心怀不轨的猎人敲响了警钟。彼得·维尔特尔（1953）在其作品《白猎手黑心4》中使用化名，揭露了休斯顿在拍摄电影《非洲女王》（伊格尔、伍尔夫和休斯顿，1951）时，痴迷于猎杀大象，尽管他认为这种行为是罪恶的。然而，当休斯顿有机会射杀大象时，他却良心不安。结果，休斯顿在大象面前犹豫了，大象随后冲向并杀死了一名试图保护他免受大象伤害的狩猎向导。

Consider a situation in which a conservationist will be delivering a speech and wishes to discuss, in order, five famous figures as they relate to wildlife conservation: Aldo Leopold, Saxton Pope and Arthur Young, Theodore Roosevelt, and John Huston. Aldo Leopold was, among other things, a fisherman, a hunter, and a professor of game management at the University of Wisconsin. Often considered the “Father of Wildlife Management,” Leopold’s posthumously published A Sand County Almanac (1949) is one of the most influential books in the area of ecology. Saxton Pope was a medical doctor and instructor of surgery at the University of California who, along with Arthur Young, set a standard of ethics for traditional bow hunting. The Pope and Young Club created in their honor is a leading conservationist organization that advocates responsible fair-chase hunting. Theodore Roosevelt, the 26th president of the United States, was a staunch conservationist who cofounded the American Bison Society and was instrumental in the establishment of the National Forest Service. John Huston was an actor and legendary film director whose elephant-hunting experience in Africa serves as a cautionary tale for hunters with ignoble intentions. Using aliases, Peter Viertel’s (1953) White Hunter Black Heart4 reveals that, while filming The African Queen (Eagle, Woolf, & Huston, 1951), Huston became obsessed with killing an elephant even though he thought the act would be sinful. However, when presented with an opportunity to shoot an elephant, Huston had a crisis of conscience. As a result, Huston hesitated in the presence of the elephant, which then charged and killed a hunting guide who had attempted to protect him from the elephant.

上述情况非常适合运用位置记忆法。与该方法的经典应用一样，这个例子涉及记住将按特定顺序讨论的特定主题。现在让我们思考如何应用位置记忆法。

The situation described above is perfectly suited for the use of the method of loci. As with classic applications of the method, this example involves remembering specific topics that will be discussed in a particular order. Let us now consider how the method of loci could be applied.

使用位置记忆法的第一步是找出一个熟悉的地点，并用其意象来组织演讲主题。假设这位自然资源保护者将她工作的大楼作为她熟悉的地点。为了记住要讨论奥尔多·利奥波德，她可能首先将“Leopold”这个名字转换成发音相似的“Leo poled”。由于“Leo”在天文学和占星术中都是狮子的象征，因此可以通过想象一头狮子爬上自然资源保护者大楼前的旗杆来形成“Leo poled”的意象。为了记住萨克斯顿·蒲柏和亚瑟·杨，这位自然资源保护者可以想象教皇在大楼前抱着一个婴儿（用来代表“杨”）。西奥多·罗斯福坐在接待处抱着一只泰迪熊（以他的名字命名）的意象可以用来纪念这位第 26 任总统。最后，可以在电梯门前贴一张休斯顿（德克萨斯州的一个城市，其发音与 Huston 相同）的大幅地图，以纪念约翰·休斯顿。

The first step in using the method of loci is to identify a familiar place whose image can be used to organize the topics of the speech. Let us say that the conservationist will use the building in which she works as her familiar place. To remember to discuss Aldo Leopold, she might first transform the name “Leopold” into the phonetically similar “Leo poled.” As “Leo” is represented by a lion in both astronomy and astrology, an image of “Leo poled” can be formed by visualizing a lion climbing the flagpole in front of the conservationist’s building. To remember Saxton Pope and Arthur Young, the conservationist could form an image of the Pope holding an infant (used to represent “Young”) at the front door of the building. An image of Theodore Roosevelt sitting at the receptionist’s desk holding a teddy bear (his namesake) could be used to remember the 26th president. Finally, an image of a large map of Houston (a city in Texas whose pronunciation is identical to Huston) posted in front of the elevator door could be used to remember John Huston.

当这位环保人士必须发表演讲时，她会在脑海中导航她的办公楼，并“拾起”她之前放置在那里的提示。她会从大楼外面开始，在那里她会遇到旗杆，现在旗杆应该与一头冉冉升起的狮子的形象联系起来。狮子代表“利奥”，因此“举着旗杆的利奥”的形象会提示奥尔多·利奥波德。靠近大楼，她会看到教皇抱着一个婴儿，这会提示萨克斯顿·波普和亚瑟·杨。进入大楼后，她发现西奥多·罗斯福在接待处抱着一只泰迪熊，这当然会帮助她记住要讨论这个人物。最后，在电梯口，这位自然资源保护者会看到一张休斯顿的大型地图，地图上会显示“休斯顿”这个名字，从而帮助她记住要讨论约翰·休斯顿。当然，按照位置记忆法的经典用法，这些步骤不一定能帮助记住演讲的细节。相反，这种方法的应用是为了帮助她按顺序记住要讨论的主题。

When the conservationist must deliver her speech, she will mentally navigate her office building and “pick up” the cues that she placed there earlier. She will begin at the outside of her building where she will encounter the flagpole, which now should be associated with the image of an ascending lion. The lion represents “Leo” and thus the “Leo poled” image will cue Aldo Leopold. Moving closer toward the building, she encounters the Pope holding an infant, which will cue Saxton Pope and Arthur Young. Upon entering the building she finds Theodore Roosevelt holding a teddy bear at the receptionist’s desk, which will, of course, help her remember to discuss this figure. Finally, at the elevator, the conservationist will see a large map of Houston, which will cue the name “Huston” and thus assist in remembering to discuss John Huston. Of course, in keeping with the classic use of the method of loci, these procedures will not necessarily assist in remembering the details of the speech. Rather, this application of the method is used to help remember the topics to be discussed in order.

在思考此处提供的示例时，应该注意，每个图像都可以进一步修饰，以增强学习者对那些特别难以记住的信息的记忆。例如，如果自然资源保护者发现自己记不住波普（Pope）和杨（Young）的名字，她可以在相应的图像中添加额外的提示，例如波普手里拿着一把萨克斯管，婴儿手里拿着一把画笔。在这个例子中，萨克斯管可以用来提示萨克斯顿（Saxton），画笔可以用来提示亚瑟（Art，Arthur）的名字。

When considering the example provided here, one should note that each image could be further embellished in an effort to improve memory for information that the learner finds especially problematic. For example, if the conservationist finds that she is having trouble remembering the first names of Pope and Young, she could embellish the corresponding image with additional cues such as a saxophone also being held by the Pope and a paintbrush being held by the infant. In this example, the saxophone would be used to cue Saxton and the paintbrush would be used to cue Art (short for Arthur).

潜在过程。一般而言，本例大量运用了精细编码，将待记忆的图形与更牢固的记忆（熟悉场所内的地点）联系起来。交互式心理意象的使用提供了更高程度的精细化，从而提供了额外的特定于项目的信息，因此应该能够极大地增强目标信息的可辨别性。

Underlying Processes. In a general sense, this example makes extensive use of elaborative encoding by the association of the to-be-remembered figures with more well-established memories (locations within a familiar place). The use of interactive mental imagery provides another degree of elaboration, which provides additional item-specific information and thus should greatly enhance the discriminability of the target information.

由于每个交互式图像的性质略有不同，因此考虑在形成单个图像时使用的助记技术可能很重要。第一个图像涉及转换编码和选择性编码。Aldo Leopold变成了更容易想象和发音相似的Leo Poled。将名字转换为语音等效项涉及选择性编码，因为它源于对要记住的项目的音素特征的定位。此外，生成的图像是一个奇怪的交互式图像。教皇抱着婴儿的图像被用来代表Saxton Pope和Arthur Young 。该图像也使用了转换编码 - 最明显的是Young变成了一个具体的婴儿交互式图像。西奥多·罗斯福的形象不涉及转换编码，但它确实涉及通过用泰迪熊修饰前总统的形象来进行精细编码。根据成像方式，在图像中加入泰迪熊也可能很奇怪。当使用休斯顿地图的常见图像来代表约翰·休斯顿时，就会使用转换编码。需要注意的是，一些心理学家（例如，Bower，1970a）建议，所使用的心理图像应尽可能与待记忆的内容相似。然而，当待记忆的内容抽象或难以想象时，这通常是不可行的。

Because the nature of each interactive image varies slightly, it may be important to consider the mnemonic techniques used in the formation of the individual images. The first image involves both transformational and selective encoding. Aldo Leopold was transformed into the more easily imaged and phonetically similar Leo Poled. The transformation of the name into a phonetic equivalent involves selective encoding because it results from orientation toward phonemic features of the to-be-remembered item. Also, the resulting image is a bizarre interactive image. An image of the Pope holding an infant was used to represent Saxton Pope and Arthur Young. This image also uses transformational encoding—most obviously in the transformation of Young into a concrete interactive image of an infant. The image of Theodore Roosevelt does not involve transformational encoding, but it does involve elaborative encoding by embellishing the image of the former president with a teddy bear. The inclusion of the teddy bear in the image may also be bizarre depending on how it was imaged. Transformational encoding is used when a common image of the map of Houston is used to represent John Huston. It should be noted that some psychologists (e.g., Bower, 1970a) have suggested that the mental images used should be as similar to the to-be-remembered items as possible. However, this is typically not feasible when the to-be-remembered items are abstract or otherwise difficult to image.

虽然运用位置记忆法需要大量的精细加工，但组织结构也是一个关键要素。在我们的例子中，信息的组织方式是将必须首先记忆的信息放置在想象地点的外部，而将稍后记忆的信息放置在图像的内部。这种放置方式保持了信息的序列顺序，以便能够按正确的顺序回忆。此外，位置记忆法固有的序列组织结构使学习者知道如何开始和完成检索过程：检索从熟悉图像中的第一个位置开始，并在所有待记忆项都已找到或所有位置都已搜索完毕时结束。使用交互式心理图像将待记忆信息与熟悉地点关联起来，也有助于将所有信息整合成一个有意义的单元。本例中运用的精细加工和组织技术相结合，将带来独特的加工过程，从而产生有效的记忆效果。

Although a good deal of elaboration is involved in the use of the method of loci, organization is also a key component. In our example, the information is organized by placing the information that must be remembered first in exterior locations of the imagined place, and information that is to be remembered later is placed in the interior of the image. This type of placement maintains the serial order of the information such that it can be recalled in proper order. Moreover, the serial organization inherent to the method of loci allows the learner to know how to begin and complete the retrieval process: Retrieval begins at the first location in the familiar image and ends when either all to-be-remembered items have been recovered or all locations have been searched. The use of interactive mental images to associate the to-be-remembered information to the familiar place also serves to consolidate all of the information into a single meaningful unit. The combination of elaborative and organizational techniques used in this example will lead to distinctive processing, which should result in mnemonic effectiveness.

研究支持。案例研究中描述的卓越记忆力为位置记忆法的有效性提供了强有力的证据（例如，Luria，1968）。然而，实证研究（例如，Roediger，1980）也表明，即使在较长的记忆间隔后，该方法仍能有效增强序列回忆（Wang & Thomas，2000）。此外，研究（De Beni & Cornoldi，1988；Massen & Vaterrodt-Plunnecke，2006）发现，在不同的列表中重复使用相同的位置记忆并不会降低该方法的有效性。然而，针对正常人群的研究表明，自我生成的位置记忆比他人提供的位置记忆更有效（参见 Moe & De Beni，2004）。

Research Support. Powerful evidence of the effectiveness of the method of loci comes from feats of exceptional memory described in case studies (e.g., Luria, 1968). However, empirical research (e.g., Roediger, 1980) has also demonstrated the method to be effective in enhancing serial recall even after a substantial retention interval (Wang & Thomas, 2000). In addition, research (De Beni & Cornoldi, 1988; Massen & Vaterrodt-Plunnecke, 2006) has found that repeated use of the same loci for different lists does not diminish the effectiveness of the method. However, research with normal populations has shown that self-generated loci are more effective than loci that are supplied by others (see Moe & De Beni, 2004).

位置法的有效性存在一些局限性。例如，Cornoldi 和 De Beni（1991）以及 Moe 和 De Beni（2005）证明，对于学习复杂的口头表达材料（例如，大量的论述），位置法比累积性口头复述更有效，这些材料需要口头而非书面呈现。此外，Canellopoulou 和 Richardson（1998）发现，神经受损的参与者在提供表象而非自我生成的表象时，可以从位置法中受益。这一发现与正式的记忆法对于脑损伤学习者来说可能过于繁琐的观点一致（McKinlay，1992；Richardson，1995）。

There are a few limitations to the effectiveness of the method of loci. For example, Cornoldi and De Beni (1991) and Moe and De Beni (2005) demonstrated the method of loci to be more effective than cumulative verbal rehearsal for learning complicated verbal material (e.g., extensive discourse) with oral but not written presentation. Also, Canellopoulou and Richardson (1998) found that neurologically impaired participants benefit from the method of loci when imagery is provided but not with self-generated imagery. This finding is consistent with the argument that formal mnemonics may be too cumbersome for brain-injured learners (McKinlay, 1992; Richardson, 1995).

□挂钩词法

□ The Peg-Word Method

挂钩词法通常用于列表的序列学习；然而，该方法在任何需要准确序列回忆的情况下都很有用。

The peg-word method is typically used for serial learning of lists; however, the method could be helpful in any situation that demands accurate serial recall.

基本步骤。使用挂钩词法的第一步是学习一个挂钩词列表，它将作为组织待记忆列表的框架。最常见的是，挂钩词列表与数字押韵。例如，挂钩词列表可能包括单词bun、shoe、tree、door、hive、sticks、heaven、gate、wine和hen。请注意，此列表中的单词按顺序与数字 1 到 10 押韵。在记住挂钩词列表后，学习者在每个待记忆项目和挂钩词之间形成一个交互式心理图像。因此，形成的第一个图像将包括第一个目标列表项目和第一个挂钩词（bun），第二个图像将包括第二个目标列表项目和第二个挂钩词（shoe），依此类推。在检索时，学习者开始按顺序从 1 到 10 进行数字检索，这将提示挂钩词和与其相关的目标项目。

Basic Procedures. The first step in using the peg-word method is to learn a list of peg words that will serve as a framework for the organization of to-be-remembered lists. Most commonly, the list of peg words rhymes with numbers. For example, the peg-words list might include the words bun, shoe, tree, door, hive, sticks, heaven, gate, wine, and hen. Notice that the words in this list rhyme, in serial order, with the numbers 1 through 10. After committing the peg-word list to memory, the learner forms an interactive mental image between each to-be-remembered item and a peg word. Thus, the first image formed will include the first target-list item and the first peg word (bun), the second image will include the second target-list item and the second peg word (shoe), and so on. At the time of retrieval, the learner begins a serial progression through the numbers 1 through 10, which will cue the peg words and the target items associated with them.

使用示例。考虑这样一种情况，一位历史系学生必须学习与 1906 年《古物法》相关细节。这项法案的正式名称是《美国古物保护法案》，美国总统曾据此设立国家纪念碑。在这种情况下，假设这位历史系学生希望使用挂钩词法记住前五个国家纪念碑，按它们的设立顺序排列。第一个国家纪念碑是魔鬼塔——由火山活动形成的地貌，位于现在的怀俄明州克鲁克县。为了记住这座纪念碑，学生可以在脑海中形成一个魔鬼在塔顶吃面包的互动画面。第二个国家纪念碑是石化森林。石化森林位于亚利桑那州的阿帕奇县和纳瓦霍县，是世界上最大的石化木集中地之一。学生可以想象一双由石化木制成的鞋子（例如，一双彩色木屐）来记住这座纪念碑。第三个建立的国家纪念碑是亚利桑那州亚瓦派县的蒙特苏马城堡。蒙特苏马城堡是 15 世纪西纳瓜人居住的悬崖住宅区。可以通过在脑海中想象一座像树屋一样坐落在树上的城堡来记住这座纪念碑。如果学生想添加额外的提示来记住“蒙特苏马”，他可以在城堡的入口处放一个大大的“M”。铭文岩（正式名称为 El Morro）是第四个建立的国家纪念碑。铭文岩是新墨西哥州西波拉县的一块砂岩峭壁，上面刻满了美洲原住民的岩画和早期西班牙探险家的铭文。学生可以通过在脑海中想象一扇由岩石和砂岩制成的门来记住这座纪念碑，门上可能还有雕刻。查科峡谷位于新墨西哥州的圣胡安县和麦金利县，是第五个建立的国家纪念碑。它集中了公元900年至1150年间居住在该地区的古代普韦布洛人的大量遗迹。为了记住这座纪念碑，学生可以想象一个蜂巢在一个峡谷里挤满了戴着军帽的蜜蜂。对于那些不熟悉的人来说，西班牙语单词“chaco”翻译成英语时发音相似，意思是“shako”。军帽是一种军帽，各国军队和军事院校在仪仗队仪式上佩戴。

Example of Use. Consider a situation in which a history student must learn details associated with the Antiquities Act of 1906. Formally known as An Act for the Preservation of American Antiquities, this act has been used by U.S. presidents to establish national monuments. In this case, let us say that the history student wishes to use the peg-word method to remember the first five national monuments in the order that they were established. The first national monument established was Devils Tower—a landform created from volcanic activity in what is now Crook County, Wyoming. To remember this monument, the student might form an interactive mental image of a devil eating a bun at the top of a tower. The second national monument established was the Petrified Forest. Located in Apache and Navajo counties, Arizona, the Petrified Forest is one of the largest concentrations of petrified wood in the world. The student might imagine a pair shoes made of petrified wood (e.g., a colorful pair of clogs) to remember this monument. The third national monument to be established was Montezuma Castle in Yavapai County, Arizona. Montezuma Castle is an area of cliff dwellings inhabited by the Sinagua people in the 1400s. This monument could be remembered by forming an image of a castle nestled in a tree like a tree house. If the student wishes to add an additional cue to remember “Montezuma,” he could place a large “M” at the entrance of the castle. Inscription Rock (known formally as El Morro) was the fourth national monument established. Inscription Rock is sandstone bluff in Cibola County, New Mexico, on which Native American petroglyphs and inscriptions from early Spanish explorers were carved. The student could remember this monument by forming a mental image of a door made of rock and sandstone that might also include carvings. Located in San Juan and McKinley counties, New Mexico, Chaco Canyon was the fifth national monument established. It contains a large concentration of ruins of the ancient Pueblo people who inhabited the area between 900 and 1150 (AD). To remember this monument, the student could imagine a beehive in a canyon that is swarming with bees wearing shakos. For those unfamiliar, the Spanish word chaco translates to the similar sounding shako in English. A shako is a military cap that is used during ceremonial guard by militaries and military academies in a variety of countries.

当学生需要按顺序记住古迹列表时，他必须首先回忆起他的挂钩词列表。每个挂钩词和数字之间的押韵关系有助于检索挂钩词列表。因此，对于第一项，学生将检索到bun，它现在与塔中吃面包的魔鬼相关联。此图像将提示第一个已建立的国家纪念碑：魔鬼塔。第二项在记忆中将以shoes为代表——在本例中，是一只由石化木制成的鞋子。石化鞋的图像将提示第二个国家纪念碑：石化森林。第三个需要记住的项目将以tree为代表，它现在与一座装饰有大写“M”的城堡式树屋相关联。此图像将提示蒙特苏马城堡，这是已建立的第三个国家纪念碑。第四项由door为代表，具体来说是一扇由雕刻的岩石和砂岩制成的门。此图像将提示铭文岩。最后，第五项由hive为代表。“蜂巢”将与峡谷中蜂巢联系起来，那里挤满了戴着高筒高筒靴的蜜蜂。这张照片将提示第五个国家保护区的建立：查科峡谷。

When the student needs to remember the list of monuments in order, he must first recall his list of peg words. The retrieval of the list of peg words will be aided by the rhyming relationship between each peg word and a number. Thus, for item number one, the student will retrieve bun, which is now associated with a bun-eating devil in a tower. This image will cue the first national monument established: Devils Tower. Item number two will be represented in memory by shoe—in this case, a shoe made of petrified wood. The image of a petrified shoe will cue the second national monument: the Petrified Forest. The third to-be-remembered item will be represented by tree, which is now associated with a castle-like tree house adorned with a large “M.” This image will cue Montezuma Castle, which is the third national monument established. Item number four is represented by door, specifically a door made of carved rock and sandstone. This image will cue Inscription Rock. Finally, item number five is represented by hive. Hive will be associated with a hive in a canyon that is swarming with shako-wearing bees. This image will cue the fifth national monument established: Chaco Canyon.

潜在过程。与位置法类似，挂钩词法也涉及大量的加工和组织，最终应产生独特的加工效果。所有待记忆项目都通过与有序数字的关联按顺序排列。以交互式心理意象的形式进行加工，并与挂钩词进行关联，应能提高目标信息的高度可辨性。

Underlying Processes. Like the method of loci, the peg-word method involves a good deal of elaboration and organization, which should ultimately result in distinctive processing. All to-be-remembered items are organized serially by virtue of association with ordered numbers. Elaboration in the form of interactive mental imagery and association with the peg words should lead to high discriminability for the target information.

帮助记忆魔鬼塔的图像是一个相当直观、虽然略显怪异的交互式心理意象。由于这座纪念碑名称的具体性，构建这一图像需要相对简单的编码。用于记忆石化森林的石化木鞋图像是一个高度交互的图像，根据所想象的鞋子类型，它既可能很常见，也可能很奇特。例如，木屐的图像相对常见，而木制运动鞋的图像则相当奇特。象征蒙特苏马城堡的树顶城堡图像是另一个交互式图像，但由于“蒙特苏马”（城堡上的“M”）的提示相对较弱，因此与之前的图像相比，该联想可能需要更多的练习。铭文岩的图像由一扇由岩石和砂岩制成的门组成，门上刻有文字。与蒙特苏马城堡的图像一样，如果学习者难以将雕刻作为“铭文”的提示，那么铭文岩的交互式图像可能需要额外的练习。也就是说，这幅图像或许能提示出纪念碑的特征，但如果没有它，具体的名称可能更难恢复。额外的彩排。第五个国家纪念碑由一个奇怪的互动图像代表：峡谷中的一个蜂巢，里面挤满了戴着高筒军帽的蜜蜂。

The image formed to assist in remembering Devils Tower is a fairly straightforward, though somewhat bizarre, interactive mental image. Developing this image requires relatively simple encoding because of the concrete nature of the monument’s name. The image of shoes made of petrified wood used to remember the Petrified Forest is a highly interactive image that could be either common or bizarre depending on the type of shoe imaged. For example, whereas an image of wooden clogs would be relatively common, an image of wooden sneakers would be rather bizarre. The image of a castle atop a tree representing Montezuma Castle is another interactive image, but the association may require more rehearsal than the previous images because of the relatively weak cue for “Montezuma” (the “M” on the castle). Inscription Rock was represented by a door made of rocks and sandstone that had been carved upon. Like the image used for Montezuma Castle, the interactive image for Inscription Rock may require additional rehearsal if the learner has trouble with carvings as a cue for “Inscription.” That is, the characteristics of the monument may be cued by this image, but the specific name may be more difficult to recover without additional rehearsal. The fifth national monument was represented by a bizarre interactive image of a hive in a canyon that was swarming with shako-wearing bees.

对挂钩词法背后过程的考察表明，其功能成分与位置法（method of loci）中相关的成分相同。具体而言，两者都通过精细编码和序列组织相结合的方式，引发独特的加工过程。在本例中，精细编码是每个待记忆项目与先前学过的挂钩词之间建立关联的结果，这种关联通过交互式心理意象得以巩固。组织是通过挂钩词与一系列序列号之间的押韵关系来对待记忆信息进行。最终，将形成强有力的检索线索，从而帮助记忆成功。

Examination of the processes underlying the use of the peg-word method reveals that the functional components are identical to those associated with the method of loci. Specifically, both induce distinctive processing by a combination of elaborative encoding and serial organization. In the present example, elaboration is the result of the association between each to-be-remembered item and a previously learned peg word, which is consolidated by the use of interactive mental imagery. Organization is exerted on the to-be-remembered information by virtue of the rhyming relationship between the peg words and a list of serial numbers. Ultimately, strong retrieval cues will be formed that should lead to mnemonic success.

研究支持。研究发现，挂钩词法可以提高即时和延迟测试中的序列回忆能力 (Elliott & Gentile, 1986; Wang & Thomas, 2000)。此外，研究表明，该方法对不同年龄段的正常学习者和学习障碍学习者均有效 (Bugelski, 1968; Bugelski, Kidd, & Segmen, 1968; Elliott & Gentile, 1986; Krinsky & Krinsky, 1996; Veit, Scruggs, & Mastropieri, 1986; Wood & Pratt, 1987)。重要的是，研究 (Massen & Vaterrodt-Plunnecke, 2006; Morris & Reid, 1970) 还表明，重复使用单一挂钩词列表不会产生干扰效应。然而，待记忆项目之间的类别相关性（Reddy & Bellezza，1986）和快速刺激呈现（Bugelski et al.，1968）可能会降低该方法的有效性。

Research Support. The peg-word method has been found to improve serial recall with both immediate and delayed testing (Elliott & Gentile, 1986; Wang & Thomas, 2000). Furthermore, research indicates that the method is effective for both normal and learning-disabled learners across a wide range of ages (Bugelski, 1968; Bugelski, Kidd, & Segmen, 1968; Elliott & Gentile, 1986; Krinsky & Krinsky, 1996; Veit, Scruggs, & Mastropieri, 1986; Wood & Pratt, 1987). Importantly, research (Massen & Vaterrodt-Plunnecke, 2006; Morris & Reid, 1970) also indicates that repeated use of a single list of peg words does not result in interference effects. However, category-relatedness among to-be-remembered items (Reddy & Bellezza, 1986) and rapid stimulus presentation (Bugelski et al., 1968) may reduce the effectiveness of the method.

□关键词法

□ The Keyword Method

关键词法由 Raugh 和 Atkinson (1975) 设计，旨在专门提升二语习得。与位置法和挂钩词法不同，关键词法并非旨在增强序列回忆，而是旨在增强线索回忆。具体来说，该方法旨在帮助学生在面对外语词汇时记忆定义。然而，关键词法的应用并不局限于二语学习，它适用于任何词汇学习情境。

The keyword method was designed by Raugh and Atkinson (1975) specifically to enhance second-language acquisition. Unlike the method of loci and the peg-word method, the keyword method was designed not to enhance serial recall but to enhance cued recall. Specifically, the method was designed to aid memory for definitions when presented with foreign vocabulary. However, the application of the keyword method is not limited to second-language learning, as it can be useful for any vocabulary-learning situation.

基本步骤。关键词教学法首先要明确学习词汇的定义和正确发音。接下来，学习者从其母语中选择一个与正确发音的外来词发音相似的单词。这个发音相似的单词将被视为关键词。最后，一个交互式的视觉在关键词和外来词定义之间建立心理意象。当测试中出现需要定义的外来词时，该词的发音会提示先前形成的交互式心理意象，其中包含需要回忆的定义的表征。

Basic Procedures. The use of the keyword method begins with the definition and correct pronunciation of the vocabulary term to be learned. Next, the learner selects a word from her primary language that sounds similar to the correctly pronounced foreign word. This similar-sounding word will be considered the keyword. Finally, an interactive visual mental image between the keyword and the definition of the foreign word is created. When the foreign word to be defined is presented at testing, the pronunciation of the word will cue the previously formed interactive mental image, which contains a representation of the definition to be recalled.

Raugh 和 Atkinson (1975；另见 Atkinson & Raugh, 1975) 建议在选择关键词时必须满足三个标准。首先，关键词必须与外来词发音尽可能相似。虽然满足这一要求有时会很困难，但 Raugh 和 Atkinson 指出，关键词不必发音与整个外来词相同，与外来词的一部分相似即可。例如，如果外来词是多音节词，则关键词只需与其中一个音节发音相似即可。此外，关键词不一定非得是一个单词，它可以是一个完整的短语。选择关键词的第二个标准是，关键词易于与外来词的定义形成互动意象。因此，易于用象征意象表示的具体词或抽象词将是最佳关键词。 Raugh 和 Atkinson 规定的最后一个标准是，给定的关键词只能用于特定日期学习的给定词汇表中的某个词汇。也就是说，虽然给定的关键词在特定学习环节中不应使用超过一次，但之前使用过的关键词可以在不同日期学习不同词汇表时再次使用。

Raugh and Atkinson (1975; see also Atkinson & Raugh, 1975) suggested that three criteria must be met in the selection of keywords. First, the keyword must sound as similar as possible to the foreign word. Although fulfilling this requirement can sometimes be difficult, Raugh and Atkinson noted that the keyword need not sound like the entire foreign word; similarity to part of the foreign word will suffice. For example, if the foreign word is polysyllabic, the keyword needs to sound similar to only one of the syllables. Also, the keyword does not necessarily have to be a single word at all—it can be an entire phrase. The second criterion in the selection of a keyword is that it lends itself to an easily formed interactive image with the definition of the foreign word. As such, concrete words or abstract words that can be easily represented by symbolic imagery will make the best keywords. The final criterion specified by Raugh and Atkinson is that a given keyword should be used for only one vocabulary term within a given list to be learned on a particular day. That is, although a given keyword should not be used more than once in a given learning session, a keyword used previously can be used again when learning a different list of vocabulary terms on a different day.

使用示例。假设一名西班牙学生在学习bigote、reina、arbol、lago和tenedor这些词汇时遇到了困难。这些词的英语翻译分别是mustache、queen、tree、lake和fork。要使用关键词法记住bigote的意思是胡子，学生首先要选择一个与bigote的正确发音(bee-goat-ay) 发音相似的英语单词。在这种情况下，选择与西班牙语单词一个音节发音相似的关键词可能是最简单的。例如，学生可以选择英语单词goat作为关键词。然后，学生会在关键词和bigote的定义之间形成一个互动图像，例如一只留着长八字胡的山羊。西班牙语单词reina 的发音为“rain-uh”。因此，要记住reina的意思是女王，学生可以在脑海中形成一个女王站在雨中的图像。Arbol 的意思是树，发音为“arebowl”。为了记住这个定义，学生可以在脑海中想象一棵树从一个大碗里长出来。为了记住lago（发音为“log-oh”）的意思是“湖”，学生可以想象一根木头漂浮在湖面上。Tenedor的发音为“tay-nay-door”。可以用一扇被叉子刺穿的门来记住tenedor 的意思是“叉子”。

Example of Use. Suppose a Spanish student is having trouble learning the vocabulary terms bigote, reina, arbol, lago, and tenedor. The respective English translations of these words are mustache, queen, tree, lake, and fork. To remember that bigote means moustache using the keyword method, the student would first select an English word that sounds similar to the correct pronunciation of bigote (bee-goat-ay). In this case, it might be easiest to choose a keyword that sounds similar to one syllable of the Spanish word. For example, the student might choose the English word goat to use as the keyword. The student would then form an interactive image between the keyword and the definition of bigote such as a goat with a long handlebar moustache. The Spanish word reina is pronounced “rain-uh.” Thus, to remember that reina means queen, the student could form a mental image of a queen standing in the rain. Arbol means tree and is pronounced “arebowl.” To remember this definition, the student could form a mental image of a tree growing out of a giant bowl. To remember that lago (pronounced “log-oh”) means lake, the student could form an image of a log floating in a lake. Tenedor is pronounced “tay-nay-door.” An image of a door impaled by a fork could be used to remember that tenedor means fork.

西班牙语词汇定义的记忆将通过每个词的发音来提示。因此，正确发音“bigote”将提示关键词“山羊”及其对应的山羊图像。胡子。根据设计，图像将包含目标西班牙语单词的定义。同样，其他词汇的正确发音将提示其各自的关键词，这些关键词将通过心理意象与相应的正确定义联系起来。

Memory for the definitions of the Spanish vocabulary terms will be cued by the pronunciation of each term. Thus, correct pronunciation of bigote will cue the keyword goat and the corresponding image of a goat with a moustache. By design, the image will contain the definition of the target Spanish word. Similarly, correct pronunciation of the other vocabulary terms will cue their respective keywords, which will be associated via mental imagery with their proper definitions.

潜在加工过程。关键词方法的主要潜在特征在于，除了通过选择性编码形成的音素-语义关系之外，还在于交互式心理意象的精细加工和组织特性。因此，差异性加工为该方法奠定了基础。

Underlying Processes. The main underlying features of the keyword method are the elaborative and organizational properties of interactive mental imagery in addition to the phonemic–semantic relationships formed through selective encoding. As such, distinctive processing provides the foundation for this method.

使用关键词方法时形成的所有图像都利用了关键词与目标词正确发音之间的音位关系以及关键词与英语翻译之间的关联。但是，形成的图像的助记属性可能存在细微的差异。例如，为记住bigote和tenedor的含义而形成的图像基于它们最容易想象的音节。请注意，对于tenedor，可以使用关键词neigh，它对应于该术语的第二个音节。但是，neigh需要次要图像（马），而关键词door可以直接想象。此外，用于bigote、arbol和tenedor 的图像相对奇怪，而用于lago和reina 的图像则很常见。如前所述，这种常见和奇怪图像的混合可以增强该方法的有效性。

All images formed when using the keyword method capitalize on a phonemic relationship between the keyword and the correct pronunciation of the target word as well as an association between the keyword and an English translation. However, there may be some slight variability in mnemonic properties of the images formed. For example, the images formed for remembering the meanings of bigote and tenedor were based on their most easily imaged syllables. Notice that for tenedor one could have used the keyword neigh, which corresponds to the second syllable of the term. However, neigh requires a secondary image (a horse) whereas the keyword door can be imaged directly. Also, the images used for bigote, arbol, and tenedor were relatively bizarre, whereas the images used for lago and reina were common. As has been noted previously, this mixture of common and bizarre imagery may enhance the effectiveness of the method.

研究支持。实证研究表明，关键词法是学习西班牙语（Raugh & Atkinson, 1975）、俄语（Atkinson & Raugh, 1975）、德语（Desrochers, Wieland & Cote, 1991）、汉语（Wang & Thomas, 1992）和他加禄语（Wang, Thomas & Ouellette, 1992）等语言词汇的有效策略。关键词法还被证明能够提高正常人群（Levin, Levin, Glasman & Nordwall, 1992；Sweeney & Bellezza, 1982；Troutt-Ervin, 1990）和学习障碍人群（Cundus, Marshall & Miller, 1986；Mastropieri, Scruggs & Fulk, 1990）的母语词汇学习效果。

Research Support. Empirical research has demonstrated the keyword method to be an effective strategy for learning vocabularies in languages such as Spanish (Raugh & Atkinson, 1975), Russian (Atkinson & Raugh, 1975), German (Desrochers, Wieland, & Cote, 1991), Chinese (Wang & Thomas, 1992), and Tagalog (Wang, Thomas, & Ouellette, 1992). The keyword method has also been shown to enhance vocabulary learning in one’s primary language among both normal (Levin, Levin, Glasman, & Nordwall, 1992; Sweeney & Bellezza, 1982; Troutt-Ervin, 1990) and learning-disabled (Cundus, Marshall, & Miller, 1986; Mastropieri, Scruggs, & Fulk, 1990) populations.

除了加强词汇学习之外，关键词方法还被发现可以有效提高对其他类型信息的记忆，例如艺术家（Carney & Levin，1991）、植物学（Rosenheck、Levin & Levin，1989）和音乐史（Brigham & Brigham，1998）所使用的信息。

In addition to enhancing vocabulary learning, the keyword method has been found to be effective in improving memory for other types of information such as that used by artists (Carney & Levin, 1991), in botany (Rosenheck, Levin, & Levin, 1989), and in music history (Brigham & Brigham, 1998).

尽管关键词法通常被认为是一种有效的记忆方法，但研究也发现了该方法的一些潜在局限性。首先，一些研究（Thomas & Wang，1996；Wang & Thomas，1995；Wang、Thomas、Inzana & Primicerio，1993；Wang et al.，1992）表明，关键词法在长时间保留间隔后并不能提高记忆效果（参见Carney & Levin，1998a、2000a，了解可能的例外情况）。最近的研究（Worthen、Fontenelle、Deschamps & Foreman，2008）也表明，这种方法在以听觉而非视觉呈现待学习信息方面更有效。其他研究表明，语言能力（Dretzke，1993）和心理意象的质量（Beaton、Gruneburg、Hyde、Shufflebottom & Sykes，2005；Campos、Amor & Gonzalez，2004）可能会影响该方法的有效性。最后，研究（van Hell & Mahn，1997）表明，对于经验丰富的外语学习者来说，死记硬背可能比关键词法更有效。

Although the keyword method is generally considered an effective mnemonic, research has uncovered some potential limitations of the method. First, several studies (Thomas & Wang, 1996; Wang & Thomas, 1995; Wang, Thomas, Inzana, & Primicerio, 1993; Wang et al., 1992) suggest that the keyword method does not improve memory after a long retention interval (see Carney & Levin, 1998a, 2000a, for possible exceptions). Recent research (Worthen, Fontenelle, Deschamps, & Foreman, 2008) also suggests that the method is more effective with auditory than visual presentation of the to-be-learned information. Other research suggests that both verbal ability (Dretzke, 1993) and the quality of mental imagery (Beaton, Gruneburg, Hyde, Shufflebottom, & Sykes, 2005; Campos, Amor, & Gonzalez, 2004) may moderate the effectiveness of the method. Finally, research (van Hell & Mahn, 1997) indicates that rote memorization may be more effective than the keyword method for experienced foreign-language learners.

□语音系统

□ The Phonetic System

语音系统是一个相当复杂的系统，专门用于帮助记忆数字。需要注意的是，该系统有时也被称为数字辅音法或大写字母系统。

The phonetic system is a rather complicated system designed specifically to aid recall of numbers. It should be noted that this system is sometimes referred to as the digit–consonant method or the major system.

基本流程。基于单词比数字更容易记忆的理念，语音系统将数字转换为字母，然后字母组合成单词。字母代表辅音，因此数字0到9由一个或多个辅音表示。元音不代表数字，但学习者可以随意使用元音来创建由辅音组合而成的单词。当必须记住目标数字时，会恢复代表该数字的单词，然后将其解码回数字。表4.1显示了语音系统的典型表示方案。

Basic Procedures. Based on the notion that words are easier to remember than numbers, the phonetic system involves converting numbers to letters, which are then combined to form words. The letters represent consonant sounds, and thus numbers zero through 9 are represented by one or more consonants. Vowels do not represent numbers but are used arbitrarily by the learner to create words for combinations of consonants. When the target number must be remembered, the word representing the number is recovered and then decoded back into numbers. Table 4.1 shows a typical representational scheme for the phonetic system.

表 4.1使用语音系统将字母转换为数字的典型情况
数字字母/辅音声音表示
0软c , s , z
1d、t、th
2n
3米
4r
5升
6ch，软 g ，j
7硬c、硬g、k、qu
8f、ph、v
9b, p
注意：元音可以任意使用来组成单词。

使用示例。假设某人希望购买双筒望远镜，以便将观鸟 (也称为“birding”) 作为一项新爱好。对于新手来说，选择双筒望远镜可能是一项繁琐的任务，部分原因是双筒望远镜的特性是用数字表示的。通常，双筒望远镜是用放大倍数和物镜 (离眼睛最远的镜头) 的直径来指定的。作为一个典型规格的示例，美国海军陆战队 (M25) 的主要野外双筒望远镜的规格为 7×50。第一个数字代表放大倍数，第二个数字代表物镜的直径。因此，M25 的放大倍数会使物体看起来比实际近七倍，物镜的宽度为 50 毫米。物镜的直径很重要，因为它决定了聚集的环境光量，进而决定了图像的清晰度。物镜直径越大，聚集的光线越多，成像也越清晰。然而，物镜直径大的双筒望远镜通常比物镜直径小的双筒望远镜更大更重。

Example of Use. Consider a situation in which a person wishes to purchase binoculars in order to pursue bird-watching (also known as “birding”) as a new hobby. For novices, selecting binoculars can be a cumbersome task partially because the characteristics of binoculars are denoted by numbers. Typically, binoculars are specified in terms of power of magnification and the diameter of the objective lens (the lens farthest from the eye). As an example of a typical specification, the primary field binocular for the U.S. Marine Corps (the M25) is specified at 7×50. The first number represents the magnification, and the second number represents the diameter of the objective lens. Thus, the M25 has a magnification that results in an object appearing seven times closer than it is, and the objective lens is 50mm wide. The diameter of the objective lens is important because it determines the amount of ambient light gathered, which in turn determines the clarity of an image. As the diameter of the objective lens increases, more light can be gathered and images become clearer. However, binoculars with a large objective-lens diameter are generally larger and heavier than those with a small diameter.

选择双筒望远镜时，另一个需要考虑的参数是出瞳距离。出瞳距离决定了在不影响图像完整性的情况下，人眼与目镜之间的距离。典型的出瞳距离为 11 毫米；然而，对于戴眼镜的人来说，通常至少需要 14 毫米的出瞳距离。

Another number that must be considered when selecting binoculars is that associated with eye relief. Eye relief determines the distance one’s eyes can be from the eyepiece without compromising the integrity of the image. A typical eye relief is 11mm; however, for those who wear eyeglasses, a relief of at least 14mm is usually necessary.

假设观鸟者在考虑了双筒望远镜的预期用途后，得出结论，她需要一架易于携带且具有中等度数的双筒望远镜。此外，因为她戴厚眼镜，所以她需要很长的出瞳距离。最终，观鸟者决定购买出瞳距离为 15 毫米的 8×30 双筒望远镜。使用表 4.1中描述的系统，她可以通过将 8×30 转换为单词famous并将数字 15 转换为tool来记住双筒望远镜的规格。因此，双筒望远镜的规格可以用famous tool来表示。在这种情况下，8 用f表示，30 用ms表示。元音a、o和u相加构成单词famous 。类似地，数字 15用t和l表示，再加上os构成单词tool。当需要记住双筒望远镜的规格时，她只需要记住这个著名的工具，然后将字母转换回数字。

Let us say that the birder, after considering the intended uses of the binoculars, concludes that she needs binoculars that are easy to carry and have mid-range power. In addition, because she wears thick eyeglasses, she needs a good deal of eye relief. Ultimately, the birder decides to purchase 8×30 binoculars with a 15mm eye relief. Using the system described in Table 4.1, she can remember the specifications of the binoculars by converting 8×30 to the word famous and the number 15 to tool. Thus, the specifications of the binoculars can be represented by famous tool. In this case, 8 is represented by f, and 30 is represented by ms. The vowels a, o, and u are added to form the word famous. Similarly, the number 15 is represented by t and l with os added to form the word tool. When it comes time to remember the specifications of her binoculars, she need remember only her famous tool and then convert the letters back to numbers.

底层过程。语音系统的使用主要涉及两个过程。首先，数字到字母的转换编码。其次，这些字母被加工成单词。构建能够引发心理意象的具体单词应该能够增强新表征的独特性 (Hunt & Marschark, 1987)。然而，待记忆的数字与其单词表征之间的联想联系取决于能否正确地重新转换为数字。虽然重新转换为数字是在使用挂钩词方法时也会涉及这一点，在这种情况下，每个挂钩词和序列号之间的押韵关系有助于重新转换。此外，这种押韵关系减少了对挂钩词列表的记忆要求，从而为恢复目标项目提供了更多的认知资源。不幸的是，语音系统并没有内置的机制来减少与转换或重新转换为数字相关的认知负荷。因此，该系统繁琐的程序可能会抵消详细说明和心理意象带来的好处。虽然一些研究人员（例如，Bellezza，Six，& Phillips，1992；Bower，1978；Carney & Levin，1994）提出了助记符来增强对语音转换的记忆，但这些程序不太可能显著降低掌握该系统的难度。

Underlying Processes. There are two main processes underlying the use of the phonetic system. First, transformational encoding is involved in the conversion of numbers to letters. Next these letters are elaborated on to construct words. Construction of concrete words that induce mental imagery should increase the distinctiveness of the new representation (Hunt & Marschark, 1987). However, the associative link between the to-be-remembered number and its word representation depends on correct reconversion to numbers. Although reconversion to numbers is also involved when using the peg-word method, in that case the rhyming relationship between each peg word and a serial number serves to aid reconversion. Moreover, this rhyming relationship decreases demands on memory for the list of peg words, which allows more cognitive resources to be available for the recovery of the target item. Unfortunately, the phonetic system does not have a built-in mechanism to reduce the cognitive load associated with either conversion or reconversion to numbers. For that reason, the cumbersome procedures of the system have the potential to outweigh the benefits of elaboration and mental imagery. Although some researchers (e.g., Bellezza, Six, & Phillips, 1992; Bower, 1978; Carney & Levin, 1994) have offered mnemonics to enhance memory for the phonetic conversions, it is unlikely that these procedures significantly reduce the difficulty of mastering the system.

研究支持。关于语音系统有效性的初步研究结果好坏参半。Bruce 和 Clemons (1982) 发现该方法对增强公制换算和标准测量单位的记忆无效。同样，Patton (1986) 发现语音系统无助于回忆日期、地址和电话号码，有时甚至会阻碍回忆。与这些结果相反，Morris 和 Greer (1983) 发现该系统对记忆两位数列表有效。后续研究（Patton、D'Agaro 和 Gaudette，1991；Patton 和 Lanzy，1987）通过证明语音系统的有效性取决于参与者是获得换算还是自行生成换算，为理解先前结果的差异提供了线索。具体而言，这些研究表明，当提供换算时，该系统有效，但当参与者自行生成换算时则无效。考虑到该方法的整体使用难度，这些发现并不令人意外。

Research Support. The results of initial research investigating the efficacy of the phonetic system were mixed. Bruce and Clemons (1982) found the method to be ineffective in enhancing memory for metric conversions and standard measurements. Similarly, Patton (1986) found that the phonetic system did not facilitate and sometimes hindered recall of dates, addresses, and phone numbers. Contrary to these results, Morris and Greer (1983) found the system to be effective for remembering lists of two-digit numbers. Subsequent research (Patton, D’Agaro, & Gaudette, 1991; Patton & Lanzy, 1987) provided clues to understanding the discrepancy in previous results by demonstrating that the effectiveness of the phonetic system depends on whether participants were supplied with conversions or generated conversions themselves. Specifically, these studies indicated that the system is effective when conversions are provided but not when they are self-generated. These findings are not surprising given the overall difficulty of use of the method.

Bellezza 等人（1992）指出，语音系统的原始表述并不能很好地适应大数字。为了解决这个问题，他们建议将长数字分解成数字对，每个数字对都用一个单词表示。然后，他们构建一个故事，将这些单词按顺序串联起来。尽管作者证明了这些程序能够增强对长串数字的记忆，但值得注意的是，当程序中也包含位置记忆法的组成部分时，记忆效果最佳。

Bellezza et al. (1992) pointed out that the original formulation of the phonetic system does not accommodate large numbers especially well. As a remedy to this problem, they suggested that long numbers be broken down into digit pairs that are each represented by a single word. A story is then constructed to link the words together in serial order. Although the authors demonstrated that these procedures led to strong memory for long strings of digits, it should be noted that the memory performance was best when components of the method of loci were also included in the procedures.

研究（例如，Thompson、Cowan 和 Frieman，1993 年；Wilding 和 Valentine，1994 年）表明，具有卓越记忆力的人经常使用该语音系统。人们可以将此解读为该语音系统能够带来卓越的记忆力。另一方面，考虑到该方法的整体复杂性和使用难度，这一发现也可以被解读为，卓越的认知能力是有效使用该方法的必要条件。支持性前一种观点认为，Higbee (1997) 证明，即使是新手，经过大量训练也能展现出与记忆大师类似的记忆能力。无论如何，与 Patton 和 Lanzy (1987) 的结论一致，语音系统可能不切实际，甚至可能不适用于日常用途。

Research (e.g., Thompson, Cowan, & Frieman, 1993; Wilding & Valentine, 1994) has suggested that the phonetic system is frequently used by those with exceptional memory skills. One could interpret this to mean that the phonetic system can lead to exceptional memory performance. On the other hand, given the overall complexity and difficulty of use of this method, this finding could be interpreted to suggest that exceptional cognitive ability is necessary for effective use of the method. Supporting the former argument, Higbee (1997) demonstrated that with a good deal of training, even novices can demonstrate feats of memory similar to those of mnemonists. Regardless, in keeping with the conclusions of Patton and Lanzy (1987), the phonetic system is likely to be impractical and possibly ineffective for casual purposes.

□总结与结论

□ Summary and Conclusions

我们对流行的正式助记符样本的研究表明，即使是复杂的助记符的有效性也是一些基本认知过程的组合。由精细加工和组织相互作用而产生的独特处理对于助记符的成功尤为重要。心理意象也起着重要作用，因为它同时具有精细加工和组织特性。了解助记符有效性背后的过程对于有兴趣使用正式助记符的人和希望自己设计助记符的人来说都很重要。在前一种情况下，了解这些过程将使人们能够调整他人设计的助记符，而不会无意中降低其有效性。对于那些对新的助记符技术感兴趣的人来说，了解背后的过程提供了创建有效学习程序所需的工具。

Examination of our sample of popular formal mnemonics indicates that the effectiveness of even complex mnemonics results from a combination of a few basic cognitive processes. Distinctive processing resulting from the interplay of elaboration and organization is particularly fundamental to mnemonic success. Mental imagery also plays an important role, due to having both elaborative and organizational properties. Knowledge of the processes underlying mnemonic effectiveness is important to both those who are interested in using formal mnemonics and those who wish to devise their own. In the former case, knowledge of the processes will allow one to tweak mnemonics devised by others without inadvertently diminishing effectiveness. For those interested in new mnemonic techniques, knowledge of the underlying processes provides the tools necessary for creating effective learning procedures.

5

摄氏度哈一个磷T埃R		 

组织助记符

Organizational Mnemonics

组织记忆法的主要目的是将待记忆信息以一种便于记忆的方式组织起来。虽然我们在前几章中提到了组织的重要性，但我们也指出，只有将组织与精细加工相结合，从而产生独特的加工方式，才能充分发挥组织的助记优势。因此，主要依赖于组织的助记法在某些情况下可能有所帮助，但除非它们也包含鼓励精细加工的机制，否则其有效性通常有限。在本章中，我们将讨论仅依赖于组织的助记法，以及主要用于组织信息但也鼓励一定程度精细加工的助记法。

The main purpose of organizational mnemonics is to organize to-beremembered information in a way that facilitates remembering. Although we noted the importance of organization in preceding chapters, we have also argued that the mnemonic benefits of organization are fully realized only when it is combined with elaboration in a way that results in distinctive processing. Thus, mnemonics that rely predominantly on organization may be helpful in some situations, but their effectiveness is often limited unless they also incorporate mechanisms that encourage elaboration. In this chapter, we discuss mnemonics that rely solely on organization as well as mnemonics that serve primarily to organize information but also encourage a degree of elaboration.

□首字母缩略词助记符

□ Acronym Mnemonics

简单首字母缩略词。用列表中每个待记住条目的首字母创建首字母缩略词是一种相当流行的组织技巧。首字母缩略词记忆法经常被大学生使用（Stalder，2005），它通过用每个条目的首字母表示，将待记住条目列表精简为一个单元。例如，假设一位护理专业的学生希望记住伊丽莎白·库伯勒-罗斯（1969）提出的悲伤的五个阶段。根据库伯勒-罗斯的说法，悲伤过程的第一阶段是否认。在否认阶段，人们会通过拒绝接受令人痛苦的消息来应对它的真实性。在最初的否认之后，人们可能会感到愤怒。正是在愤怒阶段，人们常常会思考导致悲伤的事件发生的原因，然后试图追究责任。在讨价还价阶段，一个人可能会向更高的权力机构寻求缓解不愉快的情况。抑郁阶段通常在协商阶段之后。在此阶段，人们可能会因为过度概括导致悲伤事件的真实或感知上的失控而感到绝望。悲伤过程的最后阶段是接受。在这个阶段，人们可以理性地看待情况，并尝试尽力改善现状。

Simple Acronyms. Creating an acronym out of the first letter of each to-beremembered item of a list is a rather popular organizational technique. Frequently used by college students (Stalder, 2005), acronym mnemonics serve to reduce a list of to-be-remembered items into a single unit by representing each item in terms of its initial letter. For example, consider a nursing student who wishes to memorize the five stages of grief as suggested by Elisabeth Kubler-Ross (1969). According to Kubler-Ross, the first stage of the grief process is denial. During the denial stage, a person deals with distressing news by refusing to accept its veracity. After initial denial, the person may react with anger. It is during the anger stage that a person often wonders why the event causing the grief has occurred and then attempts to assign blame. In the bargaining stage, a person might appeal to a higher power for a reprieve from the unpleasant situation. The depressive stage typically follows the bargaining stage. During this stage, the person may feel hopeless as the result of overgeneralization of a real or perceived lack of control of the grief-inducing event. The final stage of the grief process is acceptance. It is during this stage when a person may address the situation philosophically and attempt to make the best of the situation.

使用首字母缩略词助记符，学习者可以将悲伤的五个阶段简化为一个音素单元：“DABDA”。这个首字母缩略词可能通过两种方式帮助记忆。首先，将五个阶段简化为一个组块，这应该可以减少检索过程中的认知负荷。其次，这种特殊的组块方法应该可以提高准确序列回忆的概率，因为悲伤的各个阶段是在音素关联的背景下按顺序组织的。

Using an acronym mnemonic, learners can reduce the five stages of grief into a single phonemic unit: “DABDA.” This acronym could potentially aid memory in two ways. First, the five stages are reduced into a single chunk, which should reduce cognitive load during retrieval. Second, this particular method of chunking should increase the probability of accurate serial recall because the phases of grief are serially organized within the context of the phonemic association.

尽管有这些潜在的优势，简单的首字母缩略词助记符也存在一些缺陷，限制了它的有效性。首先，像上面的例子一样，大多数待记忆列表都会生成一个代表无意义音素单位的首字母缩略词。也就是说，首字母缩略词通过分块来缩减列表，但结果通常是一个无意义的词。虽然这个问题有时可以通过重新排列首字母的顺序来解决，但这种解决方案会使序列回忆变得复杂。由于用这种方法得到的首字母缩略词本质上毫无意义，语义阐述和使用心理意象的可能性大大降低。虽然这种方法确实会导致一些无意义的阐述，但很明显，简单的首字母缩略词助记符并不能强烈促进区别处理。与这些论点一致，实证研究表明，使用简单的首字母缩略词助记符的效果有限（例如，Carlson、Zimmer 和 Glover，1981；Kovar 和 Van Pelt，1991），甚至完全无效（例如，Boltwood 和 Blick，1970；Gruneberg，1973；Waite、Blick 和 Boltwood，1971）。

Despite these potential advantages, a simple acronym mnemonic has deficiencies that limit its effectiveness. First, like the example above, most to-be-remembered lists result in an acronym that represents a phonemic unit that is void of meaning. That is, the acronym reduces the list by chunking, but the result is typically a nonsense word. Although this problem can be occasionally remedied by rearranging the order of the initial letters, this solution can complicate serial recall. With the acronyms resulting from this method being essentially meaningless, the possibilities of semantic elaboration and the use of mental imagery are greatly reduced. Although the method does lead to some nonmeaningful elaboration, it is clear that a simple acronym mnemonic does not strongly encourage distinctive processing. In line with these arguments, empirical research suggests that the use of simple acronym mnemonics is of limited effectiveness (e.g., Carlson, Zimmer, & Glover, 1981; Kovar & Van Pelt, 1991) if not completely ineffective (e.g., Boltwood & Blick, 1970; Gruneberg, 1973; Waite, Blick, & Boltwood, 1971).

修饰缩略词。Stalder（2005）尝试通过在缩略词中添加无关字母来增强简单缩略词的记忆效果，使其更有意义。例如，假设一个人必须学习皮亚杰（1928）认知发展理论中的各个阶段。根据该理论，认知发展分为四个相对独立的阶段。在第一个阶段，即感觉运动阶段，儿童的思维主要由外部刺激和动作事件引发。随着儿童进入前运算阶段，思维变得更加独立于动作，但也会出现逻辑错误。在具体运算阶段，儿童的思维变得越来越合乎逻辑，但这种逻辑思维还不足以完成需要抽象推理的任务。最后，在形式运算阶段，儿童获得了通过逻辑思维处理抽象问题的能力。为了方便记忆这些认知发展阶段，Stalder 建议使用首字母缩略词“SPaCeFarm”，其中四个发展阶段是用字母S、P、C和F表示。请注意，如果没有额外的字母，那么由发展时期的首字母不可能组成有意义的缩写词。但是，加入无关的字母可以使缩写词变得有意义，易于进一步阐述，并且容易想象。因此，通过用有意义的阐述和心理意象补充简单缩写词助记符固有的组织属性，修饰缩写词助记符应该可以鼓励独特的处理，从而比简单缩写词更成功。Stalder 的结果支持这些论点，因为它表明使用修饰缩写词的人比不使用修饰缩写词的人考试成绩更好。但是，提高的成绩只发生在提供缩写词的材料中，并没有扩展到与非缩写词相关的测试项目。

Embellished Acronyms. Stalder (2005) attempted to enhance the effectiveness of the simple acronym mnemonic by adding extraneous letters to acronyms in an effort to make them more meaningful. As an example, consider a situation in which one must learn the periods of Piaget’s (1928) theory of cognitive development. According to this theory, cognitive development proceeds serially through four relatively discrete periods. During the first period, the sensorimotor period, a child’s thinking is mainly focused on and initiated by external stimuli and action events. As a child enters the preoperational period, thinking becomes more independent of action, but it is marked by logical errors. During the concrete operations period, a child’s thinking becomes increasingly logical, but the logical thinking does not extend to tasks that require abstract reasoning. Finally, during the formal operations period, the ability to handle abstract problems through logical thinking is achieved. To facilitate memory for these stages of cognitive development, Stalder suggested the use of the acronym “SPaCeFarm” whereby the four developmental periods are represented by the letters S, P, C, and F. Note that without additional letters, no meaningful acronym can be made by the initial letters of the periods of development. However, the inclusion of extraneous letters allows the acronym to become meaningful, amenable to further elaboration, and easily imagined. Thus, by complementing the inherent organizational properties of the simple acronym mnemonic with meaningful elaboration and mental imagery, the embellished acronym mnemonic should encourage distinctive processing and thus be more successful than a simple acronym. Stalder’s results support these arguments by showing that those who used embellished acronyms demonstrated better exam performance than those who did not. However, the enhanced performance occurred only for material for which acronyms were provided and did not extend to nonacronym-related test items.

另一种修饰首字母缩略词的记忆法是用每个待记单词的首字母组成一个单词，并围绕这些单词构建一个短语或故事。例如，修饰首字母缩略词可用于记忆十二脑神经。这十二脑神经包括视神经、嗅神经、动眼神经、滑车神经、三叉神经、外展神经、面神经、听神经、舌咽神经、迷走神经、脊髓副神经和舌下神经。为了记住这些神经，可以使用修饰首字母缩略词：“在古老的奥林匹斯山巅，一个芬兰人和德国人观赏了一些啤酒花”。这种记忆法对首字母缩略词的固有组织特性进行了大量阐述，并且易于进行心理意象化。因此，它可能会促进独特的处理，从而有效地增强记忆。遗憾的是，目前尚无已发表的实证研究专门评估此类修饰性助记符与其他首字母缩略词助记符的区别。显然，这方面仍有研究空间。更多简单和修饰性首字母缩略词的示例，请参见表5.1。

Another type of embellished acronym mnemonic involves creating a word from the initial letter of each to-be-remembered word and constructing a phrase or story around those words. For example, an embellished acronym can be used to remember the 12 cranial nerves. The 12 cranial nerves are the optic, olfactory, oculomotor, trochlear, trigeminal, abducens, facial, auditory, glossopharyngeal, vagus, spinal accessory, and hypoglossal nerves. To remember these nerves one could use the embellished acronym: “On Old Olympus Towering Tops, A Finn And German Viewed Some Hops.” This mnemonic adds a good deal of elaboration to the inherent organizational properties of the acronym and is amenable to mental imagery. As a result, it is likely to encourage distinctive processing and thus effectively enhance memory. Unfortunately, there are no published empirical studies that specifically evaluate this type of embellished mnemonic as differentiated from other acronym mnemonics. Clearly, there is need for research in this area. Additional examples of simple and embellished acronyms can be found in Table 5.1.

其他注意事项。虽然使用首字母缩略词助记符（尤其是修饰首字母缩略词）有一些优势，但需要注意的是，这类组织性助记符主要用于增强待记忆项目之间的内在关联。因此，单个项目的检索应该会提示所有后续项目的检索。另一方面，对内在关联性的依赖也可能导致无法检索单个待记忆项目可能会对所有后续项目的检索产生负面影响。因此，与其他助记符相比，使用首字母缩略词助记符回忆信息往往更具“全有或全无”的倾向。

Other Considerations. Although there are some advantages to using acronym mnemonics (especially embellished acronyms), it should be noted that organizational mnemonics of this class serve mainly to enhance the intraitem associations among to-be-remembered items. Thus, the retrieval of a single item should cue retrieval of all succeeding items. On the other hand, the dependence on intraitem associations opens the possibility that failure to retrieve a single to-be-remembered item may negatively affect retrieval of all succeeding items. As such, recall of information using acronym mnemonics tends to be more “all or nothing” than other mnemonics.

还应注意，首字母缩略词提供的线索与待记忆项目之间有时会存在相当大的跳跃。例如，虽然用于记住脑神经的首字母缩略词中涉及的修饰词可能会形成一个令人难忘的短语，但该短语并不能为待记忆项目提供强有力的线索。也就是说，“德语”并不能与“舌咽神经”产生明显的关联。因此，

It should also be noted that there is sometimes quite a leap between the cue provided by the acronym and a to-be-remembered item. For example, although the embellishment involved in the acronym for remembering the cranial nerves may result in a memorable phrase, the phrase does not provide strong cues for to-be-remembered items. That is, “German” does not result in an obvious association with “glossopharyngeal.” Thus,

表 5.1首字母缩略词示例
简单（没意义）
BEDMAS：括号、指数、除法、乘法、加法、减法——数学运算的顺序。
IPMAT：间期、前期、中期、后期、末期——细胞分裂的阶段。
严重症状：睡眠障碍、兴趣（减退）、内疚、精力损失、注意力不集中、食欲异常、精神运动迟缓或激动、自杀意念——重度抑郁症的症状。
简单（有意义）
铜管乐器：呼吸、放松、瞄准、瞄准、扣动扳机——射击步枪的过程。
D-CUP：描述、控制、理解、预测——科学的目标。请注意，这些目标的顺序并不固定。
家园：休伦湖、安大略湖、密歇根湖、伊利湖和苏必利尔湖——五大湖。
装饰（带字母）
箭头：适航证、登记证、操作手册、重量与平衡信息——飞行期间必须携带的文件。
CATARAct：先天性、衰老、毒性、事故、辐射、异常代谢——白内障的原因。
GrAPHS：滑动关节、角关节、枢轴关节、铰链关节、缝合关节——人体关节的类型。

为了最大限度地发挥首字母缩略词助记符的有效性，可能需要在每个提示和目标之间建立某种互动意象。有了这种互动意象的加入，修饰后的首字母缩略词在功能上将类似于挂钩词法，即首字母缩略词可以作为一个框架，提供提示与提示之间以及提示与目标之间的关联。

it may be that some sort of interactive imagery between each cue and target is needed for maximal effectiveness of acronym mnemonics. With the addition of such interactive imagery, embellished acronyms would be functionally similar to the peg-word method whereby the acronym would serve as a framework that provides both cue-to-cue and cue-totarget associations.

□故事助记符

□ Story Mnemonics

围绕待记忆信息构建故事是另一种强调内在联想的记忆技巧。然而，故事记忆法比修饰性的首字母缩略词记忆法更有优势，因为前者使用实际的目标项目来构建故事，而后者使用代理来构建故事。因此，故事记忆法省去了必须记住哪个待记忆项目与故事的每个组成部分相关联的步骤。然而，并非所有列表都适合故事记忆法。例如，如果不使用首字母缩略词和媒介，故事记忆法对记住脑神经的帮助就很小。尽管如此，故事助记符对于按顺序学习相对常见的信息具有非常有效的潜力。

Constructing a story around to-be-remembered information is another mnemonic technique that emphasizes intraitem associations. However, the story mnemonic has an advantage over an embellished acronym mnemonic because in the former mnemonic the actual target items are used in the construction of a story whereas in the latter a proxy is used in the construction of a story. As such, the story mnemonic eliminates the step of having to remember which to-be-remembered item is associated with each component of the story. However, not all lists are amenable to the story mnemonic. For example, the story mnemonic would be of little help in remembering the cranial nerves without using an acronym and mediators. Nonetheless, the story mnemonic has potential to be very effective for learning relatively common information in serial order.

举一个使用故事助记符的例子，假设一个人必须记住一份待办事项清单，为一次漫长的离家旅行做准备。具体来说，我们的旅行者必须记住在出发前把她的狗带到狗舍、停止送报纸、从银行取现金、从干洗店取衣服以及支付账单。在这种情况下，有效地使用故事助记符首先需要为清单上的每一项任务确定一个提示。在使用故事助记符时，正确的提示选择非常重要，因为所选择的提示不仅要让人想起合适的待记住事项，还要以一种能够构建有意义的故事的方式组合起来。例如，让我们用狗来提示“把狗带到狗舍”，用报纸来提示“停止送报纸”，用银行来提示“从银行取现金”，用干洗来提示“从干洗店取衣服”，用账单来提示“支付账单”。为了记住这些任务，旅行者可以编写一个包含以下提示的短篇故事：“遛狗时，我买了一份报纸，读到一家银行被抢劫了。显然，劫匪需要钱来支付干洗费用。”这个故事以一种保持列表顺序的方式对所有提示进行了有意义的整合。此外，每个提示都与其各自的待记住任务紧密相关。因此，我们既实现了强大的提示到提示的关联，也实现了强大的提示到目标的关联。此外，这些提示在有意义的背景中得到了修饰，有助于形成视觉心理意象。因此，这个例子展示了故事助记符如何轻松地结合组织和阐述来引发独特的处理，从而有效地促进记忆。

As an example of use of the story mnemonic, consider a situation in which a person must remember a to-do list in preparation for a lengthy trip away from home. Specifically, our traveler must remember to take her dog to the kennel, stop newspaper delivery to her home, withdraw cash from the bank, pick up dresses from the dry cleaner, and pay bills prior to departure. An effective use of the story mnemonic in this situation would first involve identification of a cue for each task on the list. Proper cue selection is important when using the story mnemonic because the cues chosen must not only bring to mind the appropriate to-be-remembered items but also combine in a way that allows for meaningful story construction. For our example, let us use dog to cue “take the dog to kennel,” newspaper to cue “stop newspaper delivery,” bank to cue “withdraw cash from the bank,” dry cleaning to cue “pick up dresses from the dry cleaner,” and bills to cue “pay bills.” To remember these tasks, the traveler can construct a short story including these cues: “While walking the dog, I bought a newspaper and read that a bank had been robbed.
