Apparently, the robbers needed the money to pay their dry cleaning bills.” This story provides a meaningful consolidation of all cues in such a way that maintains the serial order of the list. In addition, each cue is strongly associated with its respective to-be-remembered task. Thus, we have achieved both strong cue-to-cue and strong cue-to target associations. Moreover, these cues are embellished within a meaningful context that lends itself to visual mental imagery. As such, this example demonstrates how the story mnemonic can easily incorporate organization and elaboration to induce distinctive processing, which should effectively facilitate remembering.

实证研究支持这样一种观点，即用需要记住的物品构建一个故事是一种非常有效的助记方法。故事助记法已被证明能有效地促进大学年龄段（例如，Herrmann，1987；Herrmann、Geisler 和 Atkinson，1973）和年龄更大（例如，Drevenstedt 和 Bellezza，1993；Hill、Allen 和 McWhorter，1991）的成年人的记忆。此外，故事助记法已被证明能有效地提高记忆受损（Wilson，1995）和轻度智障（Glidden，1983）参与者的记忆力。还值得注意的是，故事助记法对于长列表（Bellezza、Six 和 Phillips，1992）和长保留间隔（Drevenstedt 和 Bellezza，1993）都有效。此外，在比较自创故事和他人创作的故事时，故事记忆法的有效性并无差异 (Buonassissi, Blick, & Kibler, 1972)。然而，正如我们之前提到的，当需要记忆的信息特别抽象时，故事记忆法的有效性可能会降低 (Manning & Bruning, 1975)。

Empirical research supports the notion that constructing a story out of to-be-remembered items can be a highly effective mnemonic. The story mnemonic has been demonstrated to be effective in facilitating memory in both college-age (e.g., Herrmann, 1987; Herrmann, Geisler, & Atkinson, 1973) and older (e.g., Drevenstedt & Bellezza, 1993; Hill, Allen, & McWhorter, 1991) adults. In addition, the story mnemonic has been shown to be effective in improving memory in memory-impaired (Wilson, 1995) and mildly retarded (Glidden, 1983) participants. It should also be noted that story mnemonics can be effective both with long lists (Bellezza, Six, & Phillips, 1992) and over long retention intervals (Drevenstedt & Bellezza, 1993). Moreover, the effectiveness of the story mnemonic does not differ when self-generated and other-generated stories are compared (Buonassissi, Blick, & Kibler, 1972). However, as we alluded to earlier, the effectiveness of the story mnemonic may be reduced when the to-be-remembered information is particularly abstract (Manning & Bruning, 1975).

□韵律与节奏的记忆法

□ Mnemonics of Rhyme and Rhythm

简单韵律。构建简单韵律来增强记忆是一种常见但研究较少的助记技巧。使用这种助记符的原理是，韵律结构允许基于音素相似性来组织待记忆信息。然而，由于待记忆信息并不总是具有押韵关系，因此助记韵律通常用于提供嵌入目标信息的语境。例如，考虑一个古老的助记符，旨在帮助人们记住如何区分北美珊瑚蛇和猩红王蛇。北美珊瑚蛇是一种剧毒蛇，可以通过红、黄、黑三色条纹来识别。无害且通常有益的王蛇也有红、黄、黑三色条纹，但这些条纹的排列顺序与珊瑚蛇不同。具体来说，北美珊瑚蛇总是有黄色条纹将黑、红条纹分开。另一方面，猩红王蛇身上的黄色条纹总是出现在黑色条纹之间。因此，可以用以下助记符来帮助区分这两种蛇：“红配黄，杀人；红配黑，结交杰克。”

Simple Rhymes. The construction of simple rhymes to enhance recall is a common, though infrequently researched, mnemonic technique. The rationale behind the use of such a mnemonic is that a rhyme scheme allows to-be-remembered information to be organized based on phonemic similarities. However, because to-be-remembered items do not always share rhyming relationships, mnemonic rhymes are often used to provide a context in which target items are embedded. For example, consider an age-old mnemonic designed to help people remember how to distinguish the North American coral snake from the scarlet king snake. The North American coral snake is a highly venomous snake that can be identified by red-, yellow-, and black-colored banding. The harmless and often beneficial king snake also has red, yellow, and black bands, but the bands appear in a different order than those of the coral snake. Specifically, the North American coral snake always has yellow bands that separate the black and red bands. On the other hand, the yellow bands on the scarlet king snake always occur between black bands. As such, the following mnemonic can be used to help distinguish the snakes: “Red on yellow, kill a fellow; red on black, friend of Jack.”

一个类似但更具民俗色彩的押韵助记符已被用来帮助水手们进行天气预报：“夜晚的红色天空，水手的喜悦。早晨的红色天空，水手的警告。” 这个助记符的基础是天气系统通常从西向东移动，而红色天空部分是由于携带水分的云被照亮而产生的。如果在傍晚看到红云，那么晴朗的西边天空正让太阳照亮向东移动的携带水分的云。但是，如果在早晨看到红云，那么晴朗的东边天空正让太阳照亮从西边到来的携带水分的云。因此，夜晚的红色天空意味着天气系统正在离去，而早晨的红色天空则意味着天气系统即将到来。

A similar, but more folkloric, rhyme mnemonic has been used to help sailors make weather predictions: “Red sky at night, sailor’s delight. Red sky in morning, sailor’s warning.” The bases for this mnemonic are that weather systems usually move from west to east and that red skies result in part from the illumination of moisture-bearing clouds. If red clouds are seen in the evening, then the clear western sky is allowing the sun to illuminate moisture-bearing clouds moving out of the area toward the east. However, if red clouds are seen in the morning, then the clear eastern sky is allowing the sun to illuminate moisture-bearing clouds that will be arriving from the west. Thus, a red sky at night means weather systems are departing, and red skies in the morning means that a system will be arriving.

这类简单的押韵助记符旨在帮助人们避免在记忆错误可能造成严重后果的情况下产生混淆。我们可以很容易地想象这样一种情况：一个人记得珊瑚蛇和王蛇的外观因红色、黄色和黑色条纹而异，但却记不住哪种条纹与哪种蛇有关。同样，一个人可能会记得早晨的红色天空预示着某种天气，但却记不住红色天空预示着什么。将重要信息嵌入押韵的语境中，可以提供一种组织方式，极大地限制正确检索的可能性。因此，这种押韵助记符应该可以显著减少记忆错误。此外，由于押韵助记符通常需要精心设计才能将目标信息与音素相关的信息联系起来，可以诱导差异化加工。另一方面，押韵助记符鼓励选择性编码，这种编码方式会最大限度地减少语义，而更注重音素特征。正如第三章所述，这种编码方式的效率不如鼓励语义细化的编码方式。

Simple rhyme mnemonics such as these are designed to help one avoid confusion in situations where incorrect memories could have damaging consequences. One can easily imagine a situation in which a person remembers that the appearance of coral snakes and king snakes differs based on red, yellow, and black banding yet fails to remember which banding is associated with which snake. Similarly, one might recall that a red sky in the morning signifies something about the weather while being unable to remember what the red sky portends. Embedding important information in the context of a rhyme provides an organization that greatly constrains the number of correct retrieval possibilities. As such, this type of rhyme mnemonic should significantly reduce memory errors. Moreover, because rhyme mnemonics typically require elaboration to associate the target information to phonemically related information, distinctive processing can be induced. On the other hand, rhyme mnemonics encourage selective encoding that minimizes semantics in favor of phonemic features. As mentioned in Chapter 3, this type of encoding would be less effective than encoding that encourages semantic elaboration.

虽然很少有研究直接检验简单押韵记忆法的有效性，但现有研究以及检验押韵与记忆之间关系的研究普遍表明，押韵记忆法的有效性可能有限。Hayes、Chemelski 和 Palmer (1982) 发现押韵能增强成年人的记忆，但对幼儿无作用。在一项仅针对幼儿的后续研究中，Johnson 和 Hayes (1987) 证明，押韵能增强故事的逐字背诵，但无助于回忆故事梗概。押韵无法增强幼儿对故事梗概的记忆，大概是由于对音位线索的选择性编码导致了知觉集中。另一方面，成年人押韵带来的回忆优势被认为是由于押韵对检索可能性的限制 (例如 Bower & Bolton，1969；Wallace & Rubin，1991)。其他针对成年人的研究（例如，Rubin & Wallace, 1989；Solso & Biersdorff, 1975）表明，押韵线索与语义线索结合呈现时效果最佳。对于智障成年人也是如此（Javawardhana, 1997）。

Although very little research has directly examined the effectiveness of simple rhyme mnemonics, the existing research and that research that examines the relationship between rhyme and memory more generally suggest that rhyme mnemonics may be of limited effectiveness. Hayes, Chemelski, and Palmer (1982) found that rhymes enhanced memory for adults but not for young children. In a follow-up study testing young children only, Johnson and Hayes (1987) demonstrated that rhymes enhance verbatim recitation of stories but failed to facilitate recall of gist. The failure of rhymes to enhance memory for gist in young children is presumably due to perceptual centration that results from the selective encoding of phonemic cues. On the other hand, the recall advantage associated with rhymes found with adults is believed to be due to the restrictions rhymes impose on retrieval possibilities (e.g., Bower & Bolton, 1969; Wallace & Rubin, 1991). Other research testing adults (e.g., Rubin & Wallace, 1989; Solso & Biersdorff, 1975) indicates that rhyme cues are most effective when presented in combination with semantic cues. The same is true for mentally challenged adults (Javawardhana, 1997).

韵律与语义的结合符合有效记忆法既包含组织性又包含阐释性的规定。韵律提供共享信息来组织离散元素，而语义信息则区分各个元素。Rubin 和 Wallace (1989; Wallace & Rubin, 1991) 将组合维度的有效性解释为提示约束。实际上，这意味着一个组合之所以独特，是因为很少有替代方案能够满足该组合。例如，一旦学会，童谣《杰克和吉尔》就很容易记住，因为韵律-语义约束严重限制了关键词的选择。杰克和吉尔要爬的是一座小山，而这些约束使得他们既不会想到楼梯，也不会想到山。

The combination of rhyme and meaning conforms to the prescription that effective mnemonics include both organization and elaboration. The rhyme provides the shared information to organize discrete elements, whereas the semantic information distinguishes among the various elements. Rubin and Wallace (1989; Wallace & Rubin, 1991) explained the effectiveness of the combined dimensions as cue constraint. In effect, the suggestion is that a combination is distinctive because few alternatives will satisfy that combination. For example, once learned, the nursery rhyme Jack and Jill is easily remembered because the rhyme-meaning constraint severely limits the critical word choices. It is a hill that Jack and Jill go up, and the constraints are such that neither stairs nor mountain will come to mind.

韵律和节奏。韵律和节奏经常组合使用来形成记忆术。鲁宾（1995）在其著作《口头传统中的记忆：史诗、民谣和数数韵律的认知心理学》中深入探讨了韵律和节奏对记忆的作用。鲁宾认为，韵律和节奏有效性背后的机制与韵律和意义的机制相同。也就是说，当尝试回忆在押韵和/或节奏环境中学到的信息时，任何不符合押韵格式或没有保持适当节奏的回忆信息都很容易被判定为不正确。因此，韵律和节奏通过限制潜在检索集。鲁宾所描述的韵律和节奏的功能与独特性处理的功能并无二致。具体而言，独特性处理源于有组织的情境，并辅以独​​特的线索。组织性决定了适当的情景情境，而特定于项目的线索则将检索的可能性限制在那些既拥有独特线索又符合特定情境的项目上（Hunt & Smith，1996）。尽管鲁宾主要从检索的角度讨论了韵律和节奏带来的限制，但必须牢记，检索高度依赖于编码。因此，编码过程和检索过程之间的严格区分通常是站不住脚的（参见 Tulving，1983）。

Rhyme and Rhythm. Rhyme and rhythm are often used in combination to form mnemonics. In his book Memory in Oral Traditions: The Cognitive Psychology of Epic, Ballads, and Counting-Out Rhymes, Rubin (1995) provided in-depth coverage of the functions of rhyme and rhythms on memory. Rubin suggested the mechanism underlying the effectiveness of rhyme and rhythm is the same as that for rhyme and meaning. That is, when attempting to recall information that was learned in a rhyming and/or rhythmic context, any recalled information that does not fit with the rhyme scheme or does not maintain proper rhythm can be easily determined to be incorrect. Thus, rhyme and rhythm facilitate memory by limiting the potential retrieval set. The functions of rhyme and rhythm described by Rubin are not unlike the function of distinctive processing. Specifically, distinctive processing results from an organized context complemented by unique cues. Organization specifies the appropriate episodic context, and item-specific cues limit retrieval possibilities to items that both share the unique cue and match the specified context (Hunt & Smith, 1996). Although Rubin discussed the constraints imposed by rhyme and rhythm mainly in terms of retrieval, it must be kept in mind that retrieval is highly dependent on encoding. As such, a strong distinction between encoding and retrieval processes is generally untenable (cf. Tulving, 1983).

当韵律和节奏与旋律相结合时，待记忆的信息就变成了歌词。在某些情况下，在歌曲中呈现的信息比在简单的语音中呈现的信息更容易被记住。例如，华莱士（1994）发现，只要旋律重复，在简单旋律中呈现的文本比单独的文本更容易被记住。根据华莱士的说法，重复对于歌曲的记忆益处至关重要，因为它使旋律更容易学习，最终增强了对旋律的熟悉度。还值得注意的是，华莱士的研究结果还表明，歌曲的益处超过了单独的韵律。

When rhyme and rhythm are combined with melody, to-be-remembered information becomes lyrics to a song. Under some conditions information presented in the context of a song is remembered better than when in the context of simple speech. For example, Wallace (1994) found that text presented in the context of a simple melody is remembered better than text alone as long as the melody is repeated. According to Wallace, repetition is important to the mnemonic benefits of song because it makes the melody easier to learn, which ultimately enhances its familiarity. It should also be noted that Wallace’s results also indicated that the observed benefits of song exceeded the benefits of rhyme alone.

近期研究（Kilgour、Jakobson 和 Cuddy，2000）表明，先前研究中发现的将待记忆信息嵌入歌曲中所带来的记忆优势，可能是由于歌曲的呈现速度比语音慢。事实上，当这些作者将歌曲和语音中信息的呈现速度等同起来时，歌曲的优势就消失了。无论这一发现如何，显而易见的是，大量信息嵌入歌曲中能够被准确地回忆起来（参见 Wallace 和 Rubin，1988）。

More recent research (Kilgour, Jakobson, & Cuddy, 2000) suggests that the mnemonic benefits of embedding to-be-remembered information in song found in previous research may be due to slower presentation rates associated with songs than speech. Indeed, when these authors equated the presentation rates of information presented in songs and speech, the advantage of song was eliminated. Regardless of this finding, it is clear that large amounts of information can be recalled accurately when embedded in song (see Wallace & Rubin, 1988).

□分类和图式组织

□ Categorical and Schematic Organization

组织待记忆信息的一种简单方法是将信息按分类层次结构排列。这种助记方法利用列表项之间的分类关系，将待记忆列表组织成可归入抽象类别标签的子集。回顾我们之前关于一位正在准备旅行的人的例子，假设她还必须记住打包以下物品：吹风机、牙线、护手霜、MP3播放器、杂志、益智书、名片、笔记本电脑和U盘。为了记住这些物品，这位旅行者可以将这九件物品分成三个临时类别：洗漱用品、娱乐用品和工作相关物品。在出发旅行之前，旅行者可能会尝试回忆这些物品，并确认它们已打包好。使用分类助记符，旅行者只需回忆起三个类别标签，这三个标签应该会提示出每个标签下包含的具体物品。请注意，这种方法通过减少必须在没有提示的情况下检索的物品总数来减轻认知负荷。分类助记符在这种情况下也很有优势，因为回忆起类别标签可能会提示出旅行中可能需要但未出现在原始清单上的其他物品。因此，当应用于这种情况时，回忆干扰（在分类助记符中很常见）实际上是有帮助的。

A simple way to organize to-be-remembered information is to arrange the information in a taxonomic hierarchy. This type of mnemonic capitalizes on categorical relationships among list items by organizing the to-be-remembered list into subsets that can be subsumed under abstract category labels. Revisiting our earlier example of a person who is preparing for travel, let us say she must also remember to pack the following items: hair dryer, dental floss, hand lotion, MP3 player, magazine, puzzle book, business cards, laptop computer, and jump drive. To remember these items, our traveler could organize the nine items into three ad hoc categories: toiletries, entertainment items, and work-related items. Prior to departing for her trip, the traveler may attempt to recall the items and verify that they have been packed. Using the categorical mnemonic, the traveler simply needs to recall the three category labels, which should cue the specific items that are subsumed under each label. Note that this method reduces cognitive load by decreasing the overall number of items that must be retrieved without cues. The categorical mnemonic is also advantageous in this situation because recall of the category label may cue additional items that may be needed for the trip but did not appear on the original list. Thus, when applied to this situation, recall intrusions— which are common with a categorical mnemonic—are actually helpful.

作为分类助记符的替代，旅行者可以使用图解式组织来帮助她记住必须打包的物品。例如，她可以在脑海中参观公寓的每个房间，并收集每个房间中的必需品。例如，吹风机、牙线和护手霜可以通过浴室的心理图像提示；MP3 播放器、杂志和益智书可以通过客厅提示；名片、笔记本电脑和闪存盘可以通过办公室角落提示。请注意，图解式助记符与分类助记符的不同之处在于，前者基于空间关系提示待记住的项目，而后者基于语义概念关系提示项目。但是，与分类助记符一样，语义组织允许回忆额外的、但以前未考虑过的项目。这种方法和分类记忆法相关的回忆干扰，可以解释为缺乏针对特定物品的加工处理，而这种加工处理对于区分目标物品和符合该图式或类别的其他物品至关重要。图式记忆法的一个潜在局限性是，在进行心理清点时，通常隐藏在视线之外的物品（例如，存放在橱柜或抽屉里的牙线）可能会被忽略 (Keenan, 1983; Kerr & Neisser, 1983)。

As an alternative to a categorical mnemonic, the traveler could use schematic organization to help her remember items that she must pack. For example, she could mentally visit each room in her apartment and gather the necessary items found in each room. For example, the hair dryer, dental floss, and hand lotion may be cued by the mental image of the bathroom; the MP3 player, magazine, and puzzle book may be cued by the living room; and the business cards, laptop, and jump drive may be cued by the office nook. Note that the schematic mnemonic differs from the categorical mnemonic in that the former cues to-be-remembered items based on spatial relationships, whereas the latter cues items based on semantic–conceptual relationships. However, like the categorical mnemonic, semantic organization allows for additional, but previously unconsidered, items to be recalled. The recall intrusions associated with this method and the categorical mnemonic can be explained by a lack of item-specific processing that would be necessary to discriminate target items from other items that fit within the schema or category. A potential limitation of the schematic mnemonic is that items that are typically concealed from view (e.g., dental floss that is stored in a cabinet or a drawer) may be overlooked during the mental inventory (Keenan, 1983; Kerr & Neisser, 1983).

实证研究（Khan & Paivio，1988；Nakamura、Kleiber & Kim，1992）表明，分类组织和图式组织能够产生相当的回忆水平，并且在控制条件下，每种方法的回忆水平都高于对照组。然而，儿童可能无法获得成人所获得的分类和图式组织带来的记忆益处。研究支持这一观点，该研究表明，按类别组织的列表比随机构建的列表在成人中（Bower、Clark、Lesgold & Winzenz，1969）能产生更好的回忆效果，但在幼儿中（Yoshimura、Moely & Shapiro，1971）则并非如此。此外，研究（Liberty & Ornstein，1973）表明，幼儿不会自发地组织待记忆的信息。这些发现与以下观点相符：幼儿的抽象思维能力有限，这阻碍了他们形成有意义的类别和图式（Piaget，1928）。

Empirical research (Khan & Paivio, 1988; Nakamura, Kleiber, & Kim, 1992) suggests that categorical organization and schematic organization lead to equivalent levels of recall and that each exceeds the level of recall in control conditions. However, it may be the case that children do not obtain the mnemonic benefits of categorical and schematic organization realized by adults. This notion is supported by research that suggests that lists organized by categories lead to better recall than randomly constructed lists in adults (Bower, Clark, Lesgold, & Winzenz, 1969) but not in young children (Yoshimura, Moely, & Shapiro, 1971). Moreover, research (Liberty & Ornstein, 1973) suggests that young children do not spontaneously organize to-be-remembered information. These findings are consistent with the notion that young children have a limited capacity for abstract thinking, which prevents them from forming meaningful categories and schemas (Piaget, 1928).

□先行组织者

□ Advance Organizers

预先组织符是一种典型的由他人生成的助记符，其组织方式强烈体现了分类和/或图解式的组织结构。与某些助记符不同，预先组织符专为帮助记忆长篇散文和技术论述而设计。因此，预先组织符非常适合教育应用。

An advance organizer is a typically other-generated mnemonic that strongly reflects a categorical and/or schematic organization. Unlike some mnemonics, advance organizers are specifically designed to facilitate memory for lengthy prose and technical discourse. For this reason, advance organizers are perfectly suited for educational applications.

先行组织者最初由奥苏贝尔（Ausubel，1960）提出，是指在相关阅读材料之前提供的概念，旨在促进学习。奥苏贝尔的先行组织者是指后续信息可以被纳入的概念。根据这种提法，预先提供的信息可以激活知识，从而增强现有知识与新信息之间的联系。奥苏贝尔描述了两种可用的先行组织者：比较型和说明型。当学习者具备与待学习材料相关的背景知识时，可以使用比较型组织者。这种类型的组织者用于帮助记忆那些虽然本质上不同，但与先前学过的概念有相似之处的概念。因此，比较型先行组织者的主要功能是帮助学习者区分两个相似的概念。例如，人类学教师可能会在学生布置详述美洲原住民传统丧葬习俗的阅读作业之前，提供一篇描述现代美洲和美洲原住民丧葬仪式之间关系的短文。这里假设学生熟悉现代美国的丧葬习俗，但不熟悉美洲原住民的丧葬习俗。因此，预先组织者可以激活学生先前关于丧葬习俗的知识，为与新信息进行比较和对比奠定基础。

Originally promoted by Ausubel (1960), advance organizers are concepts provided prior to relevant reading material in order to facilitate learning. Ausubel’s advance organizers were concepts under which subsequent information could be subsumed. According to this formulation, the information provided in advance serves to activate knowledge in a way that enhances links between that knowledge and new information. Ausubel described two types of advance organizers that can be used: comparative and expository. Comparative organizers are used when the learner has some background knowledge relevant to the to-be-learned material. This type of organizer is used to aid memory for concepts that, although fundamentally different, share similarities with previously learned concepts. Thus, the main function of a comparative advance organizer is to allow the learner to discriminate between two similar concepts. For example, an anthropology instructor might provide students with a short passage describing the relationship between modern American and Native American burial rites prior to a reading assignment that details traditional burial practices of Native Americans. It is assumed here that the students would be familiar with modern American burial practices but not the Native American practices. As such, the advance organizer would serve to activate previous knowledge about burial practices in a way that establishes a basis for comparison and contrast with the new information.

说明性先行组织者适用于学习者对所学主题几乎没有或完全没有背景知识的情况。因此，说明性先行组织者的目的是创建一个认知网络，以便随后对新信息进行分类。例如，教授入门射箭课程的运动机能学教师可能会在学生阅读有关射击准确性细节的内容之前，先讲解正确射击形式的四个主要组成部分（站姿、拉弓、瞄准和释放）。这种先行组织者会为学习者提供一个基本的认知框架，以便将详细信息归入四个主要类别标签下。本质上，组织者在介绍技术细节之前，先展示与射箭准确性相关的“大局”。值得注意的是，现代说明性先行组织者通常只是为了提供一个吸收新信息的最小框架（参见 Langan-Fox、Platania-Phung 和 Waycott，2006 年；Mayer, 2003)。因此，许多现代的先行组织者采用流程图、概念图或概念模型的形式。

Expository advance organizers are appropriate for situations in which the learner has little or no background relevant to the to-be-learned topic. Thus, the purpose of an expository advance organizer is to create a cognitive network that will allow for the subsequent categorization of the new information. For instance, a kinesiology instructor teaching an introductory archery course might present students with the four main components of proper shooting form (stance, draw, aim, and release) prior to an assigned reading on the details of shot accuracy. This advance organizer would provide the learner with a basic cognitive framework that would allow for the subsumption of detailed information under four main category labels. In essence, the organizer presents the “big picture” associated with bow-shooting accuracy prior to presenting the technical details. It should be noted that modern expository advance organizers are often designed simply to provide a minimum framework for the assimilation of new information (see Langan-Fox, Platania-Phung, & Waycott, 2006; Mayer, 2003). As such, many modern advance organizers take the form of flowcharts, concept maps, or conceptual models.

关于预先组织者对学习和记忆的有效性，已经进行了大量研究。尽管研究结论存在一些差异（参见Corkill，1992），但普遍共识是，在满足特定条件的情况下，使用预先组织者有助于学习语言材料。当然，预先组织者必须写得清晰，并与待学习的主题领域相关（Glover、Krug、Dietzer & George，1990）。此外，具体表述概念的组织者比抽象表述概念的组织者更有效（Corkill、Bruning & Glover，1988）。实施组织者的学习环境必须没有干扰，因为预先组织者无法弥补学习条件的不足（Stallings & Derry，1986）。研究（Glover 等人，1990）还表明，尽管三种预先组织条件的记忆力超过了对照条件，但在目标材料前一小时引入的组织者比在记忆测试之前立即引入或 48 小时引入的组织者更有效。较长的保留间隔也会增强预先组织者的有效性（Allen，1970；Wong，1974）。此外，Corkill、Glover、Bruning 和 Krug（1988）发现，在延迟测试之前重读组织者可以增强预先组织者的记忆益处。Thompson（1998）的研究表明，针对个体差异，预先组织者可以增强各个年龄段的语言能力低下学习者的记忆力。然而，值得注意的是，这项研究发现，对于正常的老年人来说，预先组织者有益于再认记忆，但无益于回忆。最后，关于先行组织者，应该注意的是，根据独特性理论，当与鼓励详细说明的程序结合使用时，它们的有效性会显著提高（Van Dam、Brinkerink-Carlier 和 Kok，1985）。

A good deal of research has been conducted on the effectiveness of advance organizers on learning and memory. Although there is some variability in the conclusions of that research (see Corkill, 1992), the consensus is that the use of advance organizers can be beneficial for learning verbal material given that certain conditions are met. Of course, advance organizers must be well written and relevant to the to-be-learned topic area (Glover, Krug, Dietzer, & George, 1990). Moreover, organizers that represent concepts concretely will be more effective than those that represent concepts abstractly (Corkill, Bruning, & Glover, 1988). The learning environment in which organizers will be implemented must be free from distractions, as advance organizers do not compensate for impoverished learning conditions (Stallings & Derry, 1986). Research (Glover et al., 1990) has also demonstrated that although memory in three advance organizer conditions exceeded that of a control condition, organizers introduced an hour prior to target material were more effective than those introduced immediately prior or 48 hours prior to the memory test. The effectiveness of advance organizers is also enhanced by long retention intervals (Allen, 1970; Wong, 1974). In addition, Corkill, Glover, Bruning, and Krug (1988) found that the mnemonic benefits of advance organizers were enhanced by rereading the organizers prior to delayed testing. Addressing individual differences, research by Thompson (1998) suggests that advance organizers enhance memory for learners with low verbal abilities across a wide range of adult ages. However, it should be noted that this study found that advance organizers benefited recognition memory but not recall in normal older adults. Finally, regarding advance organizers, it should be noted that in keeping with distinctiveness theory, their effectiveness is significantly increased when used in combination with procedures that encourage elaboration (Van Dam, Brinkerink-Carlier, & Kok, 1985).

□摘要

□ Summary

本章描述的所有记忆技巧只要考虑到其局限性并应用于适当的情境，就能发挥其作用。首字母缩略词的效果并不特别显著，除非它们能够通过心理意象和/或语义阐释进行修饰。故事记忆法涉及大量的阐释，因此是一种非常有效的组织记忆法。遗憾的是，并非所有待学习的信息都适合构建有意义的故事。与首字母缩略词一样，押韵记忆法与其他形式的阐释相结合时效果最佳。当简单的韵律与节奏和旋律相结合，就能形成有效的记忆法。分类和图解式记忆法很容易受到回忆入侵的影响，但当这类记忆法应用于回忆入侵可能有用的情境时，这个问题就能被转化为优势。在某些情况下，先行组织者会诱导加工，从而形成有效的分类和图解式组织。

All of the mnemonic techniques described in this chapter can be effective as long as their limitations are considered and they are applied to an appropriate situation. Acronyms are not particularly effective unless they are amenable to mental imagery and/or embellished with semantic elaboration. Story mnemonics involve a good deal of elaboration, and as a result, they are a very effective type of organizational mnemonic. Unfortunately, not all to-be-learned information lends itself to meaningful story construction. Like acronyms, rhyme mnemonics are most effective when combined with other forms of elaboration. When simple rhymes are combined with rhythm and melody, the result is an effective mnemonic. Categorical and schematic mnemonics are highly susceptible to recall intrusions, but this problem can be used to one’s advantage when such mnemonics are applied to situations in which intrusions can be helpful. Under certain conditions, advance organizers induce processing that leads to effective categorical and schematic organization.

总体而言，组织性记忆法的有效性显然取决于其精细化的程度。当组织性记忆法与精细化记忆法相结合时，记忆法通常是有效的。如果没有精细化记忆法，独特性处理就会被最小化，而组织性记忆法的有效性将取决于学习情境是否需要目标项的可辨别性。在可以接受记忆要点且回忆干扰不成问题的情况下，主要依赖于组织的记忆法可能会有所帮助。然而，当待记忆信息的可辨别性至关重要时，主要依赖于组织的记忆法可能效果有限。

Overall, it is clear that the effectiveness of an organizational mnemonic depends on the degree elaboration involved. When organizational procedures are combined with elaboration, the mnemonic is generally effective. Without elaboration, distinctive processing is minimized, and the effectiveness of an organizational mnemonic will depend on whether the learning situation requires target-item discriminability. In situations where memory for gist is acceptable and recall intrusions are not problematic, mnemonics that rely predominantly on organization may be helpful. However, when the discriminability of to-be-remembered information is crucial, mnemonics that are predominantly organizational may be of limited effectiveness.

6

摄氏度哈一个磷T埃R		 

专家和专业记忆术士

Experts and Professional Mnemonists

与大多数其他能力一样，记忆力处于一个近似正态分布的连续体中。一小部分人会遭受明显的记忆缺陷，大多数人的记忆力都处于我们认为正常的范围内，而另一小部分人则会展现出特别强的记忆力。本章将重点关注记忆力连续体的后者。具体来说，我们将讨论四个人的记忆力，他们的记忆力超越了常态，堪称真正卓越的人。本章讨论的这些人并非所有表现出卓越记忆力的人。然而，这些样本确实反映了拥有卓越记忆力的人在背景、方法和能力方面的差异。

Like most other abilities, memory skill lies on a continuum that approximates a normal distribution. A small proportion of the population will suffer from marked memory deficits, most people’s memory will fall within a range that we consider normal, and another small proportion will exhibit particularly strong memory skills. The present chapter focuses on this latter end of the continuum of memory ability. Specifically, we will discuss four individuals whose feats of memory represent deviation from the norm that can be considered truly exceptional. The individuals discussed in this chapter by no means exhaust the list of those who have exhibited exceptional memory ability. However, the sample does reflect the variability in backgrounds, methods, and abilities that exists among those who have superior general memory.

□ S.

□ S.

虽然对具有卓越记忆力的个体的实证研究可以追溯到19世纪（Brown & Deffenbacher，1975；Wilding & Valentine，1997），但Luria（1968）对S.的研究首次引起了广泛关注。S.是一个奇特的案例，部分原因是他直到20多岁后期才意识到自己的特殊能力，当时一位雇主建议心理学研究人员研究他的记忆能力。此外，除了他不同寻常的认知能力外，S.在大多数情况下，其功能表现平平或略低于平均水平。他的家庭生活也很典型——他已婚，有一个后来事业有成的儿子，但他却一直在换工作，从未建立起稳定的职业（除了成为一名记忆专家）。在这方面，Luria形容S.“没有锚”。他一生都期待着未来某个事件能够改变他的人生轨迹。

Although empirical examination of individuals with exceptional memory skills dates back to the 19th century (Brown & Deffenbacher, 1975; Wilding & Valentine, 1997), Luria’s (1968) study of S. was the first to garner widespread attention. S. was a curious case partly because he had no awareness of his special abilities until his late 20s when an employer suggested that psychological researchers should study his memory ability. Furthermore, other than his unusual cognitive abilities, S. was, for the most part, functionally average or slightly below average. His family life was typical—he was married and had a son who was later successful, yet he drifted from job to job without ever establishing a stable career (except for that as a mnemonist). In this regard, Luria described S. as “anchorless” in that he lived his life always in anticipation of a future event that would alter the course of his existence.

S. 在记忆随机数字和字母阵列这项通常很困难的任务上表现出了非凡的能力。例如，Luria (1968) 表示，S. 经过不到 3 分钟的学习时间，就能准确地回忆起一个由 50 个数字组成的阵列，这些数字的顺序可以是倒序、行序、列序，甚至是指定的对角线序。另一个特别引人注目的例子来自 S. 认为最困难的记忆任务。在作为记忆术士表演期间，S. 会要求观众提供一份需要记住的信息清单，他将用这些信息来证明自己的能力。有一次，在一家疗养院表演时，S. 看到了一长串交替出现的无意义音节，如表 6.1 所示。Luria报告说，S. 不仅在表演时准确地回忆起了清单，而且还在 4 年后凭记忆重现了整个清单。

S. demonstrated exceptional ability for the typically difficult task of remembering arrays of random numbers and letters. As an example, Luria (1968) stated that S., after less than 3 minutes study time, could accurately recall an array of 50 numbers in the order they were presented, backward, by rows, by columns, or even by specified diagonals. Another particularly striking example comes from what S. believed was his most difficult memory task. During performances as a mnemonist, S. would ask the audience to provide a list of to-be-remembered information that he would use to demonstrate his ability. On one particular occasion while performing at a sanitarium, S. was presented with a long series of alternating nonsense syllables such as that found in Table 6.1. Luria reported that not only did S. accurately recall the list at the performance but he also managed to reproduce, from memory, the entire list 4 years later.

除了对数字、字母和无意义音节的记忆能力外，S. 还展现出非凡的词汇记忆力。然而，他对文字材料的记忆并不一定延伸到有意义的散文。事实上，Luria (1968) 指出，S. 理解文本内容尤为困难。他也难以记住面孔。这些困难至少部分源于一种极端的联觉，S. 有时发现这种联觉会使其衰弱。例如，S. 报告说，简单的声音会引发生动的心理意象、色彩和味觉。数字和视觉形式也具有类似的多模态效应。因此，即使是简单的信息也会刺激他所有的感官，这使得他很难提取意义。意义仿佛只是嵌入在与任何事物相关的广阔感知体验中的一个细节。给定刺激。此外，卢里亚指出，S. 很难理解那些含义与其联觉特性不符的词语。如果一个词的发音与其所暗示的不符，S. 就会感到困惑。显然，S. 的认知功能不正常，而这种偏离正常的情况并不总是具有适应性。

In addition to his ability with numbers, letters, and nonsense syllables, S. also demonstrated exceptional memory for words. However, his memory for verbal material did not necessarily extend to meaningful prose. In fact, Luria (1968) suggested that S. had a particularly difficult time understanding the content of text. He also had difficulty remembering faces. These difficulties were at least partly due to an extreme form of synesthesia that S. sometimes found to be debilitating. For instance, S. reported that simple sounds induced vivid mental imagery, color, and taste. Numbers and visual forms had similar multimodal effects. As a result, even simple information stimulated all of his senses, which made extracting meaning very difficult for him. It was as if meaning was just a detail embedded in the vast perceptual experience associated with any given stimulus. Moreover, Luria stated that S. had great difficulty with words whose meanings did not seem to match their synesthetic qualities. If a word did not match what the sound of the word suggested, S. became confused. Clearly, S.’s cognitive functioning was not normal, and this deviation from normality was not always adaptive.

表 6.1 1936 年演出中呈现给 S. 的部分无意义音节列表
妈妈，妈妈，妈妈，妈妈
那萨那玛瓦
萨那玛那瓦
凡是凡是
纳瓦纳瓦萨玛
娜玛萨玛瓦娜
萨玛萨瓦那
娜萨玛瓦玛娜
注：实际列表比表格中显示的要长。改编自 Luria，AR，1968 年出版的《记忆术士的心灵》（The Mind of a Mnemonist ），Basic Books，纽约。

关于超凡记忆力的讨论中，一个共同的议题是：这种能力是天生的还是后天习得的（参见 Chase & Ericsson, 1982; Ericsson, 1985; Wilding & Valentine, 1991）。支持后者的观点源于一项研究（Ericsson, Chase, & Falloon, 1980）。该研究旨在探究一名普通男性（SF）通过练习将其数字广度提升至 82 位。然而，Wilding 和 Valentine（1997）认为，即使 SF 在研究前的智商和记忆力正常，他也肯定拥有非凡的动力和动机。事实上，Wilding 和 Valentine 将 SF 在人生多个领域取得成功的渴望描述为“近乎痴迷”（第 35 页）。无论如何，我们认为关于先天能力与后天习得能力的争论并不特别重要。如前几章所讨论的，记忆术的有效性受到个体差异的影响，因此，即使是学习最有效的记忆术，也不是所有愿意学习的人都能获得真正卓越的记忆能力。当然，我们相信记忆术是有帮助的，可以显著提高记忆力。然而，某种记忆术的潜在有效性受到学习任务的性质以及学习者先天和后天特征的制约。因此，我们认为，重要的问题不在于超强记忆力是天生的还是后天习得的，而在于那些记忆力超群的人所采用的策略是否对普通学习者有帮助。考虑到这一点，我们现在将讨论 S 使用的记忆术。

Common to discussions of extraordinary memory ability is the issue of whether the ability is innate or the result of practice (see Chase & Ericsson, 1982; Ericsson, 1985; Wilding & Valentine, 1991). Arguments for the latter stem from research (Ericsson, Chase, & Falloon, 1980) in which a purportedly average man (SF) increased his digit span to 82 digits through practice. However, Wilding and Valentine (1997) argued that even if SF was normal in IQ and memory prior to the study, he most certainly had exceptional drive and motivation. In fact, Wilding and Valentine describe the SF’s desire to succeed in several areas of his life as “almost obsessional” (p. 35). Regardless, we believe that the debate over innate versus practiced ability is not particularly relevant. As discussed in earlier chapters, the effectiveness of mnemonics is moderated by individual differences, and thus truly exceptional memory ability is not within the grasp of all who are willing to learn even the most effective mnemonic techniques. Of course, we believe that mnemonics can be helpful and result in significant memory improvement. However, potential effectiveness of a given mnemonic technique is constrained by the nature of the learning task and both the innate and environmentally derived characteristics of the learner. Thus, in our view, the relevant issue is not whether superior memory is innate or learned but whether the strategies employed by those with exceptional memory ability can be helpful to the average learner. With this in mind, we will now discuss the mnemonic techniques used by S.

尽管卢里亚（Luria，1968）认为S的能力是天生的，但S显然运用了一些记忆技巧。视觉心像在S的记忆编码中是一个永无止境、甚至可能难以控制的组成部分。此外，由于他的联觉，多重编码和丰富的阐释也在他的编码过程中屡见不鲜。S还广泛运用了位置记忆法（method of loci）。当看到一长串单词时，S会想象自己走在莫斯科一条熟悉的街道上，然后将需要记忆的物品放在脑海中的不同位置。当他需要回忆这些信息时，他会再次想象自己走在街上，这次会把落下的东西收起来。正如卢里亚所指出的，这解释了为什么S能够轻松地逆序回忆信息。当被要求倒序回忆一份单词表时，他只需从街道的另一端开始，在脑海中走一圈即可。

Although Luria (1968) concluded that S.’s ability was innate, it is clear that S. used some mnemonic techniques. Visual mental imagery was an interminable and perhaps uncontrollable component of S.’s encoding. Also, because of his synesthesia, the use of multiple codes and abundant elaboration were also constants to his encoding process. S. also made extensive use of the method of loci. When presented with a long list of words, S. would imagine walking down a familiar street in Moscow and then place mental images of the to-be-remembered items in various places. When he needed to recall the information, he would again imagine walking down the street, this time gathering the items he left behind. As noted by Luria, this explains why S. had no trouble recalling information in reverse order. When asked to recall a list backward, he would simply begin his mental walk down the opposite end of the street.

有趣的是，S. 在使用位置记忆法时，有时也会遇到一些困难。例如，如果他在心里把要记住的物品放在光线昏暗或隐蔽的地方，他可能会很难记住它。这与研究人员（Iaccino &Byrne, 1989; Keenan & Moore, 1979) 等人认为隐藏的心理意象比未隐藏的意象记忆效果更差。在第四章​​中，我们讨论的研究普遍支持这一观点，即回忆隐藏图像的能力取决于形成图像的时间。为了支持这一观点，Luria 认为 S. 的表现在列表呈现速度不快时最佳。值得注意的是，S. 报告说他经常改变需要记住的小物品的图像大小，这样它们就不会在他想象的地方的详细景观中“丢失”。图像大小转换是用来创建奇异意象的几种操作之一 (Marshall, Nau, & Chandler, 1979)，正如我们之前讨论过的，它可以用来增强某些记忆术的有效性。

Interestingly, S. was not immune to the difficulties that sometimes arise when using the method of loci. For example, he might have trouble remembering a to-be-remembered item if he had mentally placed it in a poorly lit or concealed place. This is keeping with researchers (Iaccino & Byrne, 1989; Keenan & Moore, 1979) who have argued that concealed mental imagery leads to poorer recall than unconcealed imagery. In Chapter 4, we discussed research that generally supports the notion that the ability to recall concealed images depends on the time available to form images. In support of this, Luria suggested that S.’s performance was optimal when lists were not presented rapidly. It is also interesting to note that S. reported that he frequently transformed the image size of small to-beremembered items so that they did not get “lost” in the detailed landscape of his imagined place. Image-size transformation is one of several operations that have been used to create bizarre imagery (Marshall, Nau, & Chandler, 1979) that, as we discussed earlier, may be used to enhance the effectiveness of some mnemonics.

尽管S.难以处理隐藏意象，但他显然比普通人更有效地运用了位置记忆法。这引出了一个关于记忆术运用的有趣问题：S.使用位置记忆法的方式是否与大多数使用者不同？在大多数情况下，他并没有不同。那些对普通用户有效的关键因素，在S.运用该方法时也同样有效。S.与其他人的主要区别在于他拥有创造生动细致心理意象的非凡能力。此外，他的联觉很可能与位置记忆法相结合，从而产生了特别强烈而有效的独特处理方式。联觉无疑会产生一种独特有效的特定物品处理方式，而熟悉地点的详细心理意象的组织特性则能完美地补充这种处理方式。因此，S.的心理构成很可能比普通人更有利于有效地运用位置记忆法。

Notwithstanding his difficulties with concealed images, S. clearly made more effective use of the method of loci than would the average person. This raises an interesting question about the use of the mnemonic: Did S. use the method of loci differently than most users? For the most part, he did not. The same factors that underlie the effectiveness of the method for a typical user were functional when S. implemented the method. The main difference between S.’s use and that of any other person was his uncanny ability to create vivid and detailed mental images. In addition, it is likely that his synesthesia combined with the method of loci in such a way that resulted in particularly strong and effective distinctive processing. Synesthesia undoubtedly produces a uniquely effective form of item-specific processing that would be perfectly complemented by the organizational properties of a detailed mental image of a familiar place. As a result, it is likely that S.’s psychological makeup was simply more conducive for the effective use of the method of loci than is that of an average person.

S. 也使用了一种类似于关键词法的技巧来记忆他无法理解的外语单词或短语。正如 Luria (1968) 所描述的，S. 会根据外语单词或短语的发音，甚至是联觉声学特性，构建一个图像，然后将该图像与一些有意义的内容结合起来，以增强记忆。当看到长长的列表或短语时，S. 会编造一个故事，创造出一系列联想，将需要记忆的内容联系在一起。同样，S. 异常强大的联觉引发的精细化处理能力，与故事法的组织特性完美互补。因此，S. 能够运用这种混合记忆法取得极佳的效果也就不足为奇了。

S. also used a technique similar to the keyword method to remember words from a foreign language or phrases he could not comprehend. As described by Luria (1968), S. would create an image based on the pronunciation or even the synesthetic acoustics of a foreign word or phrase and then combine that image with something meaningful to enhance recall. When presented with long lists or phrases, S. would construct a story to create a chain of associations that would link the to-be-remembered items together. Again, S.’s unusually strong synesthesia-induced elaboration was a perfect complement to the organizational properties of the story method. Thus, it is no surprise that S. used this hybrid mnemonic with extreme effectiveness.

S. 的卓越记忆力至少部分源于其强大的独特处理能力。这种独特的处理能力源于大量看似自动的加工处理和常见的记忆技巧的结合。根据 Luria (1968) 的观点，几乎可以肯定 S. 天生就具有非凡的认知能力。处理能力。这种非同寻常的认知能力带来了惊人的记忆力，但有时也会带来适应不良。无论如何，我们必须承认，S. 至少通过使用普通人也能使用的简单记忆技巧，进一步完善了他本已卓越的记忆力。

The exceptional memory ability of S. appears to have been at least partly the result of strong distinctive processing. This distinctive processing arose from a combination of profuse and seemingly automatic elaboration and common mnemonic techniques. In keeping with Luria’s (1968) suggestion, it is almost certain that S. was born with uncommon cognitive processing. This unusual cognition resulted in amazing feats of memory but was at other times maladaptive. Regardless, one must concede that, in the very least, S. refined his already exceptional memory ability by using simple mnemonic techniques that could be used by an average person.

□副总裁

□ V. P.

根据多项记忆能力测试的结果（Hunt & Love, 1972），VP 展现出的记忆力堪比 S。然而，VP 的记忆力比 S. 更加全面，他不仅能记住数字和无意义的音节，还能记住短语、故事和国际象棋的棋位。此外，VP 在理解含义方面也毫不费力。VP 显然在幼年时就展现出了超强的记忆力，例如他在 5 岁时就能记住拉脱维亚里加市的地图，并在 10 岁时参加比赛时记住了 150 首诗歌（Wilding & Valentine, 1997）。VP 普遍被认为比 S. 更聪明，因为他精通多种语言，智商高达 136（Wilding & Valentine, 1997）。

On the basis of the results of a variety of tests of memory ability (Hunt & Love, 1972), V. P. demonstrated memory ability that rivaled that of S. However, V. P.’s memory was more versatile than S.’s in that the former displayed exceptional memory for not only numbers and nonsense syllables but also phrases, stories, and chess positions. Moreover, V. P. had no trouble comprehending meaning. Apparently, V. P. demonstrated superior memory at an early age as exemplified by memorizing a map of the Latvian city of Riga at age 5 and memorizing 150 poems as part of a competition at age 10 (Wilding & Valentine, 1997). V. P. was generally considered more intelligent than S., as indicated by his proficiency with several languages and IQ of 136 (Wilding & Valentine, 1997).

遗憾的是，关于VP在记忆过程中使用的具体技巧，我们所知甚少。Hunt和Love（1972）认为他并不具备非凡的想象能力或空间能力；然而，正如Wilding和Valentine（1997）所述，这与他能记住里加地图并不一致。VP超强记忆力的唯一解释是运用了有意义的联想，以及根据VP本人的说法，他在学校期间大量练习死记硬背。由于缺乏关于VP记忆方法的信息（无论是自我报告的还是其他方式的），我们对他的讨论将非常简短。然而，我们认为将VP纳入本章非常重要，因为由于VP的能力比S.更注重实证检验，因此在讨论其他记忆力超群的人时，他经常被用作比较的基础。

Unfortunately, there is not much information about the specific techniques V. P. used in his attempts to remember. Hunt and Love (1972) suggested that he did not possess extraordinary imagery or spatial skills; however, as mentioned by Wilding and Valentine (1997), this is not consistent with his memorization of the map of Riga. The only explanations given for his superior memory were the use of meaningful associations and, according to V. P. himself, extensive practice with rote memorization while in school. Given the lack of information (self-reported or otherwise) about V. P.’s methods of memorization, we will keep our discussion of him brief. However, we believed it important to include V. P. in this chapter because he is frequently used as a basis for comparison in discussions of other individuals with superior memory owing to the fact that his ability was examined more empirically than was S.’s.

□艾特肯

□ Aitken

从表面上看，亚历山大·艾特肯 (Alexander Aitken) 的案例似乎与卢里亚 (Luria, 1968) 的 S 案例形成了鲜明对比。正如亨特 (Hunter, 1977) 所描述的，艾特肯是一位精明的心算家和成功的数学家，拥有出色的数字记忆力。例如，他能记住圆周率 (π) 的 1000 位，并且能记住 13 到 15 个数字。此外，亨特还形容他是一位知识渊博、敏锐的学者。对所有事物的深层含义都感兴趣。与S.不同，Aitken表现出对有意义信息的强大记忆力，包括散文段落和乐谱。Aitken声称在学生时代就记住了维吉尔和弥尔顿的《失乐园》。尽管这些事实与Luria对S.的描述截然不同，但Hunter刻意强调S.和Aitken之间的差异，可能掩盖了两人之间一些重要的相似之处。Hunter的文章中明显表明，他认为Aitken的能力和成就在质量上优于S.。这种观点贯穿了他对Aitken的讨论，在谈到记忆术时尤为明显。Hunter认为记忆术主要用于帮助记忆无意义的信息，他认为这不属于真正的学者的职权范围：

At face value, the case of Alexander Aitken appears to be in stark contrast to that of Luria’s (1968) S. As described by Hunter (1977), Aitken was an astute mental calculator and successful mathematician with an outstanding memory for numbers. As an example, he learned pi to 1,000 places and had a digit span of 13 to 15 items. Furthermore, Hunter described him as a consummate intellectual with a broad knowledge base and a keen interest in the underlying meaning of all things. Unlike S., Aitken exhibited strong memory for meaningful information including passages of prose and musical notation. Aitken claimed to have memorized the books of Virgil and Milton’s Paradise Lost during his school days. Although these facts paint a picture that seems quite different from Luria’s description of S., Hunter’s concerted effort to emphasize the differences between S. and Aitken may have obscured some important similarities between the two. It is quite evident in Hunter’s article that he believed that Aitken’s abilities and accomplishments were qualitatively superior to S.’s. This sentiment permeates his discussion of Aitken and is most evident when addressing the topic of mnemonics. Hunter viewed mnemonics as serving mainly to facilitate memory for meaningless information, and he believed that they were not in the purview of a true academic:

记忆术是一种心理技巧，它使我们能够将原本毫无意义的材料赋予特定的意义……自古希腊以来，认真研究记忆的学者们，至少可以说，一直不愿推广它们的广泛应用。为什么？因为它们让我们专注于那些严重限制生产性思维效用的属性和模式。（第163页）

Mnemonics are mental contrivances that allow us to impose ad hoc meaning on material that is otherwise meaningless to us … since the time of ancient Greece, serious students of memory have, to say the least, been reluctant to prescribe their widespread use. Why? Because they involve us in focusing upon the kind of property, and kind of pattern, that has severely limited utility for productive thinking. (p. 163)

重要的是，亨特将 S. 难以记住有意义的信息与他使用助记符联系起来。虽然尚不清楚亨特是否认为 S. 使用助记符是一个限制因素，还是仅仅是他综合认知能力较差的表现，但很明显，亨特认为 S. 高度感知的编码过程不如艾特肯的语义编码形式。此外，亨特和艾特肯都坚决否认艾特肯使用过任何类型的助记符。用艾特肯的话来说，“我从不使用助记符，也非常不信任它们。它们会给我的头脑带来一种陌生的扰动，而我希望它是纯净而清澈的”(Hunter, 1977, p. 163)。

Importantly, Hunter associated S.’s difficulties remembering meaningful information with his use of mnemonics. Although it is not clear whether Hunter believed S.’s use of mnemonics to be a limiting factor or simply a manifestation of his lesser all-around cognitive ability, it is obvious that Hunter believed that S.’s highly perceptual encoding processes to be inferior to Aitken’s form of semantic encoding. Moreover, both Hunter and Aitken adamantly denied that Aitken made use of any type of mnemonic. In Aitken’s words, “Mnemonics I never use and deeply distrust. They introduce an alien perturbation into a mind, as I would have it, be pure and limpid” (Hunter, 1977, p. 163).

尽管有人固执己见，甚至有些夸张地声称事实并非如此，但有证据表明艾特肯确实使用了记忆技巧来增强记忆力。最明显的是艾特肯对节奏的运用。为了提高对长列表的长期记忆，他会专注于听觉节奏分组，为待学习的信息强加结构。如第五章所述，节奏和/或旋律的运用可以使人对大量材料产生强烈的记忆。同样显而易见的是，艾特肯在处理信息时使用了各种代码。他对意义的浓厚兴趣促使他对每个刺激进行彻底的分析。这一分析在他讨论音乐记忆的一封信中显而易见：

Despite the adamant and somewhat pompous claims to contrary, there is evidence that suggests that Aitken did in fact use mnemonic techniques to enhance his memory. Most obvious was Aitken’s use of rhythm. To enhance his long-term retention of long lists, he would focus on auditory-rhythmic groupings to impose structure on the to-be-learned information. As noted in Chapter 5, the use of rhythm and/or melody can result in strong memory for large amounts material. It is also clear that Aitken used a variety of codes when processing information. His intense interest in meaning led to a thorough analysis of each stimulus. This analysis is evident in a letter from him discussing musical memory:

我确信，音乐记忆可以发展到比其他任何记忆都要更惊人的程度，因为我们有韵律、节奏、曲调，或不止一种，和声、乐器的色彩、某种特定的情感或情感序列、某种意义（无论用其他词语如何难以表达），在演奏者身上都是一种听觉的、节奏的、肌肉的和功能性的记忆；其次，就我而言，当一切都无力时，乐谱的视觉形象就会出现；或许还有对作曲家的人文情怀，在聆听或演奏作品时，人们会将自己与作曲家联系起来，以及对作品形式的审美兴趣。（亨特，1977年，第157页）

Musical memory can, I am certain, be developed to a more remarkable degree than any other, for we have a metre and a rhythm, a tune, or more than one, the harmony, the instrumental colour, a particular emotion or sequence of emotion, a meaning, however difficult to express in other terms, in the executant an auditory, a rhythmic and muscular and functional memory; and secondarily in my case, a visual image of the page which comes to rescue when all else flag; perhaps also a human interest in the composer, with whom one may identify oneself for the time that composition is being heard or performed and aesthetic interest in the form of the piece. (Hunter, 1977, p. 157)

这段摘录不仅揭示了他丰富的编码能力，还暗示了他运用了一些心理意象。尽管亨特没有讨论艾特肯对心理意象的运用，但从上文可以清楚地看出，至少就他的音乐记忆而言，视觉意象和动觉意象都得到了处理。因此，艾特肯和S.在处理信息时都运用了某种形式的助记符、多重编码和心理意象。还值得注意的是，两人都调整了记忆策略，以适应特别困难或人为的记忆任务。这表明艾特肯和S.都通过有意识地运用助记符技巧来提升记忆能力。

This excerpt not only reveals the richness of his encoding but also suggests some use of mental imagery. Although Hunter does not discuss Aitken’s use of mental imagery, it is clear from above that both visual and kinesthetic imagery were processed at least in terms of his memory for music. Thus, both Aitken and S. used some form of mnemonics, multiple codes, and mental imagery while processing information. It should also be noted that both men adjusted their memory strategies to accommodate especially difficult or artificial memory tasks. This suggests that both Aitken and S. refined their memory abilities with the conscious use of mnemonic techniques.

S. 和 Aitken 描述部分记忆的方式也存在一个有趣的相似之处。具体来说，Aitken 将自己对一串数字的记忆描述为“一种闪光，仿佛留下了某种印象。这是一种既看不见也听不见的奇妙感觉。我无法用语言描述它”（Hunter，1977，第 160 页）。这让人想起 S. 对某些记忆的描述，其中包含“飞溅”或“蒸汽”的描述（Luria，1968，第 39 页）。对 S. 来说，“飞溅”和“蒸汽”主要代表着模糊记忆的干扰，而 Aitken 的“闪光”似乎代表了某些记忆的某种特质。我们并非暗示 Aitken 和 S. 一样经历过联觉；我们只是想指出，两人在描述记忆（即使不是记忆本身）时都具有一种独特的共同特质。

There is also an interesting similarity in the way S. and Aitken described some of their memories. Specifically, Aitken described his memory for a string of digits as “a kind of shimmer. It’s as if it had left an impression. It’s a funny faculty of neither seeing nor hearing. It’s the kind of thing I can’t describe” (Hunter, 1977, p. 160). This calls to mind S.’s description of certain memories containing “splashes” or “puffs of steam” (Luria, 1968, p. 39). For S., the “splashes” and “puffs of steam” mainly represented distractions that obscured memories, whereas Aitken’s “shimmer” seems to represent a quality of certain memories. We are not suggesting that Aitken experienced synesthesia as did S.; we simply wish to point out a unique quality that was shared by both men in terms of their descriptions of memories (if not the memories themselves).

Aitken 与 S. 最大的不同在于他对组织结构的广泛运用。如上所述，Aitken 主要依靠有节奏的组织结构来编码待记忆的信息。他对有意义模式的持续探索也导致了大量的关系处理。那么问题来了，Aitken 是如何抵消这种强烈的关系处理倾向的，从而避免了与组织记忆相关的错误（参见第五章）？首先，必须指出的是，与 Aitken 的言语记忆相关的实证数据并不多，这些数据似乎更容易受到与以组织策略为主的记忆方法相关的辨别性错误的影响。其次，Aitken 的记忆并非万无一失，就其记忆容量、持久性和准确性而言，他的记忆力远不及 S. (Hunter, 1977)。尽管如此，Aitken 的记忆力仍然非常出色。艾特肯之所以记忆力超群，部分原因在于他主要运用组织记忆法，并广泛运用多种编码方式。由于艾特肯不断地重新编码待学习的信息，目标信息最终形成了一种独特的模式。此外，他广博的知识基础和对意义阐释的追求无疑促成了他大量的比较和对比，这既涉及特定项目，也涉及关系处理。

Aitken diverges most from S. in his extensive use of organization. As noted above, Aitken relied primarily on rhythmic organization to encode to-be-remembered information. His constant search for meaningful patterns would also lead to a good deal of relational processing. The question then becomes, how did Aitken offset this strong tendency toward relational processing in a way that allowed him to avoid the type of errors associated with organizational mnemonics (see Chapter 5)? First, it must be noted that there is not a good deal of empirical data related to Aitken’s verbal memory that would seemingly be more subject to errors of discriminability associated with predominantly organizational strategies. Second, Aitken’s memory was in no way infallible, and in terms of sheer capacity, durability, and accuracy, it was not at the level displayed by S. (Hunter, 1977). Nonetheless, Aitken’s memory ability was exceptional. A partial explanation for Aitken’s memory prowess in light of using mainly organizational mnemonics is his extensive use of multiple encodings. Because Aitken continually recoded to-be-learned information, the target information eventually emerged as part of a unique pattern. In addition, his broad knowledge base and quest for meaningful interpretation undoubtedly resulted in a good deal of comparison and contrast that involved both item-specific and relational processing.

艾特肯强大的知识库通过自然的独特处理方式促成了他卓越的记忆力，这一观点得到了近期研究（Rawson & Van Overschelde, 2008; Van Overschelde, Rawson, Dunlosky, & Hunt, 2005）的支持。这些研究表明，特定领域的专家级记忆表现可以通过特定项目处理和关系处理相结合来解释。重要的是，这些研究的对象是拥有正常基本记忆技能、恰好在某个特定领域（NFL橄榄球）知识渊博的人。此外，这些“专家”强大记忆力背后的独特处理方式并非有意识地运用记忆技巧的结果，而是其专业领域中成熟知识库的自然协变量。考虑到这些发现，艾特肯很可能至少在对他所精通的几个领域的信息进行了一种或多或少自然的独特处理方式。因此，他有意识地运用节奏组织很可能经常与与其专业知识相关的特定项目处理方式相辅相成。

The idea that Aitken’s strong knowledge base contributed to his superior memory via natural distinctive processing is supported by recent research (Rawson & Van Overschelde, 2008; Van Overschelde, Rawson, Dunlosky, & Hunt, 2005), which has demonstrated that domain-specific expert memory performance can be accounted for by a combination of item-specific and relational processing. Importantly, these studies examined people with normal basic memory skills who happened to be especially knowledgeable in a particular area (NFL football). Moreover, the distinctive processing that underlay strong memory performance for these “experts” was not the result of conscious use of mnemonic techniques but a natural covariate of a well-developed knowledge base in their domain of expertise. Taking these findings into consideration, it is likely that Aitken engaged in a more or less natural form of distinctive processing at least for information in the several areas for which he was highly knowledgeable. Thus, it is likely that his conscious use of rhythmic organization was frequently complemented by the item-specific processing associated with his expert knowledge.

与 S. 类似，Aitken 也使用记忆技巧，但他超强的记忆力并不能完全用这些技巧来解释。Aitken 使用的组织技巧似乎与一般人不同。首先，Hunter (1977) 对 Aitken 运用节奏的描述表明，节奏是更大、更复杂的模式的一部分，而不是从简单的节奏或旋律中衍生出来的。从这个方面来看，Aitken 强大的智力很可能在他的主观组织中发挥了重要作用。此外，除了他通过不断的比较和对比来使用特定于项目和关系的处理之外，Aitken 使用的记忆技巧似乎比对大多数学习者有帮助的记忆技巧更复杂。

Similar to S., Aitken used mnemonic techniques, but his superior memory ability cannot be fully explained by the use of those techniques. It appears that Aitken’s use of organizational techniques was different from that which is typical. First, Hunter’s (1977) description of Aitken’s use of rhythm suggests that it was used as part of a larger, more complex pattern than would be derived from a simple rhythm or melody. In this respect, it is likely that Aitken’s powerful intellect played a large part in his subjective organization. Moreover, with the exception of his use of item-specific and relational processing by way of continual comparisons and contrasts, it appears that Aitken’s use of mnemonics was more complicated than that which would be helpful to most learners.

□ TE

□ T. E.

与S.和Aitken不同，TE及其研究者（Gordon、Valentine和Wilding，1984；Wilding和Valentine，1985）将他卓越的记忆力归功于他从青少年时期就开始使用的记忆术。TE运用了多种记忆术，但他偏爱的记忆术是该方法是一种与第四章所述几乎相同的语音系统（见表4.1）。使用这种方法，他在配对联想记忆中的准确率与VP在类似任务中的表现相当，在数字矩阵记忆中的准确率与VP和S.相当，并且在布朗-彼得森短期记忆测试中的表现超过了VP（参见Peterson & Peterson, 1959）。TE还表现出对故事、面孔和姓名的出色记忆力。

Unlike S. and Aitken, T. E. and those who studied him (Gordon, Valentine, & Wilding, 1984; Wilding & Valentine, 1985) ascribed his exceptional memory skills to the use of mnemonic techniques, which he began using as a teenager. T. E. used a variety of mnemonic techniques, but his preferred method was a phonetic system nearly identical to that described in Chapter 4 (see Table 4.1). Using this method, he displayed memory accuracy for paired associates that was comparable to V. P.’s performance on a similar task, memory for number matrices that was comparable to performances by V. P. and S., and performance that exceeded that of V. P. on the Brown-Peterson test of short-term memory (see Peterson & Peterson, 1959). T. E. also displayed exceptional memory for stories, faces, and names.

TE 的案例尤其引人关注，因为他没有表现出其他特殊能力的迹象，而且他的基本认知能力也并无不寻常之处（Gordon 等人，1984）。这使得 Gordon 等人得出结论，TE 的能力源于他运用了记忆术。此外，作者还指出，其他人仅凭运用记忆术就能达到与 TE 类似的记忆力：

The case of T. E. is especially interesting because he showed no signs of other exceptional abilities, and his basic cognitive abilities were not unusual (Gordon et al., 1984). This led Gordon et al. to conclude that T. E.’s ability was accounted for by his use of mnemonics. Moreover, the authors suggested that memory performance similar to that of T. E. could be achieved by others simply by using mnemonic techniques:

有证据表明，TE 的记忆能力需要用其非凡的基本能力来解释。尽管他的表现比“正常”受试者更准确，甚至比其他记忆大师更胜一筹，但他的所有成就都可以用他运用的记忆“技巧”来解释。此外，没有任何证据表明，如果人们充分了解所使用的记忆技巧，并准备以同样的程度进行练习，那么许多人无法像 TE 一样高效地完成记忆任务。（Gordon 等人，1984 年，第 13 页）

There has been evidence to suggest that T. E.’s memory performance requires an explanation in terms of unusual basic abilities. Although he performed more accurately than “normal” subjects— indeed he even performed better than other mnemonists—all of his feats could be explained by the mnemonic “tricks” that he employed. Furthermore, there is nothing to suggest that many people could not perform memory tasks as efficiently as T. E., if they had a full knowledge of the mnemonic techniques used and were prepared to practise them to the same extent. (Gordon et al., 1984, p. 13)

Gordon等人的结论与Ericsson及其同事（例如Chase & Ericsson，1982；Ericsson，1985）的观点相呼应，他们认为卓越的记忆力只能通过大量的练习才能获得。虽然我们不一定赞同这一说法，但我们确实认为TE所使用的记忆方法值得仔细研究。

The conclusion made by Gordon et al. echoes the sentiments of Ericsson and colleagues (e.g., Chase &Ericsson, 1982; Ericsson, 1985) who have argued that exceptional memory can be achieved solely through extensive practice. Although we do not necessarily endorse this claim, we do believe that the mnemonic methods used by T. E. are worthy of close examination.

如上所述，TE 广泛运用了语音系统。然而，值得注意的是，TE 经常将语音系统与其他助记符相结合，以满足特定学习任务的需求。例如，在 Gordon 等人（1984）的实验 1 中，TE 被要求学习许多由三字母组合和一个两位数组成的配对联想词。在测试中，TE 拿到三字母组合，并被要求回忆与之关联的数字。这项任务的难度在于，他们只使用四个三字母组合，并不断用不同的数字进行修复，并且在回忆之前改变中间的试验次数。TE 结合语音系统、故事法和类似于挂钩词法的组件来完成这项任务。首先，他根据有意义的联想，将每个三字母组合转换成一个单词。然后，他使用语音系统规定的转换方法将每个数字转换成一个单词。然后，代表每个三字母组合的单词作为他与之关联的挂钩词。通过交互式心理意象，他理解了代表数字的单词。然后，他运用故事法将这些交互式心理意象串联起来。因此，这种巧妙的方法组合使TE能够将相对无意义的信息（三元组-数字对）转化为有意义的图像，并在故事的语境中将它们按顺序组织起来。这是将精细加工与组织相结合以实现独特加工的一个很好的例子。

As mentioned above, T. E. made extensive use of the phonetic system. However, it should be noted that T. E. often combined the phonetic system with other mnemonics in order to meet the demands of a given learning task. For example, in Gordon et al.’s (1984) Experiment 1, T. E. was required to learn numerous paired associates each composed of a trigram and a two-digit number. At testing, T. E. was provided with the trigram and asked to recall the associated number. This task was made more difficult by using only four trigrams, which were continually being repaired with different numbers, and by varying the number of intervening trials prior to recall. T. E. approached this task using a combination of the phonetic system, the story method, and a component that resembles the peg-word method. First, he converted each trigram into a word based on meaningful associations. He then converted each number to a word using the conversion prescribed by the phonetic system. The words representing each of the trigrams then served as peg words that he associated with the words representing numbers via interactive mental imagery. He then linked the interactive mental images together using the story method. Thus, this skillful combination of methods allowed T. E. to convert relatively meaningless information (trigram–number pairs) into meaningful images and then organize them in serial order within the context of a story. This is a fine example of achieving distinctive processing by combining elaboration with organization.

TE 还将挂钩词法的变体与语音系统相结合，以记忆数字数组。例如，在 Gordon 等人（1984）的实验 3 中，TE 被呈现了一个包含 48 个数字的数组，该数组被分成八行。TE 使用语音系统创建了一个单词，随后在脑海中形成了一个图像来表示每一行。然后，他将组成每行的数字分成两组，每组三个数字，再使用语音系统将这些数字转换为单词。之后，他使用交互式心理意象，为每一行创建一个场景，其中包含代表该行数字组的单词图像。这种方法为 TE 提供了很大的测试灵活性，因为可以轻松地按顺序或由其他人随机选择的行来回忆数组。显然，这种方法是有效的，TE 在任务中的完美表现证明了这一点。此外，与 VP 或 S 相比，TE 完成此项任务及类似任务所需的学习和回忆时间更少。

T. E. also combined a variation of the peg-word method and the phonetic system to remember arrays of numbers. For example, in Gordon et al.’s (1984) Experiment 3, T. E. was presented with an array of 48 numbers that was divided into eight rows. T. E. created a word and, subsequently, a mental image to represent each row using the phonetic system. He then separated the numbers composing each row into two groups of three numbers, which he again converted to words using the phonetic system. Then, using interactive mental imagery, he created a scene for each row that included images of the words representing the number groups within the row. This method afforded T. E. a good deal of flexibility at testing because the array could be easily recalled in order or by rows selected randomly by others. Clearly this method was effective as evidenced by T. E.’s perfect performance on the task. Moreover, T. E. required less study and recall time to complete this and similar tasks than did V. P. or S.

TE 使用更简单的记忆技巧来记住故事、面孔和名字。在一项实验中，由于呈现速度的限制，TE 无法使用正式的记忆技巧（Wilding & Valentine，1985，实验 1），仅凭心理意象，TE 在记忆故事主题和情节方面的表现优于对照组参与者。然而，正如 Wilding 和 Valentine 所指出的，如果 TE 像大多数人在这种学习情境中那样只使用心理意象，那么他使用这种方法的效率显然比普通参与者更高。为了支持这一论点，TE 在一项想象思维测试中的得分比平均值高出 4.8 个标准差（Wilding & Valentine，1985）。

T. E. used simpler mnemonic techniques to remember stories, faces, and names. In an experiment in which the presentation rate precluded the use of formal mnemonic techniques (Wilding & Valentine, 1985, Experiment 1), T. E. outperformed control participants in memory for themes and episodes of stories by simply using mental imagery. However, as noted by Wilding and Valentine, if T. E. used only mental imagery as would most in this type of learning situation, his use of the method was obviously more efficient than the casual user’s. In support of this argument, T. E. scored 4.8 standard deviations above the mean in a test of imaginal thinking (Wilding & Valentine, 1985).

TE 也运用视觉心像法来记忆面孔。然而，在这种情况下，他会夸大面孔的一个显著特征，然后将这个特征叠加到他自己的面孔图像上。通过这种方法，TE 对 36 张面孔（每张 5 秒）的列表表现出了完美的识别能力。有趣的是，TE 对显著特征的夸大与 S. 上文描述的对图像变换的运用类似。

T. E. also used visual mental imagery for remembering faces. However, in this case he would exaggerate a distinctive feature of the face and then superimpose this feature on his image of the face. Using this method, T. E. displayed perfect recognition for a list of 36 faces presented for 5 seconds each. Interestingly, T. E.’s exaggeration of distinctive features is similar to S.’s use of image transformation described above.

综合考虑所有因素，TE 卓越的记忆力表现似乎源于其对记忆术的娴熟运用和异常强大的想象思维能力。虽然尚不清楚 TE 卓越的想象思维能力是源于他大量练习记忆术的结果，还是在他运用记忆术之前就已具备，但可以肯定的是，他对记忆术的了解和运用促成了他非凡的记忆力。

Taking all into consideration, it appears that T. E.’s exceptional memory performance resulted from skillful application of mnemonic techniques and unusually strong imaginal thinking ability. Although it is unclear whether T. E.’s superior imaginal thinking ability was the result of extensive practice with mnemonics or preceded his use of them, it is clear that his knowledge and use mnemonics contributed to his exceptional feats of memory.

□总结与结论

□ Summary and Conclusions

本章讨论的人物背景、能力和方法各不相同。S. 出身平凡，但联觉显著。他能极其准确地记住一长串字母、数字和单词，但难以记住有意义的信息。VP 智商高，精通多种语言，对各种信息都表现出卓越的记忆力。Aitken 智商极高，受过良好的教育，并且具有极强的分析性处理能力。他以对数字信息的出色记忆力而闻名，但他也对其他类型的信息表现出强大的记忆力。TE 大学毕业后，十几岁时就对记忆术产生了兴趣，对数字、面孔和故事等各种信息都表现出卓越的记忆力。

The individuals discussed in this chapter represent a wide range of backgrounds, abilities, and methods. S. was a man with an unremarkable background and marked synesthesia. He displayed extremely accurate memory for long lists of letters, numbers, and words but had difficulty with meaningful materials. V. P., a man with a high IQ and expertise in a variety of languages, displayed outstanding memory for a wide variety of information. Aitken was highly intelligent and exceptionally well educated, and he engaged in an extremely analytical form of processing. He was known for his exceptional memory for numerical information, but he also displayed strong memory for a variety of other types of information. T. E. was a college graduate who developed an interest in mnemonics as a teenager and displayed exceptional memory for a variety of information including numbers, faces, and stories.

尽管有人声称并非如此，但本章讨论的所有人都定期使用至少一种记忆技巧。S. 广泛运用了位置记忆法，以及更普遍的交互式心理意象法。虽然关于 VP 方法的细节不多，但人们相信他的技巧包含大量有意义的阐述。Aitken 声称没有使用任何记忆技巧，但有证据表明他广泛运用了节奏组织、多重编码和关系处理。与其他讨论的人物不同，TE 将他的记忆能力完全归功于记忆技巧。他广泛运用了语音系统和故事法，以及交互式心理意象法和挂钩词法的组成部分。

Despite some claims to the contrary, all of the individuals discussed in this chapter used at least one mnemonic technique on a regular basis. S. made extensive use of the method of loci and, more generally, interactive mental imagery. Although there are few specifics available regarding V. P.’s methods, it is believed that his technique involved a good deal of meaningful elaboration. Aitken claimed to use no mnemonic techniques, but evidence suggests that he made extensive use of rhythmic organization, multiple coding, and relational processing. T. E., unlike the others discussed, attributed all of his memory ability to the use of mnemonics. He made extensive use of the phonetic system and the story method as well as interactive mental imagery and components of the peg-word method.

有人认为，几乎任何愿意精通记忆技巧的人都可以获得超强的记忆力（参见 Chase & Ericsson，1982；Ericsson，1985；Ericsson 等，1980；Wilding & Valentine，1985）。然而，Wilding 和 Valentine（2006）最近指出，仅通过使用或练习记忆术，不太可能获得本文讨论的个人所表现出的广泛记忆优势。虽然我们大体上同意这种观点，但我们确实相信，使用记忆术可以显著提高一个人在广泛学科领域的记忆能力。此外，我们相信，通过大量练习适当的技巧可以实现高度专业化的记忆能力。然而，真正卓越的广泛记忆可能是多种因素共同作用的产物，包括遗传倾向、环境因素和一般才能。

It has been argued that superior memory can be achieved by virtually anyone who is willing to become well versed in mnemonic techniques (see Chase & Ericsson, 1982; Ericsson, 1985; Ericsson et al., 1980; Wilding & Valentine, 1985). However, Wilding and Valentine (2006) more recently argued that broad memory superiority such as that displayed by the individuals discussed here is unlikely to be achieved solely through mnemonic use or practice. Although we generally agree with this notion, we do believe that the use of mnemonics can significantly improve one’s memory ability across a wide domain of subject areas. Moreover, we believe that highly specialized feats of memory prowess could be achieved through extensive practice with appropriate techniques. However, truly exceptional broad-based memory is likely a product of multiple factors including genetic predispositions, environmental factors, and general aptitude.

7

摄氏度哈一个磷T埃R		 

助记符回归教育

Mnemonics Returns to Education

记忆术与教育之间的关系历久弥新，尽管偶尔会有些动荡。记忆术在正规教育中的作用是支持文科课程的核心目的，即教授有效的口头交流。从中世纪到 20 世纪初，修辞学是大学课程的核心，而记忆术被视为该课程的重要组成部分。但在那个时期，记忆术偶尔会受到批评，被认为无效，甚至有损于真正的理解，因此不值得在严肃的教育中占有一席之地。批评家们指出，死记硬背与知识的获取和运用毫无关系。时代变了。修辞学不再是大学课程中的主导，正规的记忆术课程也从各个级别的课堂上消失了。与此同时，人们对记忆术在支持学习方面的价值的务实认识，为在正规教学中选择性地应用记忆术技巧注入了新的活力。结果是对课堂应用中的记忆术进行了大量扎实的研究。

The relationship between mnemonics and education has been enduring if occasionally tempestuous. Mnemonics’ place in formal education was to support the central purpose of the liberal arts curriculum, teaching effective oral communication. From the Middle Ages to the early 20th century, rhetoric was the core of the university curriculum, and mnemonics was viewed as a critical component of that curriculum. But during that period, mnemonics was sporadically criticized as ineffectual or even detrimental to true understanding and as such deserved no status in a serious education. Rote memory, the critics observed, has nothing to do with the acquisition and use of knowledge. The times have changed. Rhetoric no longer has hegemony within the university curriculum, and formal courses in mnemonics have vanished from the classroom at any level. At the same time, a pragmatic appreciation for the value of mnemonics in support of learning has given new life to selective application of mnemonic techniques in formal instruction. The upshot is a substantial body of solid research on mnemonics in classroom application.

在本章中，我们将概述这项研究，并着眼于两个目标。第一个目标是阐明助记技巧在不同学科和不同材料中的应用范围。在某些情况下，这些应用并不令人意外，例如学习第二语言词汇。在其他情况下，这些应用则出乎意料，例如学习多项式和代数问题求解。

In this chapter, we shall provide an overview of that research with two goals in mind. The first goal is to illustrate the range of applications of mnemonic techniques across disciplines and types of materials. In some cases, these applications are not surprising, such as the learning of second-language vocabulary. In other instances, the applications are rather unexpected, such as learning polynomials and problem solving in algebra.

第二个目标是突出在正规教学中使用助记符的相关问题，并将这些问题转化为可研究的问题。例如，鉴于基础研究发现，图像在记忆抽象材料方面的作用不大（Paivio，1971），将需要视觉图像的助记符应用于抽象材料是否可取？开发助记符的难度与其促进学习和记忆的效果之间的成本效益比是多少？助记符技术如果学生难以掌握，显然就没有实际用处。同样明显的是，助记符的有效性取决于该符的易记性。本系列的一位编辑告诉我们，他在高中时学过一个很棒的助记符，是关于罗马帝国灭亡的15个原因的，但不幸的是，他已经记不清了。假设助记符能被记住，那么它能被解码就变得很重要。毕竟，最终令人感兴趣的是助记符的目标，而不是符本身。关于其中一些问题的研究已经存在，接下来我们将有选择地回顾这些研究。

The second goal is to highlight issues associated with the use of mnemonics in formal instruction and to cast those issues as researchable questions. For example, is it advisable to use a mnemonic requiring visual imagery in application to abstract material, given the basic research finding that imagery is of little value in memory for abstract material (Paivio, 1971)? What is the cost–benefit ratio of the difficulty of developing a mnemonic to its facilitation of learning and memory? A mnemonic technique obviously will be of no practical use if it is too difficult for students to develop. Equally obvious is that the effectiveness of a mnemonic device will hinge on the memorability of that device. One of the editors of this series mentioned to us that he learned a wonderful mnemonic in high school for the 15 reasons that the Roman Empire collapsed, but unfortunately he no longer remembers the mnemonic. Assuming the mnemonic can be remembered, it becomes important that it can be decoded. After all, it is the target of the mnemonic not the device itself that is of ultimate interest. Research is available on some of these issues, and in what follows, we selectively review that research.

□应用领域

□ Areas of Application

当代关于助记符教育应用的研究涵盖了广泛的助记符技巧和学科。这些文献可以以多种不同的方式组织。可以按学科对研究进行分类来完成这项任务。或者，可以使用助记符作为组织结构。这两种方法都可以取得良好的效果，但我们选择了第三种方法。也就是说，可以根据认知需求的维度来安排助记符技巧的目标，一端以对单个单词的死记硬背为基点，另一端以类比推理为基点。我们的讨论将沿着这个维度进行，从词汇和术语的习得开始。然后，我们将研究分类法中关系的习得以及这些关系在推理任务中的应用。接下来，我们将探讨助记符技巧在数学中的应用，最后我们将探讨助记符在话语记忆中的应用。

Contemporary research on educational applications of mnemonics includes a wide range of mnemonic techniques and academic disciplines. This literature could be organized in several different ways. One could approach the task by categorizing the studies by discipline. Alternatively, one could use mnemonic devices as the organizational structure. Either of these approaches could be used to good effect, but we have chosen a third alternative. That is, one can order the goal of the mnemonic technique on a dimension of cognitive demand, anchored on one end by rote memory of single words and on the other by analogical reasoning. Our discussion will proceed along that dimension beginning with the acquisition of vocabulary and terminology. We then move on to studies on the acquisition of relationships within taxonomies and the use of these relationships in reasoning tasks. Application of mnemonic techniques to mathematics will follow that, and we finish with work on the use of mnemonics in memory for discourse.

外语习得

Foreign-Language Acquisition

学习一门非母语的道路上，词汇习得铺就了道路，而对许多学生来说，这是一条坎坷的路。通过传统的练习方法学习词汇既困难又乏味。因此，任何能够提高学习效率的教学方法，不仅会受到欢迎，而且很可能还会激发学生学习外语的兴趣。这个阶段非常适合运用记忆术。其基本目标是记住一对词，在本例中，是通过将外来词与已知语言中的单词进行对比，来记住其含义。因此，我们掌握了大量关于记忆术在外语词汇习得中的作用的信息也就不足为奇了。

The road to learning an alternative language is paved with vocabulary acquisition, and for many students this is a bumpy stretch. Learning vocabulary through traditional drill methods is difficult and tedious. Consequently, any pedagogical procedure that enhances the efficiency of the process would not only be welcomed but would probably encourage more interest in the study of foreign languages. This stage is set perfectly for the application of mnemonic techniques. The basic goal is to acquire a memory for a pair of words, in this case for the meaning of a foreign word by equating it with a word in a known language. Thus, it is not surprising that we have a fair amount of information about the utility of mnemonics for foreign-vocabulary acquisition.

至少对于研究目的而言，最受欢迎的技术是关键词法，它是在外语词汇习得的背景下发明的（Atkinson，1975）。虽然第四章已经详细描述了该方法，但这里只做简要的回顾。该技术分三个阶段进行。第一阶段是学习外来词和关键词之间的关系，关键词是已知语言中发音与外来词相似的词。第二阶段是通过已知语言的翻译引入外来词的含义。在此阶段，形成一个交互式图像，将关键词与外来词的母语对应词联系起来。例如，假设要学习的目标是西班牙语单词perro。我们选择hero作为关键词，不仅因为最后一个音节的发音与perro相似，还因为很容易为hero形成一个交互式图像，该图像可以很容易地与perro的含义（即狗）联系起来。也许我们形成的图像是一辆消防车上的狗，项圈上戴着奖章。掌握了前两个阶段后，第三阶段就是运用助记符翻译外来词汇。其思路是，perro会提示hero，这反过来又会唤起互动图像，最终解码为dog。

The favored technique, at least for research purposes, is the keyword method, which was invented in the context of foreign-vocabulary acquisition (Atkinson, 1975). Although a detailed description of the method was given in Chapter 4, a brief refresher is offered here. The technique proceeds in three stages. The first is learning the relationship between the foreign word and the keyword, which is a word in the known language that sounds like the foreign word. The second stage brings in the meaning of the foreign word through its translation in the known language. In this stage, an interactive image is formed relating the keyword to the native-language equivalent to the foreign word. For example, suppose the target to be learned is the Spanish word perro. Let us pick hero as the keyword, not only because the last syllable is similar in sound to perro but also because it will be easy to form an interactive image for hero that can be related easily to the meaning of perro, which is dog. Perhaps the image we form is of a dog on a fire truck with a medal on her collar. With the first two stages of the process mastered, the third phase is the use of the mnemonic in translation of the foreign vocabulary. The idea is that perro would cue hero, which in turn would bring the interactive image to mind and allow decoding to dog.

许多研究报告表明，关键词法比死记硬背或任人自学更有效（相关评论，参见Cohen，1987；Paivio & Desrochers，1981）。Atkinson（1975）最初开发该技术时，使用的是俄语-英语翻译，但从那时起，其他语言的翻译方法也开始使用。这些方法包括德语-英语（Desrochers、Wieland & Cote，1991）、他加禄语-英语（Wang、Thomas & Ouellette，1992）以及汉语-英语（Wang & Thomas，1992）。此外，关键词法已被证明对老年人（Gruneberg & Pascoe，1996）和儿童（Pressley、Levin & Miller，1981）的第二语言学习有效。

A number of studies have reported that the keyword method is more effective than rote rehearsal or simply leaving people to their own devices in learning foreign vocabulary (for reviews, see Cohen, 1987; Paivio & Desrochers, 1981). Atkinson’s (1975) original development of the technique was with Russian–English translations, but since that time other languages have been used. These include German–English (Desrochers, Wieland, & Cote, 1991), Tagalog–English (Wang, Thomas, & Ouellette, 1992), and Chinese–English (Wang & Thomas, 1992). Moreover, the keyword method has been shown to be effective for second-language learning with older adults (Gruneberg & Pascoe, 1996) and children (Pressley, Levin, & Miller, 1981).

然而，与这些积极成果形成鲜明对比的是一系列近期的负面发现（例如，Desrochers 等人，1991 年；Ellis & Beaton，1993 年；Wang & Thomas，1995 年）。其中一项最彻底的研究报告了关键词法没有效果，即范·赫尔和马恩 (van Hell and Mahn, 1997) 的研究。在这项研究中，他们将关键词法与死记硬背的复述法进行了对比，研究对象包括有外语学习经验的学生和没有经验的学生。学习结束后，每个学生立即接受测试，两周后接受测试，三周后再次接受测试。测试不仅包括翻译准确性的测量，还包括延迟的测量。虽然很少有研究测量延迟，但翻译所花费的时间是衡量熟练程度的重要指标。令人惊讶的结果是，学习方法的有效性会随着外语经验的变化而变化。有经验的学生在复述后的表现比使用关键词法时更好。使用了。缺乏经验的学生在两种技术之间没有表现出任何差异。这些结果在准确性和延迟方面均成立。

Weighing against these positive results, however, are a series of more recent negative findings (e.g., Desrochers et al., 1991; Ellis & Beaton, 1993; Wang & Thomas, 1995). One of the most thorough studies reporting no effect of the keyword method is that of van Hell and Mahn (1997). In this study, the keyword method was pitted against rote rehearsal with students who were either experienced in learning foreign language or inexperienced. Following the study session, each student was tested immediately, 2 weeks later, and again 3 weeks after the initial study session. The tests included not only a measure of accuracy of translation but also a measure of latency. Although few studies measure latency, the time taken in translation is an important index of proficiency. The surprising result was that the effectiveness of the study method varied as a function of experience with foreign languages. The experienced students performed better following rehearsal than when the keyword method was used. The inexperienced students showed no difference between the two techniques. These results held for both accuracy and latency.

范·赫尔和马恩（1997）等人的研究结果，混淆了记忆技巧在外语习得中的有效性问题。仅就研究数量而言，关键词法在外语词汇习得中的效果较为理想，但负面报告也显示死记硬背能取得更好的效果，这一事实更加凸显了调和研究结果不一致的必要性。目前，尚不清楚哪些关键因素决定了关键词法的效果究竟比标准的练习技巧更好还是更差。

Results such as those reported by van Hell and Mahn (1997) and others muddle the issue of the effectiveness of mnemonic techniques in the acquisition of foreign language. In terms of just the sheer number of studies, the balance sheet favors the use of the keyword method in the acquisition of foreign vocabulary, but the fact that the negative reports include better performance from rote rehearsal adds urgency to the need to reconcile the inconsistency among the studies. At this point, it is not clear what critical factors determine whether the keyword method will produce better or worse performance than rather standard drill techniques.

术语的习得

Acquisition of Terminology

入门课程的首要要求之一是学习新的专业术语。此类学习的要求与学习外语词汇的要求基本相同：建立术语与其含义之间的联系。与习得任何新词（无论是母语还是外语）一样，许多学生会采用标准的重复策略来完成这项任务，试图通过死记硬背将新术语与其定义联系起来。虽然各种记忆方法都可以应用于这项任务，但如果缺乏明确的指导，很少有学生会采用精细记忆策略（Soler & Ruiz，1996）。现有研究表明，这是一种错误的做法，可以通过教师的积极干预来纠正。

Among the first requirements of introductory courses is learning new jargon. The requirements for such learning are essentially the same as those for learning foreign vocabulary: establishing a relationship between the term and its meaning. As with the acquisition of any new words, native or foreign, many students will approach this task with a standard repetition strategy, attempting to associate the new jargon with its definition through rote drill. Various mnemonic procedures could be applied to the task, but in the absence of explicit instructions to do so, few students will adopt an elaborative mnemonic strategy (Soler & Ruiz, 1996). Available research suggests that this is a mistake, and it is one that can be corrected by active intervention of instructors.

例如，关键词方法已在入门课程中取得一些成功。Carney 和 Levin (1998a) 报告了他们开发的“神经助记符”材料进行的一系列实验，以帮助学习心理学入门课程中的术语。为了测试其程序的有效性，Carney 和 Levin 将他们的神经助记符技术与死记硬背条件进行了比较。例如，其中一个术语是丘脑，其要学习的意思是“传入信息的中继站”。他们创建了两个略有不同的关键词条件，在这两个条件下，新术语都与一个语音和拼写相似的关键词相关联。在其中一个关键词条件中，实验者提供了图像；例如，丘脑的图像是“想象一场接力赛。第一名跑步者将热水瓶（丘脑）而不是接力棒交给下一名跑步者。”在另一个关键词条件下，参与者被要求生成自己的图像，将术语的含义与关键词（thermos）联系起来。对照组为重复条件。研究阶段结束后不久，参与者被要求完成一项定义匹配任务，随后进行一项多项选择题测试，要求参与者运用所学的含义。的术语。这两项测试的结果都支持助记条件，其本身的有效性并没有差别。

For example, the keyword method has been used with some success in introductory courses. Carney and Levin (1998a) reported a set of experiments on “neuromnemonic” materials that they developed to assist in learning terminology in introductory psychology. To test the effectiveness of their procedure, Carney and Levin compared their neuromnemonic technique with a rote repetition condition. As an example, one of the terms was thalamus, whose to-be-learned meaning was “relay station for incoming information.” Two slightly different keyword conditions were created, in both of which a phonetically and orthographically similar keyword was associated with the novel term. In one of the keyword conditions, the experimenters supplied the images; for example, the image for thalamus was “Imagine a relay race. The first runner hands a thermos (thalamus), instead of a baton, to the next runner.” In the other of these keyword conditions, the participants were instructed to generate their own image relating the meaning of the term to the keyword (thermos). The control comparison was a repetition condition. Shortly after the study phase, the participants were given a definition-matching task followed by a multiple-choice test that required application of the learned meaning of the terms. The results from both of these tests favored the mnemonic conditions, which themselves did not differ in effectiveness.

Carney 和 Levin (1998a) 使用关键词法迫使参与者生成和阐述待学习的材料，这与我们在第二章中关于基础记忆研究中生成和阐述的影响的讨论一致。除了关键词助记符之外，其他方法也能够促进这些过程，并且可能对使用者更有效。为了检验这种可能性，Balch (2005) 基本上复制了 Carney 和 Levin 的研究，并增加了两个研究条件。其中一个条件要求参与者在看到术语及其定义后，对该术语的定义进行释义，另一个条件要求参与者生成该术语的例子。在这两种情况下，都必须对材料进行一定程度的阐述和生成性处理才能完成学习任务。与关键词法相比，生成术语的例子在定义记忆测试和应用术语能力测试中均取得了相当的成绩。解释定义是经常向学生推荐的一种技巧，但在学习时，它并不比死记硬背好。

Carney and Levin’s (1998a) use of the keyword method forced the participants to generate and elaborate the to-be-learned material, which is consistent with our discussion in Chapter 2 of the effects of generation and elaboration in basic memory research. Methods other than keyword mnemonics are capable of encouraging these processes and perhaps are more efficient for the user.
