The player’s goal is to assemble a world-class art collection by going to 30 private art sales where the player attempts to acquire original paintings by famous artists. To buy the paintings, the player borrows money from a financier who also gives the player information about the paintings to be sold at the upcoming auction. The information is in the form of presentation of actual digitized versions of works by famous artists, which constitute the memory set for the round. After seeing the set, the player proceeds to the sale where he or she sees pictures one at a time and must decide whether to buy the picture or pass. Pictures that were not seen in the original set are, by the rules of the game, forgeries and are to be avoided. These forgeries are repeated during the course of the sale. Within this context, the avoiding-repetitions procedure described by Jennings and Jacoby is implemented. Feedback from the financier is provided following each sale, and the player can go to the “gallery” to view the collection. Financing is a part of the game in that the player occasionally may need to borrow more money from the financier but must maintain a certain balance, which is aided by sometimes selling part of the existing collection. Thus the avoiding-repetitions procedure is embedded in a play-athome video game, but the instructions and descriptions never mention that the game is a memory training tool.

Toth 等人（2005 年）报告了一项研究的数据，该研究向一组老年人提供了《艺术品经销商》的副本，并要求他们每天玩 1 到 2 个小时，直到参与者完成 30 轮游戏。未接受治疗的对照组接受了与玩家相同的训练前和训练后评估。对照组在年龄和其他重要变量上与训练组仔细匹配。所有接受训练的人员都完成了全部 30 轮游戏，这对于训练研究来说是一个令人印象深刻的依从率。训练后评估显示，训练组成员比他们自己的训练前基线和对照组的表现都有了显著的提高。在完成研究后的最后一次访谈中，所有玩家都对这次体验给出了积极的评价，并赞同玩游戏可以增强认知能力的总体想法，他们表示如果这些游戏或类似的游戏被证明可以提高认知能力，他们会在家里玩这些游戏。

Toth et al. (2005) reported data from a study in which one group of older adults was given copies of Art Dealer and asked to play the game for 1 to 2 hours per day until the participants had completed the 30 rounds of the game. A nontreatment control group was given the same pre- and posttraining assessment as the players. The control group was carefully matched to the training group on age and other important variables. All of the training individuals completed all 30 rounds of the game, which is an impressive compliance rate for training studies. The posttraining assessment showed substantial gains for the training group members over both their own pretraining baseline and the performance of the control group. In a final interview after completing the study, all of the players rated the experience as positive and favorably endorsed the general idea of playing games to enhance cognition, saying that they would play this or similar games at home if they were shown to enhance cognitive performance.

Toth 等人（2005）的研究虽然处于初步阶段，但展示了游戏化方法在健康老年人记忆训练中的应用前景。该方法相比传统的记忆训练方案具有诸多优势。电脑游戏更具吸引力，因为人们感觉自己是在玩游戏，而不是在进行康复训练。例如，在 Toth 等人的研究中，11 名参与者中有 9 名表示，他们感觉自己是在参与游戏，而不是在进行记忆测试。同样，大多数参与者表示，如果已知“艺术品经销商”之类的游戏能够增强记忆功能，他们愿意在家玩。一个重要的实际优势是，游戏式训练几乎不需要前往实验室或康复中心，而且训练计划可以由个人决定。最后，电脑游戏为老年人维持和增强记忆技能​​提供了一种颇具吸引力且相对经济的方法。我们期待看到越来越多的电脑游戏用于记忆康复。

Although preliminary in its scope, the work of Toth et al. (2005) illustrates the promise of a gaming approach to mnemonic training among healthy older people. The approach has several advantages over more traditional mnemonic training regimens. Computer games are more engaging in that people feel as if they are playing rather than working at rehabilitation. For example, 9 of the 11 players in Toth et al.’s study said they felt as if they were involved in a game not a memory test. By a similar majority, the participants said that they would play games such as Art Dealer at home if the games were known to enhance memory function. An important practical advantage is that training-by-gaming requires minimal visits to a laboratory or rehabilitation site, and the schedule of training can be determined by the individual. Finally, computer games offer an appealing and relatively inexpensive approach to maintaining and enhancing memory skills in older adults. We expect to see increasing development and deployment of computer games in service of memory rehabilitation.

□摘要

□ Summary

在本章中，我们描述了记忆康复尝试中常用的目标和方法。干预措施通常针对以下两个目标之一：将基本记忆过程恢复到损伤前的功能，或改善受损记忆过程所造成的残疾。除了伴随轻微脑损伤或正常衰老的极轻微损伤外，恢复受损记忆过程的尝试通常都未能成功。针对特定残疾的治疗已取得积极成果，在某些情况下甚至使失忆症患者能够独立生活。如此显著的成功实属罕见，但针对个体需求而设计的记忆术常常被证明能够提高患者及其护理人员的生活质量。随着我们不断前进，支持评估这些技术的研究与继续开发这些技术本身同样重要。正如我们所见，在该领域开展研究颇具挑战性，现有的工作也并非尽善尽美。如果我们想要成功地将广义上的记忆术应用于记忆障碍这一重要领域，那么对康复技术及其有效性的仔细研究必须成为当务之急。

In this chapter we have described the goals and methods commonly used in attempts to rehabilitate memory. Interventions typically target one of two goals: restoration of basic processes to preinjury functioning or amelioration of disabilities caused by the impaired processes. With the exception of very mild impairment accompanying minor brain injury or normal aging, attempts to restore impaired processes have been unsuccessful. Treatments targeting specific disabilities have yielded positive outcomes, in some cases even allowing amnesic individuals to live on their own. Success this dramatic is rare, but mnemonic techniques designed for individual needs frequently have been shown to enhance the quality of life for both patients and caregivers. As we move forward, it will be as important to support research evaluating these techniques as it is to continue the development of the techniques themselves. As we have seen, performing research in this area is challenging, and existing work is less than perfect. Careful research on rehabilitation techniques and their effectiveness must be a high priority if we are to succeed in applying mnemonics broadly conceived to the important domain of memory impairment.

9

摄氏度哈一个磷T埃R		 

那么，助记符在当代心理学中有一席之地吗？

So, Is There a Place for Mnemonics in Contemporary Psychology?

在结束对记忆术的讨论后，我们认为有必要重新审视第一章标题中提出的问题。记忆术研究在现代心理学中究竟属于什么位置？在最后一章中，我们将对探讨这个问题的著作进行概要介绍。

Here at the end of our discussion of mnemonics, we think it appropriate to revisit the question raised in the title of the first chapter. Where, if at all, does the study of mnemonics belong in modern psychology? In this final chapter, we shall provide a synopsis of the book that addresses this question.

□基础记忆科学中的记忆术

□ Mnemonics in Basic Memory Science

在心理学中，记忆术研究的明显归宿是记忆科学家群体。具有讽刺意味的是，记忆研究的某些基本前提是记忆术被广泛接受的潜在障碍。其中最主要的是，记忆理论的正确主题是记忆的自然运作。自然记忆与人工记忆技术之间的这种紧张关系并不是什么新鲜事，而且正如当代心理学所代表的那样，并不是特别难以驾驭或有原则性。另一方面，解释自然记忆的隐含目标确实不容易融入人工记忆。自艾宾浩斯时代以来，基础科学的目标一直是解释记忆的运作，而​​记忆术的唯一目的是提高记忆力。这些目标是兼容的，但它们是不同的。由于这些和其他原因，在基础记忆研究期刊上很少出现关于记忆术的研究。

The obvious home in psychology for the study of mnemonics is within the community of memory scientists. Ironically, certain basic premises of memory research are subtle obstacles for widespread acceptance of mnemonics. Chief among those is that the proper subject of memory theory is the natural operation of memory. This tension between natural memory and the artificial techniques of mnemonics is not new and, as represented in contemporary psychology, not particularly fractious or principled. On the other hand, it is true that the implicit goal of explaining natural memory does not easily incorporate artificial memory. The goal of basic science since the time of Ebbinghaus has been to explain the operation of memory, whereas the sole purpose of mnemonics is to improve memory. These goals are compatible, but they are different. For these and other reasons, very little research on mnemonics appears in the journals of basic memory research.

话虽如此，基础记忆科学与助记术之间确实存在着一种共生关系，至少在原则上如此。基础研究对助记术的贡献通常被认为是这种关系中更重要的组成部分。毕竟，精心控制的实验关于什么会影响记忆、什么不会影响记忆的最终权威。鼓励想象、组织和精细化的条件已被深入研究，并且显然都有益于记忆。这三种操作，想象、组织和精细化，是几乎所有助记技巧的基础，因此，有人可能会说，基础研究提供了助记技巧的基础。从这种观点来看，这种关系不是共生的，而是不对称的，由科学主导，而助记技巧只是科学的一种应用。然而，这种观点被这样一个历史事实所蒙蔽：想象、组织和精细化早在记忆科学出现之前就已用于助记。事实上，许多当代科学论文，尤其是关于想象的论文，都会通过引用这些操作在助记技巧中的经典用途来介绍这个主题。

That said, a symbiotic relationship does exist, at least in principle, between basic memory science and mnemonics. The contribution of basic research to mnemonics is usually perceived as the more important component of the relationship. After all, carefully controlled experiments are the final authority on what does and does not affect memory. Conditions that encourage imagery, organization, and elaboration have been studied intensively, and all clearly benefit memory. These three operations, imagery, organization, and elaboration, are the basis of virtually all mnemonic devices, and, as such, one might argue that basic research has provided the foundation of mnemonics. On that view, the relationship is not symbiotic but asymmetrical, dominated by science of which mnemonics is but an application. Such a view, however, is clouded by the historical fact that imagery, organization, and elaboration were in mnemonic use long before a science of memory existed. Indeed, many contemporary scientific papers, especially on imagery, will introduce the topic by referring to classical uses of those operations in mnemonic devices.

或许一个更好的比喻是，基础研究和助记术是两条截然不同的道路，但起点相同。这个起点是对提升记忆力的操作的直觉。助记术以直觉为基础，创造出促进记忆的手段，而基础科学则从直觉出发，分析这种益处是如何产生的。两条道路都有助于验证最初的直觉。助记术可能没有达到其目的，或者基础研究可能会发现直觉操作实际上是别的东西。在此过程中，基础记忆科学和应用记忆科学之间可能出现一种互利共生的关系。

Perhaps a better metaphor is that basic research and mnemonics are two diverging paths with the same starting point. That starting point is intuition about the operations that improve memory. Mnemonics takes the intuition as the basis for creating devices to facilitate memory, whereas basic science proceeds from the intuition to an analysis of how the benefit occurs. Both paths can contribute to validating the initial intuition. The mnemonic may not serve its purpose, or the basic research may discover that the intuitive operation is actually something else. Along the way, a symbiotic relationship can emerge for the mutual benefit of basic and applied memory science.

□记忆法

□ Mnemonology

我们建议将基础记忆研究和记忆术之间的这种接口称为记忆学，其本质上是研究促进记忆的过程。本书描述了许多这样的过程，以及验证其促进作用的基础科学。仅举一个我们之前描述的例子，基础研究已经证实组织和加工的联合操作（在此称为独特处理）比单独使用任何一种操作更能促进记忆。研究甚至表明，这种独特处理似乎表征了专家在特定领域的记忆优势（Rawson & van Overschelde，2008；van Overschelde，Rawson，Dunlosky & Hunt，2005）。目前还没有专门开发记忆术来利用这一发现，尽管现有设备的一些应用可能正在这样做。成功创建一种基于这些原理的技术将是一个强大的工具。随着基础记忆理论的进步，记忆学应该能够通过开发基于基本促进过程的技术来利用新发现。

We have suggested that this interface between basic memory research and mnemonics be called mnemonology, which is essentially the study of processes that facilitate memory. A number of these processes have been described throughout the book, along with the basic science that validates their facilitative effect. To take just one example that we described previously, basic research has established that the joint operation of organization and elaboration, herein referred to as distinctive processing, facilitates memory beyond the operation of either alone. Research even has shown that it is this distinctive processing that seems to characterize the domain-specific memory advantage of experts (Rawson & van Overschelde, 2008; van Overschelde, Rawson, Dunlosky, & Hunt, 2005). No mnemonic has been intentionally developed to capitalize on this discovery, although some applications of existing devices are probably doing just that. Successful creation of a technique based on these principles would be a powerful tool. As basic memory theory progresses, mnemonology should be in the position to capitalize on new discoveries by developing techniques grounded in the basic facilitative processes.

助记学还将通过对助记手段的研究为基础研究的目标做出贡献，这些助记手段可以提供关于某些变量产生有益影响的环境的有用科学信息。这些环境可能比基础研究通常所能容忍的更丰富、更复杂，但这些更复杂的情况可以产生激发对新现象的研究兴趣的观察结果。例如，我们回顾了 Balch (2005) 的一项研究，该研究比较了三种学习术语定义的技术。有趣的是，Balch 发现，生成每个术语的例子所产生的效果相当于关键字助记符的效果，这两者都比解释定义更好。这是一个可靠的结果吗？为什么生成术语的例子比解释定义更容易记住该定义？这些问题的答案将有助于我们理解不仅是记忆的基本过程，而且是理解的基本过程。

Mnemonology also will contribute to the goals of basic research through the study of mnemonic devices, which can yield useful scientific information about the contexts in which certain variables have beneficial effects. These contexts are likely to be richer and more complex than is normally tolerated in basic research, but these more complicated situations can yield observations that stimulate research interest in a new phenomenon. For example, we reviewed a study by Balch (2005) that compared three techniques for learning the definitions of terms. Interestingly, Balch found that generating an example of each term yielded performance equivalent to that of a keyword mnemonic, both of which were better than paraphrasing the definition. Is this a reliable result? Why should generating an example of a term lead to better memory for a definition than paraphrasing that definition? Answers to these questions would contribute to our understanding of basic processes not only in memory but also in comprehension.

记忆科学是助记术的权威验证机构，从这个意义上说，它是心理学中助记术的发源地。助记学通过识别最佳表现的自然记忆过程，并着手应用这些过程，为基础科学做出了贡献。通过明确承认两者的不同目标，助记学可以缓解基础科学与助记术之间历来存在的紧张关系，并促进科学界加大努力，将助记术发展成为基础记忆研究的一个严肃的应用分支。

Memory science is the validating authority for mnemonics, and in that sense, it is the home for mnemonics in psychology. Mnemonology contributes to the basic science by identifying natural memory processes that are optimal for performance and then proceeding to apply these processes. By explicitly recognizing the different goals of the two enterprises, mnemonology can reduce the tension that historically has existed between basic science and mnemonics and foster greater effort within the scientific community to develop mnemonics into a serious applied branch of basic memory research.

□教育中的记忆法

□ Mnemonology in Education

教育是记忆术的发源地。记忆术技巧曾作为独立课程教授，并嵌入在普通修辞学课程中。其目的是让学生掌握构建口头论证的实用工具。这些技巧的实用性并非问题所在；人们认为记忆术能够为自然记忆提供有益的支持。随着时间的推移，这种观点发生了变化，以至于现在我们所知的任何课程都不再将记忆术作为一门课程，任何特定技巧的有效性都有待研究来证明。因此，记忆学在教育期刊上最为常见也就不足为奇了。

Education was the original home of mnemonics. Mnemonic techniques were taught in stand-alone courses embedded within the general rhetoric curriculum. The intent was to equip the student with useful tools to build oral argument. The utility of these techniques was not at issue; mnemonics was assumed to provide beneficial support for natural memory. This attitude has shifted over time such that now mnemonics is not offered as a course in any curriculum of which we are aware, and the effectiveness of any given technique is a matter to be demonstrated in research. Thus, it is no surprise that mnemonology has been most evident in education journals.

在某些教育场所内进行的研究或以某些教育场所为蓝本的研究已成为助记符领域最活跃的新信息来源之一。目前有大量的研究成果，涵盖了不同年龄段、不同学科和不同技术类型。我们在第7章回顾了其中一些研究。这些文献表明，助记符对学习和记忆各种材料都非常有益，从简单的词汇习得到新习得概念的概括。

Research within or modeled on some education venue has become one of the most active sources of new information on mnemonics. A large number of studies ranging across ages, disciplines, and type of techniques are now available. We reviewed a sample of these studies in Chapter 7. That body of literature shows that mnemonics can be quite beneficial to learning and memory of diverse material ranging from simple vocabulary acquisition to generalization of newly acquired concepts.

需要更多研究关注的问题之一是记忆术对知识获取的有效性。我们在这里试图区分记忆和知识，并运用一个广为接受的假设：知识比记忆更少地受到情境的限制。换句话说，知识可以迁移到不同于习得情境的情境中；知识具有普遍性。我们在第七章中回顾的一些研究确实报告了记忆术训练在将习得材料应用于新情境方面是有效的，这开始接近我们提出的问题。欢迎更多此类研究。另一个值得关注的问题是开发不仅有效而且易于使用的记忆术。我们回顾的一些技术确实有效，但也非常复杂。这种复杂性会让教师和学生都感到沮丧。许多问题值得进一步关注，这使得该领域成为一个对教育和心理学研究人员都充满兴趣的潜在研究领域。

Among the issues that need more research attention is the effectiveness of mnemonics for the acquisition of knowledge. Here we mean to distinguish memory and knowledge, using the widely shared assumption that knowledge is less restricted by context than is memory. In other words, knowledge transfers to contexts that are different from the acquisition context; knowledge is generalizable. A few of the studies we reviewed in Chapter 7 did report that mnemonic training was effective in the application of the acquired material to new circumstances, which begins to approximate the question we are raising. Much more of this type of research would be welcome. Another matter that deserves attention concerns the development of mnemonics that are not only effective but also user-friendly. Some of the techniques that we reviewed certainly were effective but were also very complicated. That complexity will discourage both an instructor and the student. Many issues can be identified that would benefit from further attention, making this a potentially rich area of interesting questions for both educational and psychological researchers.

□康复中的记忆术

□ Mnemonics in Rehabilitation

与记忆术与教育之间的关系不同，记忆术在认知康复中的应用并无争议。事实上，治疗记忆丧失还有什么其他选择呢？迄今为止，关于这一主题的文献最好在区分恢复既往功能和补偿残疾的背景下理解。传统记忆术对这两个目标的效果因脑损伤严重程度而异。

Unlike the relationship between mnemonics and education, the use of mnemonic techniques in cognitive rehabilitation is noncontroversial. Indeed, what other choice is there for the treatment of memory loss? The literature to date on this topic is best understood in the context of a distinction between restoration of previous function and compensation for disabilities. The effect of traditional mnemonics on these two goals differs as a function of the severity of brain damage.

传统的内部记忆策略能够成功恢复非常轻微的损伤，例如健康老龄化所带来的损伤。然而，对于更严重的损伤，恢复创伤前的功能似乎是不可能的。这种失败并不奇怪。受伤或疾病对大脑造成的损害会消除记忆能力。在缺乏这种神经基础的情况下，无论多少训练都无法恢复原来的记忆功能。这就像一个人试图通过锻炼不存在的肢体来康复被截肢的肢体。然而，这个结论与内部记忆法在正常情况下的效用无关，而且它本身也有待进一步的记忆学研究来修正。

Traditional internal mnemonic strategies yielded successful restoration of memory function in very mild impairment, such as that associated with healthy aging. With more severe impairment, however, restoration of pretrauma functioning does not seem possible. This failure is not at all surprising. The damage inflicted on the brain by injury or disease eliminates the memory ability. In the absence of that neural substrate, no amount of training will restore original memory function. It is as if one were attempting to rehabilitate an amputated limb through exercise of the nonexistent limb. This conclusion, however, has no bearing on the utility of internal mnemonics under normal conditions and is itself subject to revision pending further research in mnemonology.

另一方面，文献清楚地表明，记忆技巧是用于补偿训练的有效治疗工具。一系列传统的记忆方法已被有效地用于帮助受损的记忆完成日常活动。另外两种技术也取得了令人鼓舞的成果。其中第一次尝试通过从本质上绕过习得任务的有意识的记忆要求来促进学习。这种方法是斯金纳学习理论和记忆研究基本理论融合的罕见例子；前者将这项技术称为无错学习，而后者则是内隐记忆的一个例子。习得环境的基本要素是足够的线索支持，以在没有错误的情况下唤起所需的反应。后续测试环境提供同样强大的线索支持，使得有意记忆习得对于成功的表现不是必需的。在这些条件下，严重遗忘症患者已经学会了使用有意教学技术来学习他们无法掌握的技能。这种方法的主要局限性是学习的概括范围狭窄。扩大这种概括范围是记忆学面临的重要挑战。

On the other hand, the literature clearly shows that mnemonic techniques are valuable therapeutic tools in service of compensatory training. A range of traditional mnemonic approaches has been used effectively to assist impaired memory with routine activities. Two additional techniques also have yielded promising outcomes. The first of these attempts to facilitate learning by essentially bypassing conscious memory demands of the acquisition task. This approach is a rare instance of convergence from Skinnerian learning theory and basic theory in memory research; the former labeled the technique errorless learning, and for the latter it is an example of implicit memory. The essential element of the acquisition environment is sufficient cue support to evoke the desired response in the absence of error. Subsequent test environments supply equally powerful cue support such that intentional memory of acquisition is not necessary for successful performance. Under these conditions, severely amnesic patients have been taught skills that were beyond their grasp using intentional instructional techniques. The major limitation of this approach is the narrow scope of generalization of the learning. Expanding that range of generality is an important challenge for mnemonology.

第二种成功弥补严重脑损伤相关残疾的方法是使用外部记忆支持。这些技术的技术复杂程度各不相同，从简单的记笔记到复杂的计算机控制干预。作为一类，外部记忆在治疗残疾方面具有一些积极的特点。其中最主要的是大多数外部设备易于个性化。每个人对记忆的具体需求差异很大，易于定制对治疗来说是一个优势。研究表明，记忆簿、个人记事本和录音机等低技术设备具有积极的效果，但这些低技术记忆方法的一个重要缺点是必须记住使用它们。因此，个人记事本对于没有记忆障碍的人来说可能是不可或缺的工具，而对于严重记忆障碍的人来说，它的用处有限。随着这些设备变得越来越复杂，它们的设计旨在克服忘记使用它们的障碍。这项技术令人兴奋。它真正意义上的人工记忆，因为它不仅提供需要记住的内容，还提供获取这些内容的线索。工程师、计算机科学家和心理学家的进一步合作将使这些应用更加复杂，并为数百万遭受严重脑损伤的人提供更有希望的康复过程。

A second approach that successfully compensates for disability associated with severe brain damage is the use of external mnemonic support. These techniques range in technological sophistication from simply keeping notes to elaborate computer-controlled interventions. As a class, external mnemonics have several positive features in application to remedying disabilities. Chief among those is that most external devices are easily personalized. The particular memory demands vary widely across people, and ease of customization is a benefit for therapy. Research has shown positive results from low-technology devices such as memory books, personal organizers, and tape recorders, but one important drawback to these low-tech mnemonics is that one must remember to use them. Thus a personal organizer may be an indispensable tool for a nonimpaired person, whereas it is of limited use for a severely memory-impaired person. As the devices become more sophisticated, they are designed to overcome the disability of failing to remember to use them. This technology is exciting. It truly is artificial memory in that it supplies not only the to-be-remembered content but also the cue to access that content. Further collaboration of engineers, computer scientists, and psychologists will lead to more sophistication in these applications and a more promising course of rehabilitation for the millions of people suffering severe brain damage.

□自然记忆的局限性

□ Limitations on Natural Memory

很少有人对自己的记忆力感到满意。抱怨遗忘的案例远多于成功记忆的案例。这些想法和抱怨与我们行为所提供的证据形成了鲜明的对比。我们大部分的能力都是后天习得的，而成功执行习得行为正是记忆的功能。记忆是将过去的经验带入现在的过程。这是一个有利而高效的过程，它赋予物种识别经验情境并做出适当反应的能力。在这方面，记忆可以说是强大而精准的。健康的人很少会忘记他们学到的东西，例如走路、语言运用、驾驶、礼仪、喜欢的食物，以及他们昨天甚至前天做过的事情。这些事情的功能性清单无穷无尽。如果像记忆这样对生存至关重要的东西，真的像人们想象的那样变化无常，那真是大自然的残酷玩笑。那么，为什么记忆看起来如此难以掌握呢？

Very few people seem to be impressed with their memory abilities. Complaints about forgetting far outnumber success stories of memory prowess. Such beliefs and complaints are an ironic contrast to the evidence provided by our behavior. The bulk of our repertoire is learned, and successful performance of learned behavior is the function of memory. Memory is the process that brings past experience into the present. It is an advantageous and efficient process that confers on the species the ability to recognize experienced situations and respond to them appropriately. In this role, memory can be seen as powerful and precise. Healthy people rarely forget the things they learned such as walking, the use of language, driving, etiquette, favorite foods, and what they did yesterday and maybe even the day before. The list is functionally infinite. It would be a cruel trick of nature if something as important to survival as memory were as fickle as people seem to assume. So why does memory seem to be so difficult?

这个问题的答案在于，自然记忆过程被人为地挪用。鉴于记忆的功能是将过去的经验用于当前，记忆的基本要求是能够识别先前的经验，即在当前情境下做出适当的反应。这种原始记忆是我们现在所说的条件反射或程序记忆的组成部分。有意识地重现先前的经验对这一功能并非必要。正如巴特利特 (1932) 所指出的：“在一个环境不断变化的世界里，文字记忆极其不重要”（第 204 页）。保留高度详细的信息并非对记忆的生物发育施加的选择压力。记住诸如葛底斯堡演说、银行账户的 8 位密码、今天的购物清单或罗马帝国衰落的 15 个原因之类的事情并非自然而然。记住这些细节与自然记忆的兼容性，就像飞行与人类手臂的兼容性一样。尽管如此，对这些材料的记忆很可能是我们评估自己能力的标准，至少部分是因为随着技术的进步，对详细信息的需求似乎也在增加。

The answer to this question has its roots in the co-opting of the natural memory process for artificial purposes. Given that memory functions to make past experience available for current use, the basic requirement of memory is the ability to recognize previous experiences in the sense that an appropriate response is delivered in the current setting. This primitive memory is a component of what we now call conditioning or procedural memory. Conscious reproduction of prior experience is not necessary to this function. As Bartlett (1932) noted, “In a world of constantly changing environment, literal recall is extraordinarily unimportant” (p. 204). Retention of highly detailed information was not a selective pressure on the biological development of memory. Memory for such things as the Gettysburg Address, the 8-symbol password for your banking account, today’s grocery list, or the 15 reasons the Roman Empire failed does not come naturally. Memorization of such detail is no more compatible with natural memory than is flying for human arms. Nonetheless, memory for such material is likely the standard against which we assess our ability, at least in part because the demands for detailed information seem to escalate with every advance in technology.

□助记符的价值

□ The Value of Mnemonics

记忆术提供了一种应对日常记忆需求的方法。外部记忆术的广泛使用，对大多数人来说都是显而易见的。然而，我们的目的是重新激发人们对内部记忆术的兴趣和欣赏。本书的部分目标是证明，记忆术并非仅限于正式的记忆系统。相反，记忆术的领域涵盖了所有通过基础研究已知的、有助于提高记忆表现的记忆原理。只要了解一些记忆的真正运作方式，我们每个人都可以利用记忆术提供的强大补充。

Mnemonics provides one way of coping with the day-to-day demands on memory. This fact is obvious to most people as witnessed by the widespread use of external mnemonics. Our purpose, however, is to rejuvenate an interest in and an appreciation for internal mnemonics. Part of our goal in the book has been to demonstrate that mnemonics is not exhausted by formal mnemonic systems. Rather, the domain of mnemonics extends to all memory principles known through basic research to benefit performance. With some knowledge of how memory really works, each of us can take advantage of the powerful supplement offered by mnemonic techniques.

无论具体情况如何，自创助记符都能根据个人的需求和能力进行定制。只需掌握一些基本原则，再加上一点创造力，任何人都可以构建出其效力不亚于正式系统。例如，记忆的一个基本原理是，我们无法记住自己没有注意到的事情。尽管这条原则显而易见，但我们经常违背它，事后还抱怨自己记忆力差。当你初次被介绍给某人时，如果你脑子里想的不是名字，而这种情况经常发生，那么即使在短时间内记住对方名字的机会也会降低。一个简单的记忆策略是在回应介绍时刻意提及对方的名字，并在随后的对话中继续这样做。

Regardless of the context, self-generation of mnemonics tailors the device to the individual’s need and ability. With a small set of basic principles and a bit of creativity, anyone can construct mnemonics that are as powerful as the formal systems. For example, a basic fact of memory is that we cannot remember that to which we did not attend. As obvious as this principle is, we often violate it and later complain about our poor memory faculties. When you are introduced to someone for the first time, your chance of remembering that person’s name even in the short term goes down if you are thinking about something other than the name, which happens frequently. A simple mnemonic strategy is to intentionally use the person’s name when responding to the introduction and to continue to do so if there is ensuing conversation.

更复杂的助记符的开发应该考虑各种情境因素。我们在第二章中描述了其中的一些因素。这些因素都不是特别复杂，但它们确实需要了解未来的测试环境。例如，我会被要求识别或回忆这些信息吗？我会被要求提供上下文的细节，还是会被要求提供与上下文无关的一般信息？在可以预测这些问题答案的范围内，助记符应该根据测试环境进行定制。

The development of more complex mnemonics should take various situational factors into account. We described a number of these in Chapter 2. None of these factors are particularly complicated, but they do require knowledge of the future testing environment. For example, will I be asked to recognize or recall the information? Will I be asked for details of the context, or will I be asked for general information independent of the context? To the extent that the answers to such questions can be anticipated, the mnemonic should be tailored to that testing environment.

培养个人记忆术的另一个重要信息是了解记忆的基本原理。其中一些原理是根据我们的记忆经验直观获得的。例如，大多数人都知道意象有助于记忆。其他原理不太明显，但一旦掌握就很容易理解。我们在第 3 章中描述了其中一些基本原理。我们相信，有动力并掌握这些基本必要信息的人可以通过记忆术来提高记忆力。我们希望本书的努力不仅能振兴记忆学，还能鼓励人们使用记忆术并帮助他们做到这一点。

Another important piece of information for developing your personal mnemonic is knowledge of basic principles of memory. Some of these principles are intuitive based on our experiences with memory. For example, most people know that imagery facilitates memory. Other principles are less obvious but are easily understood once accessed. We described some of these basic principles in Chapter 3. It is our belief that people who are motivated and in possession of this minimal requisite information can facilitate their memory performance with mnemonics. We hope that our efforts in this book not only invigorate mnemonology but also encourage individuals to use mnemonics and help them do so.



 

笔记

NOTES

  1. 桑代克在哈佛大学与詹姆斯一起攻读研究生，之后转学到哥伦比亚大学，并在卡特尔的指导下完成了学位（Boring，1950 年）。
  2. Thorndike studied with James as a graduate student at Harvard prior to transferring to Columbia where he completed his degree with Cattell (Boring, 1950).
  3. 有关识别过程的不同观点请参见 Tulving (1983)。
  4. See Tulving (1983) for a differing view of the recognition process.
  5. 正如稍后将要讨论的，从这里的理论角度来看，存储的概念并不是必需的。
  6. As will be discussed later, the concept of storage is not necessary from the theoretical perspective taken here.
  7. 另请参阅 1990 年的同名电影。
  8. See also the 1990 film of the same name.
